"Je ne prendrai pas la dÃ©cision de dÃ©fÃ©rer cette loi devant le Conseil constitutionnel (...) La qualitÃ© du travail a permis d'aboutir Ã  une texte pleinement satisfaisant", a-t-il estimÃ© en rendant hommage au travail parlementaire.

Au centre de ce texte controversÃ©: le renforcement des pouvoirs de l'autoritÃ© administrative (prÃ©fets, ministre de l'IntÃ©rieur) pour assigner quelqu'un (non plus Ã  rÃ©sidence, mais dans un pÃ©rimÃ¨tre au minimum Ã©gal Ã  la commune), rÃ©aliser des perquisitions, fermer un lieu de culte ou faire des contrÃ´les d'identitÃ© prÃ¨s des frontiÃ¨res. Le tout sans feu vert judiciaire, perquisitions exceptÃ©es.

Nouveau projet contre la radicalisation

L'ex-Premier ministre socialiste Bernard Cazeneuve avait suggÃ©rÃ© qu'Emmanuel Macron soumette au Conseil constitutionnel cette loi antiterroriste, qui suscite des craintes d'atteintes aux libertÃ©s, pour "apaiser ce dÃ©bat", dans un entretien paru dans Le Monde datÃ© de dimanche-lundi.

Par ailleurs, Emmanuel Macron a Ã©galement indiquÃ© que "13 attentats ont Ã©tÃ© dÃ©jouÃ©s depuis le dÃ©but de l'annÃ©e" en France. En dÃ©cembre, un comitÃ© interministÃ©riel devra "arrÃªter un nouveau plan national" contre la radicalisation, en dressant une "liste des territoires" qui feront l'objet d'une surveillance spÃ©cifique." Il a Ã©galement prÃ´nÃ© une initiative "au niveau europÃ©en.

"Durcir la rÃ©ponse" aux menaces visant policiers et gendarmes

Un peu plus tard, le prÃ©sident de la RÃ©publique a affirmÃ© qu'il souhaitait "durcir" la rÃ©ponse aux menaces "lÃ¢ches et intolÃ©rables" visant les policiers et les gendarmes.

"Aux menaces et mises en cause physiques, sont venues rÃ©cemment s'ajouter des mises en cause indirectes" de leurs proches, a dÃ©plorÃ© le prÃ©sident de la RÃ©publique. "Je souhaite que nous puissions aller plus loin" que le droit Ã  l'anonymat inscrit dans la loi, "pour durcir nos outils de rÃ©ponse face Ã  ces comportements lÃ¢ches et intolÃ©rables", a-t-il ajoutÃ© en prÃ©cisant que "1870 agents et militaires seront recrutÃ©s dÃ¨s 2018". En contrepartie, il attend "beaucoup" des forces de l'ordre "en terme d'exemplaritÃ©."

Emmanuel Macron a Ã©galement profitÃ© de ce discours pour clarifier ses positions sur la crise migratoire et l'accueil des rÃ©fugiÃ©s en France. Il souhaite notamment que "nous reconduisions de maniÃ¨re intraitable" les Ã©trangers n'ayant "pas de titre" de sÃ©jour, tout en accueillant "de maniÃ¨re exigeante et conforme Ã  nos valeurs" les rÃ©fugiÃ©s et personnes en rÃ¨gle.

"Nous accueillons mal, nous avons des procÃ©dures trop longues, nous intÃ©grons approximativement et nous ne reconduisions plus", a affirmÃ© le chef de l'Etat tout en reprenant la formule de l'ancien Premier ministre Michel Rocard pour qui "tout en prenant notre part, nous ne pouvons pas accueillir toute la misÃ¨re du monde".
TITLE: "13 attentats ont Ã©tÃ© dÃ©jouÃ©s" en France depuis janvier 2017 annonce Macron

SUMMARY:
A post shared by Brittany May (@brittanyjlmay) on May 16, 2017 at 8:16am PDTIn the wake of a broken heart from an emotionally abusive relationship, Winnipegger Brittany May went into a tailspin.
But it's bigger than she hoped for, and it's fierce: Fierce Females Project.
A post shared by Brittany May (@brittanyjlmay) on Aug 25, 2016 at 11:24am PDTIt's a place to find mentors, peers, and professionals.
"I started looking to other women for inspiration and Fierce Females presented me with the opportunity to learn from and meet incredible women from all over the world.
But May finds common threads amongst all Fierce Females: Perseverance, confidence, and bravery in the face of disbelievers.
TEXT:
Have you ever felt like you're the only one who feels trapped in a relationship, or alone out of a relationship, or helpless in finding your life's direction?

It's not easy to share your personal experiences if you see them as failures. So often we keep them trapped inside. They sit there. They gnaw at you. They make you feel alone. But imagine if by sharing them, they could inspire you.

Imagine if by sharing them, they could inspire others.

A post shared by Brittany May (@brittanyjlmay) on May 16, 2017 at 8:16am PDT

In the wake of a broken heart from an emotionally abusive relationship, Winnipegger Brittany May went into a tailspin. After four years with her boyfriend â€” whom she always thought she needed â€” he broke up with her. It made her believe she wasn't good enough for someone else. And now alone, she felt lost.

Instead of dealing with her inner monster that told her she wasn't good enough, she created a monster. She still doesn't know what it is. But it's bigger than she hoped for, and it's fierce: Fierce Females Project.

A post shared by Brittany May (@brittanyjlmay) on Aug 25, 2016 at 11:24am PDT

It's a place to find mentors, peers, and professionals. And a place to see how women of today have been influenced by women of yesterday and how they can help women of tomorrow, whether through sharing stories, ideas, projects, successes, or failures.

"I started looking to other women for inspiration and Fierce Females presented me with the opportunity to learn from and meet incredible women from all over the world. It also became an emotional safe space for my heart and my mind, a way to keep busy. It was built out of pain. As the late Carrie Fisher said, 'take your broken heart, make it into art,'" May tells HuffPost Canada.

Because of feminism's stigma, she avoided it 'like the plague,' until she embraced it like a lifesaver.

As Women's History Month celebrates the contributions of influential and inspiring women to Canada's rich history, Fierce Females is an ongoing project that celebrates and connects the past with the present and the present with the future.

The 27-year-old says it took her 24 years to discover feminism. Because of its stigma, she avoided it "like the plague," until she embraced it like a lifesaver. In the wake of her struggle, she realized how women's shared struggles unite us.

A post shared by Brittany May (@brittanyjlmay) on Oct 29, 2016 at 10:01am PDT

"Feminism has evolved from only fighting for women to fighting for all things that affect ALL women. All women encounter the sexism part, but only some women encounter racism, homophobia, xenophobia, etc., and that's something that needs to be recognized."

So May isn't necessarily just teaching feminism with her project; she's learning from it. That's why she highlights women that society doesn't â€” or hasn't â€” always talked about. It's easy to overlook their stories, but once you read them, you can't dismiss their impact.

These women's personal stories are akin to an exercise in self-awareness and self-reflection.

From a Swedish band of sisters, to an American makeup artist on BuzzFeed, to broadcasters to business owners to human rights advocates and beyond, "unconventional" women from around the globe join the project by connecting with May, or by a referral from a participant.

Each woman answers a set list of questions, which leads to sharing personal stories, which are akin to an exercise in self-awareness and self-reflection.

Not only for the woman featured, but for its audience too.

One of those women is Canadian-born activist Amirah Sequeira.

May says, "Her heart is one of the biggest I know. Since I can remember she has helped raise awareness and money for AIDS research. She has dedicated her life to human rights."

Honored to introduce Stephen Lewis at #GSS2015. Inspired&grateful 4 his sustained rage, unapolagetic politics. @AIDS_Free_World #EndAIDS â€” Amirah Sequeira (@miraseq) May 22, 2015

And May says the project has taught her she's not alone.

"Every single one of these 50-plus women have struggled and endured. It's what makes us who we are and instead of letting the struggle ruin us, we let it drive us."

But May finds common threads amongst all Fierce Females: Perseverance, confidence, and bravery in the face of disbelievers. "Not to mention badassery, if I'm even allowed to say that."

(You badyourass you can.)

A post shared by Brittany May (@brittanyjlmay) on Sep 21, 2016 at 12:36pm PDT

May's project was borne out of the ashes of failure and has given birth to a successful, growing network of females.

So, it may take a village to raise a child, but it took a failure and vulnerability for May to create a community to elevate women.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: How Brittany May Stopped Hating Feminism And Started Learning From It

TEXT:
Four Britons have been kidnapped in Nigeria, state police have confirmed.

Officers in the countryâ€™s southern Delta state are attempting to rescue the missionaries who were taken by unidentified gunmen on October 13, police spokesman Andrew Aniamaka told Reuters.

The Brits are believed to be in the country providing â€œfree medical servicesâ€.

STEFAN HEUNIS via Getty Images The Brits were kidnapped in the Niger Delta region of Nigeria

Aniamaka said: â€œThe abductors have not made any contact but we are doing our investigations to know the motive and have them rescued without jeopardising their lives.

â€œInformation available to us shows they are missionaries giving free medical services,â€ he said, adding that the British nationals had been working in a very rural area.

Community chief Theo Fakama, from the local Enukorowa community of Delta state, told Sky News that residents were â€œsaddenedâ€ by the disappearance of the group, who had â€œbrought succourâ€ to the community for three years.

According to AFP, it is believed that two of the people who have been abducted are a couple.

Kidnapping for ransom has long been a common problem in parts of Nigeria.

A number of foreigners have, in the last few years, been kidnapped in the Niger Delta region, which holds most of the countryâ€™s crude oil - the countryâ€™s economic mainstay.
TITLE: Four Britons Kidnapped By Gunmen In Nigeria, State Police Report

Die Verhandlungen zwischen der BrÃ¼ssel und London Ã¼ber den EU-Aussteig GroÃŸbritanniens kommen nur schleppend voran

Nun warnt die OECD vor den Folgen des Brexits - insbesondere falls dieser nicht aufgefangen werde

Aus Sicht der Wirtschaftsexperten gibt es nur eine LÃ¶sung: Der Verbleib der Briten in der EU

Die Briten spÃ¼ren schon jetzt die Folgen ihrer Entscheidung aus der EU auszutreten: Ob Obst und GemÃ¼se, Milchprodukte oder MÃ¶bel - alles ist teurer geworden.

Das das nicht nur vorÃ¼bergehende Symptome sind, verdeutlicht nun eine Studie der Organisation fÃ¼r wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung (OECD). Wirtschaftsexperten aus den wohlhabendsten Industrienationen kommen in dem Papier zum Schluss: Die britische Wirtschaft wÃ¼rde einen "signifikanten" Boost bekommen, wenn der Brexit in einem zweiten Referendum rÃ¼ckgÃ¤ngig gemacht werden wÃ¼rde.

Die OECD warnt obendrein: SchlieÃŸt GroÃŸbritannien bis zu seinem Austritt im MÃ¤rz 2019 keinen Handelsvertrag mit der EU ab - wonach es derzeit eher aussieht - dann wird das Land hart getroffen.

OECD-GeneralsekretÃ¤r JosÃ© Ãngel GurrÃ­a ging sogar soweit, die SchÃ¤den des Brexits mit denen der Luftschlacht der Deutschen gegen London im Zweiten Weltkrieg zu vergleichen.

Denn derzeit sagt die Organisation fÃ¼r die britische Wirtschaft nur eine Wachstum von einem Prozent fÃ¼r das kommende Jahr voraus. Die Vorhersage wÃ¼rde sich mit einem "ungeordneten Brexit" und ohne Deal mit der EuropÃ¤ischen Union noch verschlimmern.

Zweites Referendum gefordert

Die internationale Organisation betont, dass die Einwanderung zu einem groÃŸen Boom auf GroÃŸbritanniens Arbeitsmarkt gesorgt habe. Zugleich warnen die Experten vor einem vorschnellen Abbruch der Austrittsverhandlungen mit der EU. Bei dem Fall wÃ¼rden die Preise emporschnellen, der Pfund weiter fallen und Investitionen austrocknen.

Um ein solches Szenario zu verhindern, empfiehlt die OECD ein neues Referendum - oder ein Wechsel der Mehrheiten in der Regierung von Theresa May.

Falls GroÃŸbritannien tatsÃ¤chlich in der EU bleiben wÃ¼rde, hÃ¤tte das mittelfristig "positive" Auswirkungen auf das dortige Wirtschaftswachstum.

Verhaltene Angst vor dem "No Deal"-Brexit

London hat die VorschlÃ¤ge schnell zur Seite gewischt. Die Idee einer Wiederholung des EU-Referendums stehe "absolut" nicht zur Debatte, erklÃ¤rte ein Sprecher von Premierministerin May.

Ein Regierungssprecher ergÃ¤nzte: "Es wird kein zweites Referendum geben. Wir arbeiten daran, britische ArbeitsplÃ¤tze und die Wirtschaft zu schÃ¼tzen." Auch Mays Finanzminister Kanzler Philip Hammond betonte, "fÃ¼r die Regierung ist klar, dass wir die EuropÃ¤ische Union verlassen". Allerdings warnte er ebenfalls verhalten vor einem "No Deal"-Brexit.

"Wir wissen, dass wir mit einer begrenzten Ãœbergangszeit - die einen abrupten EU-Ausstieg vermeidet - Unternehmen mehr Sicherheit bieten kÃ¶nnen. Diese Sicherheit wird Investition zugute kommen, die wiederum die ProduktivitÃ¤tsgewinne der Zukunft vorantreiben werden", erklÃ¤rte Hammond.

"Keep Calm And Carry On"

Im Falle eines harten Brexits wÃ¼rde GroÃŸbritannien im Handel auf die Konditionen der Welthandelsorganisation zurÃ¼ckfallen. Aus Sicht der OECD wÃ¼rde das zahlreiche Jobs und das Wirtschaftswachstum des Landes gefÃ¤hrden.

OECD-GeneralsekretÃ¤r GurrÃ­a hatte den Bericht zusammen mit Hammond am Dienstag in London vorgestellt. Dabei betonte GurrÃ­a, "eine mÃ¶glichst enge Beziehungen zwischen der EU und GroÃŸbritannien" wird in der Zukunft "entscheidend sein".

Seine Organisation wÃ¼nsche sich einen EU-Ausstieg "so nahtlos und sanft wie mÃ¶glich". Zudem unterstrich GurrÃ­a die Vorteile, die GroÃŸbritannien aufgrund der engen Handelsbeziehungen mit der EU und der Einwanderung von EU-BÃ¼rgern genieÃŸe.

Im Zuge dessen legte er den Briten auch die Kriegsphase "Keep Calm And Carry On" nahe - um anzumerken, dass Winston Churchills Reaktion auf den Luftkrieg der Nazis ein Model fÃ¼r heute wÃ¤re.

Nachgefragt, ob May diesen Vergleich fÃ¼r angebracht hÃ¤lt, antwortete ihr Sprecher nur kurz: "Nein."

Der Text erschien zuerst in der HuffPost UK und wurde von Marco Fieber Ã¼bersetzt und bearbeitet.



(lp)
TITLE: Eine Studie der OECD zeigt, wie hart der Brexit GroÃŸbritannien treffen wird - die Forscher sehen nur einen Ausweg

TEXT:
It's been a rough few weeks for Tom Tilley. Triple J's Hack presenter came under fire for interviewing white nationalists on his show, then he became a meme for the far-right.

Then, in early October Tilley had to pull out of his Hack hosting duties after he was involved in a motocross crash. In a video he shared to his Facebook, Tilley explained he flipped his bike mid-air resulting in several injuries including a broken thumb and foot.

On Tuesday, Tilley posted a lengthy message on his Facebook detailing his experience of recovery and how it affected his mental health.

Describing "The moment that really cut through?" Tilley wrote, "It took me by surprise. It was the simple act of asking my little brother for help".

"I completely lost it, over the phone, weeping. I hung up, then wept again."

"I'm now trying to understand why that hit me so hard. Can it be harder to reach out to those that are closest? Is it a male thing?"

Tilley went on to describe how often he had heard of men struggling to ask help, describing the masculine sense of pride as a "delicate flower". But he also used the experience to reflect on his personal fortunes.

"This relatively painful experience resulted from recreation. Not as a result of harassment, violence or the systematic discrimination that disrupts and destroys the daily lives of so many other people. It also reminds me how lucky we are to have a strong and relatively equitable health care system."

Comments on the post have been full of support, with Tilley's followers sharing their own experiences of feeling vulnerable when it comes to asking for help.

"I'm 40 next year and I still find it hard to ask for help," one commenter wrote, "learn well from the lessons presented to you, and most of all remember you aren't alone in dark times".

You can read Tilley's full post on his Facebook page which, just to be clear, he didn't "bash out on a codeine binge lol".
TITLE: Tom Tilley Recovers From Motocross Crash With Heartfelt Message About His Mental Health

A su vez, se establece la obligaciÃ³n de los partidos para presentar sus informes de campaÃ±a cada 30 dÃ­as.
TEXT:
Desde 1977, en MÃ©xico, ha habido diversas reformas electorales con Ã©nfasis en crear un modelo robusto de financiamiento y fiscalizaciÃ³n de partidos polÃ­ticos. Lo que ha cambiado a lo largo del tiempo, hasta 2014 --cuando se hizo la Ãºltima reforma-- han sido las fÃ³rmulas de asignaciÃ³n de recursos, las restricciones de obtenciÃ³n de financiamiento privado y los Ã³rganos encargados de la fiscalizaciÃ³n de recursos.

El tipo de financiamiento a partidos que opera es mixto y, hasta ahora, el financiamiento pÃºblico es preponderante sobre el privado, debido, a entre otras cosas, a la reforma electoral de 2007, pero desde 2015 se han presentado diversas iniciativas para reducir el financiamiento pÃºblico a los partidos en MÃ©xico.

Los argumentos son diversos: el voto en nuestro paÃ­s es proporcionalmente mÃ¡s costoso que en otros lugares del mundo; el financiamiento pÃºblico obstaculiza la relaciÃ³n de los partidos polÃ­ticos con los ciudadanos; el financiamiento pÃºblico ha creado incentivos no deseados que motivan a la creaciÃ³n de partidos que agrupen ciudadanos que quieran recibir presupuesto pÃºblico; el voto nulo o en blanco no tiene consecuencias y no castiga a los partidos, y el gasto local electoral ha aumentado.

Las propuestas de reducciÃ³n del financiamiento pÃºblico a partidos polÃ­ticos buscan la eliminaciÃ³n del financiamiento pÃºblico, ya sea permitiendo cualquier donaciÃ³n o solo donaciones de militantes; reducir el porcentaje que se calcula de actividades ordinarias segÃºn la Unidad de medida y actualizaciÃ³n (UMA); vincular el cÃ¡lculo del porcentaje para actividades ordinarias a la votaciÃ³n valida emitida en lugar de la lista nominal y unificar el gasto en partidos a nivel local con el federal.

Sin embargo, la eliminaciÃ³n del financiamiento pÃºblico para partidos polÃ­ticos no es recomendado por organismos internacionales y otros cuerpos polÃ­ticos como la UniÃ³n Europea.

La razÃ³n principal detrÃ¡s de la existencia de fondos pÃºblicos para los partidos es evitar la influencia de agentes privados en decisiones legislativas o de gobierno, seÃ±ala un estudio del Instituto Belisario DomÃ­nguez (IBD).

En particular, en otros paÃ­ses se ha documentado ciertas relaciones de dependencia de candidatos hacia organizaciones privadas en la bÃºsqueda de fondos para realizar sus campaÃ±as.

El caso Odebrecht de supuestos sobornos a encargados de coordinar campaÃ±as electorales en MÃ©xico y otros paÃ­ses de AmÃ©rica Latina es un ejemplo de ello, seÃ±ala el documento, al tiempo que enfatiza en aumentar las donaciones pequeÃ±as de militantes de los partidos junto con mecanismos para incentivarlas como incentivos fiscales.

El anÃ¡lisis del IBD tambiÃ©n destaca la iniciativa #SinVotoNoHayDinero, la cual busca "cambiar la conducta de los partidos polÃ­ticos e, hipotÃ©ticamente, hacer que respondan a manifestaciones de rechazo del electorado", sin embargo seÃ±ala que no hay evidencia suficiente sobre si estas fÃ³rmulas de cÃ¡lculo del financiamiento cambien el comportamiento de los partidos polÃ­ticos.

Estos mecanismos, por su diseÃ±o, tienden para fortalecer a los partidos con mayor representaciÃ³n y, por lo tanto, a desfavorecer a los partidos emergentes, porque la fÃ³rmula de distribuciÃ³n incentiva la desigualdad, dado que, obedece a la proporciÃ³n de la votaciÃ³n. Estas propuestas contrastan con aquellas que buscan que el financiamiento para actividades ordinarias se reparta 50% de manera equitativa entre partidos en lugar de 30% como ahora funciona. Sin embargo, la sola presencia de financiamiento pÃºblico incentiva a la formaciÃ³n de nuevos partidos." IBD.

EVITAR LA TENTACIÃ“N

Para la fundaciÃ³n IDEA, los recientes actos de corrupciÃ³n en AmÃ©rica Latina se deben a la falta de fiscalizaciÃ³n y a los incentivos que tienen los partidos para recaudar fondos de manera ilegal para financiar publicidad en medios de comunicaciÃ³n y movilizar ciudadanos para obtener mayor votaciÃ³n.

La fundaciÃ³n recomienda reducir las grandes donaciones y permitir sÃ³lo las pequeÃ±as.

Por su parte, el Consejo de Europa revelÃ³ que es necesario reducir la dependencia de los partidos a las "grandes donaciones" y el finamiento por medio de contribuciones de los militantes.

"Enfatiza la necesidad de revisar y regular las actividades de los partidos mediante las fundaciones o centros de pensamiento que tengan a su disposiciÃ³n, los recursos que reciben de sus grupos parlamentarios y de la capacidad que estos partidos puedan contratar deuda con bancos", seÃ±ala el estudio.

La OrganizaciÃ³n para la CooperaciÃ³n y el Desarrollo EconÃ³mico (OCDE) enfatiza en el problema de conflictos de interÃ©s entre los donadores privados a campaÃ±as, cabilderos y legisladores electos, y, aunque reconoce que el financiamiento pÃºblico equitativo puede fragmentar mÃ¡s el sistema de partidos, enfatiza que pueden revisarse las reglas de otorgamiento de recursos proporcional a la votaciÃ³n emitida.

Por su parte, el Centro de Estudios Espinosa Yglesias e Integralia Consultores propone eliminar la publicidad oficial no indispensable para asignarla a tiempos oficiales de partidos polÃ­ticos a nivel local; fiscalizar el gasto pÃºblico que pueda ser desviado a campaÃ±as electorales; estimular donaciones privadas transparentes; fiscalizar el gasto electoral que no deviene de los recursos otorgados a partidos; evitar las estrategias contables que distribuyen el gasto entre candidaturas para que se contabilice por partido o coaliciÃ³n y hacer mÃ¡s equitativo el gasto al asignar 50% del presupuesto para actividades ordinarias de manera equitativa entre partidos.

LA RUTA DE LA FISCALIZACIÃ“N

El tipo de financiamiento a partidos que se tiene en nuestro paÃ­s es mixto y, hasta ahora, el financiamiento pÃºblico es preponderante sobre el privado, debido, a entre otras cosas, a la a reforma electoral de 2007, con la que el entonces INE buscÃ³ garantizar que se cumpliera con las restricciones de contribuciones privadas a partidos en tiempos de campaÃ±a por medio de la creaciÃ³n de comisiones de fiscalizaciÃ³n.

"En particular, las experiencias de uso de dinero privado en los casos Pemexgate, Amigos de Fox y en 2012 el caso Monex, ayudaron a construir el nuevo andamiaje de fiscalizaciÃ³n que se aprobÃ³ en la reforma polÃ­tico electoral de 2014", seÃ±ala el documento del IBD.

Tras el Pemexgate y Amigos de Fox se hizo obligatorio para los partidos polÃ­ticos permitir al Instituto acceder a sus cuentas siempre y cuando se fundara y solicitara dicha solicitud.

AdemÃ¡s, se exigiÃ³ a los partidos reportar los ingresos y egresos concernientes a las precampaÃ±as presidenciales a travÃ©s de informes especiales; y, respecto a la campaÃ±a, se hizo obligatorio que los partidos presentaran una serie de informes especiales en tres momentos distintos.

Asimismo, el IFE realizÃ³ un monitoreo de medios electrÃ³nicos de comunicaciÃ³n para identificar los promocionales adquiridos por los partidos.

Se crearon ademÃ¡s la Ley General de Partidos PolÃ­ticos, (LGPP); la Ley General de Instituciones y Procedimientos Electorales (LGIPE) y la Ley General en Materia de Delitos Electorales (LGMDE), las cuales sustituyeron al Cofipe.

Asimismo, el IFE fue sustituido por el Instituto Nacional Electoral (INE), al cual se le dieron nuevas atribuciones a nivel local, como la fiscalizaciÃ³n de ingresos y egresos de los partidos polÃ­ticos, sus coaliciones, las agrupaciones polÃ­ticas nacionales y de los candidatos a cargos de elecciÃ³n popular federal y local.

Para que el INE realice una fiscalizaciÃ³n minuciosa, la nueva regulaciÃ³n contempla la implementaciÃ³n de un sistema informÃ¡tico para contabilidad en lÃ­nea y un padrÃ³n de proveedores para controlar el gasto erogado por los partidos.

AdemÃ¡s, los plazos para la presentaciÃ³n de informes de precampaÃ±a se hicieron mÃ¡s cortos, de 30 dÃ­as pasaron a 15, eliminÃ¡ndose los informes preliminares de campaÃ±a. A su vez, se establece la obligaciÃ³n de los partidos para presentar sus informes de campaÃ±a cada 30 dÃ­as.

Otro cambio importante es el reconocimiento, a nivel constitucional, de la nulidad de las elecciones a causa del rebase del tope de gastos de campaÃ±a, de recibir dinero de una fuente ilÃ­cita o de usar recursos pÃºblicos en las campaÃ±as, y se consideran determinantes cuando la diferencia entre la votaciÃ³n obtenida entre el primero y el segundo lugar sea menor al 5% en el caso de rebase de topes de campaÃ±a.

SUMMARY:
Amarinder Singh waves during a road show in favour of Congress candidate for Gurdaspur Lok Sabha bypoll Sunil Jakhar on October 9, 2017 in Gurdaspur, India.
ADVERTISEMENTMaintaining its winning streak from the assembly elections, Punjab's ruling Congress secured an emphatic win in the Gurdaspur Lok Sabha seat on Sunday.
Congress candidate Sunil Jakhar won by a margin of over 1.93 lakh votes, officials said.
He polled over 4.99 lakh votes, compared to 3.06 votes polled by Salaria.
Congress leaders and workers started had celebrating the impending victory by bursting firecrackers and distributing sweets in Gurdaspur, Chandigarh and other places even before the final result was declared.
TEXT:
Punjab Chief Minister Capt. Amarinder Singh waves during a road show in favour of Congress candidate for Gurdaspur Lok Sabha bypoll Sunil Jakhar on October 9, 2017 in Gurdaspur, India.

ADVERTISEMENT

Maintaining its winning streak from the assembly elections, Punjab's ruling Congress secured an emphatic win in the Gurdaspur Lok Sabha seat on Sunday.

Congress candidate Sunil Jakhar won by a margin of over 1.93 lakh votes, officials said. He polled over 4.99 lakh votes, compared to 3.06 votes polled by Salaria. The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) polled only around 24,000 votes.

Jakhar, who was in the lead right from the time the vote count began on Sunday morning, extended the margin over his BJP rival Swaran Salaria after each of the 14 rounds of counting.

Congress leaders and workers started had celebrating the impending victory by bursting firecrackers and distributing sweets in Gurdaspur, Chandigarh and other places even before the final result was declared.

"We won the election because of the positive policies of the Congress. People have faith in the party," Jakhar, who was termed an 'outsider' in the constituency by his opponents, told the media after his victory

Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh hailed the "unprecedented" Congress victory "as a total rejection of the anti-people policies of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its ally, the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD)".

"The massive win for Congress candidate shows the people's complete denunciation of the corrupt and immoral BJP and SAD," Amarinder said, adding that it also underlined the political annihilation of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in the state.

"The over 1.93 lakh margin of victory has not only more than compensated for the 1.36 lakh vote defeat of Congress candidate Pratap Singh Bajwa against BJP's Vinod Khanna in 2014 but has surpassed even the 1.51 lakh lead by which Sukhbans Kaur Bhinder (Congress) had won in 1980," Amarinder pointed out.

The seat was earlier held by the BJP, which had won it in 2014. The seat fell vacant in April following the passing away of veteran actor Vinod Khanna, a four-time MP from the seat.

AAP candidate Maj. Gen. Suresh Kumar Khajuria (retd) lost his security deposit.

Khajuria left the counting centre alleging that the voting was rigged by the Congress, which came to power in the state after sweeping the assembly polls.

The counting was conducted in centres in Gurdaspur and Pathankot towns. There were 11 candidates in the fray for the October 11 election. Nearly 56 per cent of the 15.22 lakh registered voters exercised their franchise.

The voter turnout was much lower than the over 70 per cent polling in 2014.
TITLE: Big Win For Congress In Gurdaspur LS By-Poll

TEXT:
Moment dÃ©cisif de la vie politique chinoise, le 19Ã¨me CongrÃ¨s du Parti communiste chinois est aussi un Ã©vÃ©nement d'une grande importance pour le monde.

Comme pour les CongrÃ¨s qui l'ont prÃ©cÃ©dÃ© mais avec une intensitÃ© toujours plus forte, les mÃ©dias internationaux, les analystes, les dÃ©cideurs Ã©conomiques vont observer les dynamiques et les messages qui marqueront ce temps fort de l' actualitÃ©.

Cet intÃ©rÃªt toujours grandissant s'explique par le fait que jamais dans son histoire moderne, la Chine n'a occupÃ© une telle centralitÃ© dans les affaires du monde.

DeuxiÃ¨me Ã©conomie mondiale continuant Ã  croÃ®tre Ã  un rythme soutenu, la Chine reprÃ©sente environ 30% de la croissance globale. Toutes les multinationales ont des intÃ©rÃªts en Chine et les milieux d'affaires ne peuvent ignorer les transformations et les particularitÃ©s de l'immense marchÃ© chinois.

Si le poids financier et Ã©conomique de la Chine s'impose comme une Ã©vidence, son influence politique est tout aussi dÃ©terminante. Sur tous les continents, la gestion et la rÃ©solution des crises sont de plus en plus dÃ©pendantes des positions Ã©laborÃ©es et dÃ©fendues par la diplomatie chinoise.

PÃ©kin est devenu une clef de voÃ»te de la gouvernance mondiale qu'il faut, certes, continuer Ã  perfectionner. C'est le prÃ©sident Xi Jinping, dont l'engagement dans la lutte contre les dÃ©rÃ©glements climatiques dÃ©coule de sa vision d'une "civilisation Ã©cologique", qui est l'une des forces majeures pour la mise en oeuvre de l'Accord de Paris sur le climat.

Mais la Chine ne se rÃ©sume ni Ã  une Ã©conomie, ni Ã  une entitÃ© politique, elle est, avant tout, une grande civilisation vivante. Sa renaissance engendre Ã  travers le monde une curiositÃ© de plus en plus vive Ã  l'Ã©gard de ses Ã©lÃ©ments constitutifs, sa langue, ses arts, ses moeurs ou sa philosophie.

De l'observation des thÃ¨mes autour desquels les grandes discussions publiques ont gravitÃ© ces derniÃ¨res annÃ©es, il ressort qu' "une Ceinture, une Route" a souvent occupÃ© le centre des dÃ©bats. La visibilitÃ© de cette initiative pour des "Nouvelles Routes de la Soie" est, sur le fond comme sur la forme, une illustration de la centralitÃ© grandissante de la Chine.

AprÃ¨s le 18Ã¨me CongrÃ¨s de 2012 qui a vu le pouvoir passÃ© de la quatriÃ¨me Ã  la cinquiÃ¨me gÃ©nÃ©ration des dirigeants du pays, Xi Jinping a immÃ©diatement placÃ© son mandat sous le signe de la renaissance chinoise prÃ©sentant une vision de long terme tant pour les affaires intÃ©rieures que pour le positionnement extÃ©rieur de la Chine.

Le 19Ã¨me CongrÃ¨s sera marquÃ© lui par le renouvellement d'une partie de l'Ã©quipe qui soutient la vision de Xi Jinping, il confirmera l'engagement sur la voie des rÃ©formes et de l'ouverture. C'est ce nouveau ComitÃ© central, son Bureau politique et son ComitÃ© permanent qui auront la charge de prÃ©parer en 2021 le centiÃ¨me anniversaire du Parti communiste chinois.

Sur une voie qui lui est propre nÃ©cessairement faÃ§onnÃ©e par un contexte historico-culturel unique, oeuvrant Ã  rester en capacitÃ© de s'adapter aux transformations objectives du monde, le Parti est une invitation Ã  rÃ©flÃ©chir sur une expÃ©rience de gouvernance qui enrichit le vocabulaire de la science politique.

Cette expÃ©rience de gouvernance s'enracine dans une longue histoire, elle est nourrie par un environnement culturel singulier mais elle prend forme aussi en s'adaptant au monde contemporain.

Il ne s'agit Ã©videmment pas d'Ã©riger cette pratique en modÃ¨le puisqu' elle est liÃ©e Ã  des conditions qui ne peuvent Ãªtre transposÃ©es, mais le temps est venu de reconnaÃ®tre, dans une perspective comparative, ses avantages et ses positivitÃ©s: stabilitÃ© et innovation dans un Ã©quilibre entre la verticalitÃ© du pouvoir et l'horizontalitÃ© d'une sociÃ©tÃ© entrepreneuriale, prÃ©dictabilitÃ©, double capacitÃ© de s'inscrire dans le long terme et d'embrasser le changement.

En cette annÃ©e du 19Ã¨me CongrÃ¨s, il faut souhaiter que le monde, loin des caricatures, des prÃ©jugÃ©s et des simplifications, prenne le temps de mieux saisir comment fonctionne le Parti communiste chinois, ses processus de sÃ©lection, sa facultÃ© Ã  Ã©laborer des consensus autour de grands axes politiques et stratÃ©giques, son aptitude Ã  rÃ©former le pays le plus peuplÃ© de la planÃ¨te, les sources de sa lÃ©gitimitÃ©

Aucune organisation ou institution humaine n'est parfaite, mais alors que ce Parti est au coeur d'une des transformations les plus significatives de notre temps, il mÃ©rite toute notre attention.

Soyons au moins aussi ouverts Ã  cette expÃ©rience de gouvernance que les stratÃ¨ges de ce Parti ne le sont a l'Ã©gard d'autres formes de gouvernance, ainsi nous pourrons perfectionner chacun dans nos contextes nos formes d'organisation politique tout en gardant en vue l'impÃ©ratif d'une meilleure gouvernance mondiale qui nous reste Ã  bÃ¢tir.

U.S. President Donald Trump rolled out his new Iran strategy on Friday, vowing to deny Tehran 'all paths to a nuclear weapon' in a major shift in Washington's Iran policy.
Trump announced he will not certify the Iran nuclear deal and warned that the US could leave the Iran deal 'at any time.'

SUMMARY:
Darryl Brohman, Beau Ryan, Erin Molan and Paul Vautin pose with yet another Logie Award -- this one for Best Sports Program in 2016.
The world awaits a slicker, younger era of The NRL Footy Show -- or whatever they choose to rebrand it as -- after the shock news that long running host Paul Vautin has been kicked off.
Newman's shock value is a huge part of the reason why people tune in to the AFL Footy Show in the AFL states.
Vautin had schlock value but not shock value.
Vautin has a year to serve on his Nine contract, which he will likely serve in the commentary box.
TEXT:
Darryl Brohman, Beau Ryan, Erin Molan and Paul Vautin pose with yet another Logie Award -- this one for Best Sports Program in 2016.

The age of the boofhead might just be over. The world awaits a slicker, younger era of The NRL Footy Show -- or whatever they choose to rebrand it as -- after the shock news that long running host Paul Vautin has been kicked off.

Vautin, 58, was one of the original Footy Show co-hosts. The former Manly, Queensland and Australia forward never had what you'd call a face made for television, and to his credit, he was always the first to make light of his own appearance.

"Fatty", as he was known, really was the most unlikely TV star in history. He was the guy more likely to be running a benefit gig at an RSL club nowhere near you. But his jovial, good-natured manner, and locker room sense of humour endeared him to fans over the years. Eleven Logies in a 24-year run mean something.

Vautin was never a provocateur like the AFL Footy Show's Sam Newman. His sexism was more a gentle old school nudge and wink than Newman's overt and often disgusting attacks on women. In fact, his subtlety might even have led to his downfall.

Newman's shock value is a huge part of the reason why people tune in to the AFL Footy Show in the AFL states. It's the car crash you simply have to watch. Vautin had schlock value but not shock value. And in the end, you sense that Channel 9 execs thought he was well, just a bit old school.

Vautin ten years ago in 2007, with then co-host Paul Harragon.

We don't know exactly what they were thinking, nor whether the show will be axed entirely or merely rebooted and rebranded. All we know, as Fairfax media reported, is that Footy Show executive producer Glenn Pallister told Vautin -- who is currently holidaying in the U.S. and has made no statement -- that the show would cease to exist in its current format, and that his services were no longer required.

This also appears to be the end of the Footy Show career of Darryl Brohman, Vautin's off-contract contemporary, and another who brings a gentle, yesteryear charm which has its appeal, but which, in all likelihood, doesn't quite cut it with younger audiences.

"I would think the show is gone," Brohman told Sydney radio station 2GB on Tuesday afternoon.

BREAKING: NRL icon and @NRLFootyShow fan favourite the @therealbigmarn confirms he "won't be there" on the Footy Show in 2018. pic.twitter.com/RbzW5pLpgS â€” Sydney Live (@SydneyLive2GB) 17 de outubro de 2017

"Personally I don't know if Fatty's gone that they can call it 'The Footy Show'.

"I think we're all realistic enough to realise there's always a use-by date for everyone in television and I'm realistic enough to know I've had a pretty good run. I'm not bitter at all."

Brohman said it was likely that Erin Molan will continue as host of the new or revamped show. Beau Ryan, the 32-year-old former player known for his controversial street vox pops, and whose appeal is strong with female and younger viewers, may also retain his gig.

"It's that sort of show, y'know?" Vautin once quipped after accidentally farting while on the panel (it's all in the clip below).

But it won't be that sort of show anymore. The Footy Show's ratings have dipped as low as 80,000 after reaching nearly 400,000 per episode in its heyday, so something had to give.

Vautin has a year to serve on his Nine contract, which he will likely serve in the commentary box. But he will be missed from this format. Like other figures in Australian sporting life -- think Lleyton Hewitt -- he started as a figure who many found obnoxious -- but mellowed over the years to the point where he became highly likeable.

But since when does likeable cut it in television?
TITLE: Footy Show Host Paul Vautin Booted, In Sure Sign The Age Of The Boofhead Is Over

SUMMARY:
Millie the dog lost her paw when she was just a pup and since then, it's been a constant struggle to find a prosthetic leg that fits just right.
This has seen Millie try four different models and styles of prosthetic, but finally she has found a leg that lets her run, jump and play -- and it's all thanks to 3D printing.
Millie's fifth and current prosthetic leg can be altered to suit her body on a computer using Autodesk's Fusion 360 software and a 3D printer.
This means that Millie's owners Ed and Nora Dieppe can print Millie a new leg without her having to be fitted for a replacement each time she grows.
The 3D-Printed ProstheticMillie's 3D printed leg is made from a material called CPE which is a co-polyester plastic, making the leg easy to fit and super lightweight.
TEXT:
Millie the dog lost her paw when she was just a pup and since then, it's been a constant struggle to find a prosthetic leg that fits just right.

This challenge means finding a leg that's comfortable, easily adjustable and can adapt to Millie's growing and changing body. This has seen Millie try four different models and styles of prosthetic, but finally she has found a leg that lets her run, jump and play -- and it's all thanks to 3D printing.

Millie's fifth and current prosthetic leg can be altered to suit her body on a computer using Autodesk's Fusion 360 software and a 3D printer. This means that Millie's owners Ed and Nora Dieppe can print Millie a new leg without her having to be fitted for a replacement each time she grows.

This solution has been a long time coming, as some of the previous legs left her feeling uncomfortable and restricted. It's been quite a journey for Millie, but now she really does seem happier than ever.

Millie As A Puppy

Millie lost her paw when she was just a puppy.

Millie's First Leg

Millie's first leg was perfect when she was small, but she quickly grew out of it.

The Second Prosthetic

Clunky and oversized, Millie hated number two from the start. She even tried chewing it off in protest.

Leg Number Three

The third leg was better, but still a little heavy for Millie. It was bulky, and hard to fit.

Number Four

Prosthetic leg four was more streamlined, easier to fit and lighter in weight. While it was still quite cumbersome, Millie did get greater freedom of movement.

The 3D-Printed Prosthetic

Millie's 3D printed leg is made from a material called CPE which is a co-polyester plastic, making the leg easy to fit and super lightweight. With her new leg, Millie can now run, jump and play just like any other doggo, and if she ever needs the leg adjusted Ed or Nora can simply jump onto the computer, chnage the design of the prosthetic and print Millie a brand new one.
TITLE: Millie The Dog : Australia's First Pup To Receive a 3D Printed Prosthetic Leg

Prendre un virage Ã  180Â° dans la vie ce n'est pas Ã  la portÃ©e de tout le monde. Pour ma part, j'ai eu besoin d'un bon coup de pied au derriÃ¨re pour comprendre que je pouvais m'autoriser de vivre un rÃªve aussi simple soit-il.

TEXT:
Sardina Pilchardus It sounds a bit like something Harry Potter would shout, pointing his wand desperately as the minions of evil swarm towards him in the nether regions of Hogwarts. It is, however, the Latin name for the European pilchard, known for marketing reasons these days as the Cornish sardine (or as Voldemort might say, ssssardine). Writer, journalist and food fiend who blogs at Mrs Portly's Kitchen

Everything You Need To Know About Week Seven Of GBBO 'It's shaping up to be the hottest day in the tent EVER.' Oh really? Us October folk really feel for you. We really do. I must say, Ch4, keep these senses-we-can-never-experience coming. First taste, now temperature, next smell and touch. Truly, excellent viewing. A cynical optimist and lover of 70s music, spicy food, and a good pub garden.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Skillet I love to serve this straight from the oven to the table, ensuring at least 10 minutes cooling time with a large dollop of ice cream in the centre. If you do not have a skillet at home (they are quite expensive) then you can use a cake pan instead. Le Cordon Bleu chef, cookery teacher, gluten-free

Food Poisoning: How To Spot It, Treat It And Avoid It In the UK there are over 800,000 cases of food poisoning every year. Almost every single one of us will fall victim to the dreaded 'bad stomach' at some stage in our lives. London Doctors Clinic founder and Senior NHS GP

Six Everyday Dairy-Free Swaps Going dairy-free doesn't have to be daunting - new research from Dream shows that 31m people in the UK are keen to cut out dairy from their diet, but only 12% ever attempt this as they believe it will be too difficult for them. Registered Nutritionist practising in Harley Street

Our Teens Are 'Ditching Dairy' - A Teenage Time Bomb Waiting to Happen? Worryingly, the trend is greatest in our young generation of 16-24 year olds who are shunning dairy at the fastest rate, despite needing it the most during their strong bone-forming years to prevent health issues such as osteoporosis or thinning bones later in life. Clinical and sports dietitian, expert in functional medicine and personalised nutrition

Health With A Purpose As it stands currently, it seems that the 'good health industry' in all its guises is profiting greatly from distorting our sense of purpose. In this quest it is legitimate to spend our time hunting for recipes, developing recipes, sharing recipes; filming and photographing ourselves consuming healthy food and working out; taking selfies of our nearly naked bodies; and feeling tremendous guilt and lethargy if we do anything less. In the process, so much human energy is wasted. And all this, sadly, makes us extremely unhealthy in other ways. Writer, Baha'i, mother

Annoying Archetypes: The Hipster Cook You're invited out to dinner with a friend at the home of this person, about whom your friend is reluctant to say too much; his name will be Django or Salinger or Tarquin or something along those lines; there will be a heavy duty check shirt, big beard and unneeded eccentric spectacles - the first clues as to what you're in for. Comedian, best-selling author, trainer and speaker; founder of Positive Comedy Training; books have sold half a million copies + worldwide

Why Go Dairy-Free? With people becoming more and more aware of the environment, we're seeing a rise in dairy-free diets, as well as vegetarian and vegan diets. There's also a case of many people just wanting to try new options- new research shows that 31m people in the UK are keen to drop dairy from their diet, but only 12% of people actually attempt to switch to a dairy-free diet Registered Nutritionist practising in Harley Street

Venison Tagine With Squash And Prunes People keep telling me autumn is underway, and according to the weather experts in Britain's Met Office it started on September 1st, but they just carve the year into quarters to make their statistics easier to calculate. Clinging to summer, I prefer to stick with the old astronomical calendar and by that measure, the seasons change on the 22nd. That doesn't stop me wanting autumnal food though. Writer, journalist and food fiend who blogs at Mrs Portly's Kitchen

Back To School Basics For A Better Lunchbox The old tricks are the best! Making shapes out of sandwiches, presenting fruit in small colourful containers, adding a fun curly straw to drink their milk with - it all helps to make sure they actually eat everything. After all, children don't get any nutritional benefit from food that never leaves the lunchbox. Clinical and sports dietitian, expert in functional medicine and personalised nutrition

The Vegan Guide To Staying Healthy On The Road For backpackers, tourists, or anyone who travels for work, trying exotic new cuisines is one of the best things about travelling. Who wouldn't be excited to try authentic empanadas in Mexico, steaming-hot street food in Vietnam, or a plate of fresh gnocchi in Italy? Freelance writer travelling the world

A Love Letter To Phá»Ÿ And HÃ  Ná»™i The global culinary diktat ordains the truly transcendent plate comes to an accord with the state of mind of the consumer. That country and culture, currency and currentness, the city, chef and diner are all represented. Pho manages to do all of these things and goes beyond, resolutely. Profoundly. No dish in the world is more profound. Chef and owner of Gin & Ruk. Opening his first restaurant in Bristol, England, in 2018.

Raspberry Bakewell Slice A fresh and fruity take on an old family favourite, this tray bake is good cut into fingers and eaten with a cuppa, or with a dollop of cream for dessert. I love the contrast of the tart raspberries against the sweet filling. Vary it by swapping the raspberries for blackberries and blackberry jam, or try pitted, halved cherries with cherry jam. Writer, journalist and food fiend who blogs at Mrs Portly's Kitchen

Fennel, Cheese And Onion Tart As our own fennel is looking decidedly weedy (in every sense) I was extremely grateful. I had all sorts of plans for them, but as usual things were a bit hectic, so I plumped for this quick fennel tart. The braising can be done ahead of time if necessary and the mixture refrigerated. Let it come to room temperature before assembling the tart. Writer, journalist and food fiend who blogs at Mrs Portly's Kitchen
TITLE: Food: Recipes, Blogs And Video Ideas For Simple Everyday Cooking

TEXT:
Australiaâ€™s Attorney General has been schooled in etiquette - and grammar - after having his surname reportedly pronounced â€œBrand-arseâ€ after he refused to correctly say his colleagueâ€™s name.

George Brandis has been repeatedly criticised for failing to say Richard Di Nataleâ€™s surname properly.

George Brandis has called Richard Di Natale "Di Na-tar-lay" for some time



RDN asks him to pronounce it "Di Na-ta-lee"



Brandis declines pic.twitter.com/mc6uUjRY6p â€” Josh Butler (@JoshButler) October 17, 2017

Brandisâ€™s comments were widely criticised on social media.

There's something vaguely ethnocentric about Brandis deciding he gets to decide how someone else's non-Anglo name should be pronounced... â€” Snorkelling Fish (@snorkellingfish) October 17, 2017

Its very rude not to make an effort&pronounce peoples names properly.Tries too hard to prove that hes an Aussie by pronouncing it like that â€” Lana Arcus (@lana_arcus) October 17, 2017

Apparently Brandis is incapable of being professionally respectful. That was your moment to acknowledge the error, apologise, move on. â€” Jodes (@whoozqueen) October 17, 2017

When challenged on the mispronounciation, Brandis retorted: â€œI mean no offence Senator Di Natale, thatâ€™s just the way I pronounce the English language. Iâ€™m sorry if my pronunciation is imperfect.â€

He then persisted to incorrectly pronounce his colleagueâ€™s name.

In retaliation, senator Peter Whish-Wilson later referred to Brandis as â€œBrand-arseâ€, according to local media reports.

He then apologised saying: â€œThatâ€™s just how I pronounce it.â€

Peter Whish-WIlson just called George Brandis "senator Brand-Arse" then apologised saying "that's just how I pronounce it" #auspol #SenateQT â€” Paul Karp (@Paul_Karp) October 18, 2017

Senator Peter Whish-Wilson just pronounced George Brandis' name as "Brand-arse"



Probs a dig at the AGs pronunciation of Di Natale #qt â€” Matthew Doran (@MattDoran91) October 18, 2017

Senator Peter Whish-Wilson pronounced George Brandis name as "Brand-arse" in #qt but did apologis as he has trouble pronouncing things ğŸ˜‚ â€” Katherine (@KatherinedeHeer) October 18, 2017
TITLE: Australian Attorney General George Brandis Mispronounces Colleagues' Name, Gets Branded 'Brand-Arse'

POLITIQUE - Liberticide pour les uns laxiste pour les autres, la loi antiterroriste, dÃ©finitivement adoptÃ©e par un ultime vote au SÃ©nat mercredi 18 octobre, concentre beaucoup de critiques. Pour la France insoumise, le texte dÃ©fendu par GÃ©rard Collomb installe "une forme d'Ã©tat d'urgence permanent". Du cÃ´tÃ© des RÃ©publicains au contraire, cette loi ne va pas assez loin et la sortie annoncÃ©e de l'Ã©tat d'urgence "dÃ©sarmera la France" face au terrorisme.

"Entre deux excÃ¨s, notre texte apparaÃ®t ce qu'il est: de la dentelle de l'antiterrorisme", expliquait de son cÃ´tÃ© le dÃ©putÃ© de LREM, et vice-prÃ©sident de l'AssemblÃ©e nationale, Sacha HouliÃ©, citÃ© par Le Monde, Ã  l'occasion du vote au Palais Bourbon. Marine Le Pen, quant Ã  elle, continue de qualifier le texte de "sous Ã©tat d'urgence" et d'"escroquerie".

Si le texte reprend en effet des mesures de l'Ã©tat d'urgence, comme la possibilitÃ© pour le prÃ©fet de procÃ©der Ã  des fermetures de lieux de cultes ou les assignations Ã  rÃ©sidence, certaines dispositions ont Ã©tÃ© encadrÃ©es alors que d'autres ont Ã©tÃ© tout simplement abandonnÃ©es.

Parmi les mesures permises par l'Ã©tat d'urgence mais absentes de la loi anti-terroriste, figurent l'interdiction de manifester (utilisÃ©e au moment de la COP21 ou pendant la grogne contre la loi travail) ainsi que la dissolution des "associations ou groupements de fait qui participent Ã  la commission d'actes portant une atteinte grave Ã  l'ordre public".

Les perquisitions administratives modifiÃ©es

Autre mesure qui saute: les perquisitions administratives Ã  la seule discrÃ©tion du prÃ©fet. Sous l'Ã©tat d'urgence, ce dernier peut ordonner une perquisition chez un individu, de jour comme de nuit, en se passant du contrÃ´le de la justice. Si la loi anti-terroriste n'enterre pas le principe des perquisitions administratives, pudiquement rebaptisÃ©es "visites et saisines", celles-ci devront Ãªtre soumises Ã  l'autorisation d'un magistrat, Ã  savoir le juge des libertÃ©s et de la dÃ©tention du Tribunal de grande instance de Paris. Sauf dÃ©rogation, celles-ci seront menÃ©es entre 6h et 21h, comme une perquisition classique. Ã€ noter Ã©galement que ces "visites et saisines" ne pourront Ãªtre appliquÃ©es que dans le cadre de la lutte anti-terroriste.

Une adaptation au droit commun qui fait hurler le dÃ©putÃ© LR Ã‰ric Ciotti, qui estime que cette disposition conduira Ã  mener "moins de perquisitions administratives". Sur ce point, un Ã©clairage s'impose. "Ce rÃ©gime judiciaire d'exception,(...), n'avait pas brillÃ© par son efficacitÃ©, un an aprÃ¨s les attentats de Paris: si 4200 perquisitions ont eu lieu, seules 1,5 % d'entre elles ont donnÃ© lieu Ã  des procÃ©dures judiciaires entre novembre 2015 et novembre 2016", souligne Le Monde.

Car si les perquisitions administratives ont trÃ¨s vite obtenu des rÃ©sultats au dÃ©but de l'Ã©tat d'urgence (aprÃ¨s le 13 novembre), celles-ci se sont rapidement essoufflÃ©es une fois l'effet de surprise estompÃ©. Un tiers des perquisitions ont d'ailleurs Ã©tÃ© ordonnÃ©es dÃ¨s la premiÃ¨re semaine de l'Ã©tat d'urgence et, depuis le mois de janvier 2016, leur nombre a considÃ©rablement chutÃ©.

Ce qui va au-delÃ  de l'Ã©tat d'urgence

Si plusieurs responsables LR crient au "laxisme", il y a des dispositions qui vont bien au-delÃ  de l'Ã©tat d'urgence. Parmi elles, l'obligation pour les personnes soupÃ§onnÃ©es de transmettre leurs identifiants numÃ©riques ou encore le contrÃ´le des communications hertziennes.

Ã€ noter cependant que les dÃ©putÃ©s avaient adoptÃ©, mardi 3 octobre, un amendement Ã©tablissant un contrÃ´le parlementaire sur l'exÃ©cution de ces mesures. Reste Ã  savoir maintenant comment ce texte sera votÃ© au SÃ©nat.
TITLE: Ces mesures de l'Ã©tat d'urgence absentes de la loi antiterroriste (et ce que Ã§a signifie)

Christian Lindner will nicht, dass die CDU das Finanzministerium bekommt | dpa

FDP-Chef Lindner will das Finanzministerium nicht der CDU Ã¼berlassen

Das Finanzministerium sollte nach Ansicht des FDP-Vorsitzenden Christian Lindner in einer neuen Koalition nicht wieder an die CDU gehen. In der "Frankfurter Allgemeinen Zeitung"vom Dienstag lieÃŸ er aber erneut offen, ob er selbst das Amt anstrebe:

"Mir ist eine andere Finanzpolitik wichtiger als die Frage, welche Person im Ministerium sitzt. Es hat sich aber gezeigt, dass Wolfgang SchÃ¤uble ein leitender und leidender Mitarbeiter des Bundeskanzleramts war", sagte er kurz vor Beginn von Jamaika-Verhandlungen von Union, FDP und GrÃ¼nen.

Lindner fÃ¼gte erlÃ¤uternd hinzu: "Die Nachbesetzung durch Peter Altmaier (CDU) unterstreicht, dass das Bundesministerium der Finanzen kein fachliches Korrektiv des Kanzleramts ist, sondern seine verlÃ¤ngerte Werkbank. Deshalb empfehle ich, das Kanzleramt und Bundesfinanzministerium politisch zu trennen. Ob ein Liberaler Minister wÃ¤re, ist da nachrangig."

Auf die Nachfrage "Dann also ein grÃ¼ner Finanzminister?" sagte Lindner: "Ein GrÃ¼ner, ein CSU- oder ein FDP-Finanzminister - alles wÃ¤re besser, als das Kanzleramt und das Finanzministerium weiterhin in CDU-Hand zu halten, denn so wird durchregiert. Das hat sich nicht bewÃ¤hrt."

Er halte es fÃ¼r vÃ¶llig ausgeschlossen, "dass ein nur kommissarisch agierender Bundesfinanzminister in BrÃ¼ssel Verhandlungen fÃ¼hrt, als wÃ¤re nichts geschehen. Es dÃ¼rfen keine Festlegungen getroffen werden ohne neue politische Legitimation."

Kanzleramtschef Peter Altmaier soll nach dem Ausscheiden von Wolfgang SchÃ¤uble (CDU) vorÃ¼bergehend Finanzminister werden.

â€œWir schauen mal, was gehtâ€

Die Gemeinsamkeiten zwischen den mÃ¶glichen Regierungsparteien seien laut Lindner seit der Bundestagswahl nicht grÃ¶ÃŸer geworden. Eine Verweigerung der GesprÃ¤che nannte er im Interview jedoch "unverantwortlich", weil es "um die StabilitÃ¤t der Bundesrepublik geht".

Sein vorsichtiges Motto fÃ¼r den Beginn der SondierungsgesprÃ¤che am Mittwoch: "Wir schauen mal, was geht.â€

Dem erzkatholischen Land, wo Teile der BevÃ¶lkerung seine maximal 25.000 muslimischen MitbÃ¼rger (noch nicht einmal 0,1 Prozent der BevÃ¶lkerung) fÃ¼r zu viel hÃ¤lt. â–º "Insbesondere hofft Polen, dass der FlÃ¼chtlingsdeal mit der TÃ¼rkei hÃ¤lt", sagt RydliÅ„ski. Das ist auch der aktuelle SchlÃ¼sselpunkt zwischen BrÃ¼ssel und Ankara.

â–º Zweitens will sich Warschau fÃ¼r die tÃ¼rkische UnterstÃ¼tzung bei Polens Nato-Beitritt revanchieren.

â–º Drittens habe man noch immer nicht vergessen, dass das Osmanische Reich, der VorgÃ¤ngerstaat der heutigen TÃ¼rkei, die Teilung des polnischen KÃ¶nigreichs zwischen Russland, PreuÃŸen und Ã–sterreich-Ungarn nicht anerkannte. "Das politische GedÃ¤chtnis in Polen ist sehr lang", unterstreicht RydliÅ„ski.

Die TÃ¼rkei - "Ein exotischer VerbÃ¼ndeter"

Deshalb seien die derzeitigen bilateralen Beziehungen "sehr gut", obwohl fÃ¼r viele Polen die TÃ¼rkei ein "exotischer VerbÃ¼ndeter" sei, erlÃ¤utert RydliÅ„ski.

Er sieht das Treffen als weiteren Hinweis fÃ¼r die verstÃ¤rkten polnischen Beziehungen zu illiberalen Staaten. So wie sie es jetzt schon zwischen der polnischen nationalkonservativen Regierungspartei Recht und Gerechtigkeit (PiS) und dem ungarischen MinisterprÃ¤sidenten Viktor OrbÃ¡n gibt.

Der Politikwissenschaftler betont: "Seit die TÃ¼rkei und Polen 2009 eine strategische Partnerschaft beschlossen haben, harmonieren beide wirtschaftlich sehr gut. In beiden LÃ¤ndern gibt es Millionen Konsumenten, beide Ã–konomien lechzen nach Investitionen: Poland hat das Wissen, die TÃ¼rkei eine starke Industrie. Es ist eine Win-Win-Situation."

Warschau wolle mit der EU-Einladung an die TÃ¼rkei auch Berlin Ã¤rgern, glaubt RydliÅ„ski. Die Devise von PiS: "Schaut her, wir sind ein nicht-muslimischer Staat aber schÃ¤tzen Erdogans Ideen."

Seit der RegierungsÃ¼bernahme durch PiS im Herbst 2015 beziehungsweise seit dem Putsch in der TÃ¼rkei versuchen beide Staaten - zum Unmut vieler liberaler und sÃ¤kularer KrÃ¤fte - die Bedeutung der Religion in beiden Gesellschaften voranzutreiben.

Hay dos tipos de personas: las que ven las series paulatinamente, y las que devoran.
Estos segundos fueron analizados por Netflix, que, despuÃ©s de un gran estudio de mercado, descubrieron cuÃ¡les son los programas que los "supermaratoneros" ven en tiempo rÃ©cord.

Ce mardi 17 octobre, l'actrice Lena Headey a rejoint Rose McGowan, Angelina Jolie, Gwyneth Paltrow, Lea Seydoux, Judith GodrÃ¨che et beaucoup d'autres en dÃ©nonÃ§ant Ã  son tour le harcÃ¨lement qu'elle a eu Ã  subir de la part de Harvey Weinstein.

SUMMARY:
A federal court in Maryland was the second to block President Donald Trumpâ€™s third and most extensive initiative to limit travel into the United States on Wednesday.
A Hawaii judge blocked the ban the day before, just hours before it was set to go into effect.
It represents an â€œextricable re-animation of the twice-enjoined Muslim ban,â€ Maryland District Judge Theodore D. Chuang said.
It applies only to those who couldnâ€™t prove a â€œbona fideâ€ relationship with a family member or entity in the U.S.
They view this ban as yet another thinly veiled attempt to target Muslims (six out of the eight countries on the list are Muslim-majority).
TEXT:
A federal court in Maryland was the second to block President Donald Trumpâ€™s third and most extensive initiative to limit travel into the United States on Wednesday. A Hawaii judge blocked the ban the day before, just hours before it was set to go into effect.

It represents an â€œextricable re-animation of the twice-enjoined Muslim ban,â€ Maryland District Judge Theodore D. Chuang said. His ruling is somewhat smaller in scope than that of his Hawaii counterpart, Judge Derrick Watson. It applies only to those who couldnâ€™t prove a â€œbona fideâ€ relationship with a family member or entity in the U.S.

The International Refugee Assistance Project, the Iranian Alliances Across Borders and various individual plaintiffs, including the state of Hawaii, filed lawsuits in Hawaii and Maryland after the travel ban â€• which would indefinitely ban citizens from Chad, Iran, Libya, North Korea, Somalia, Syria, Venezuela and Yemen from entering the country â€• was announced on Sept. 24. They view this ban as yet another thinly veiled attempt to target Muslims (six out of the eight countries on the list are Muslim-majority).

â€œEO-3 suffers from precisely the same maladies as its predecessor: it lacks sufficient findings that the entry of more than 150 million nationals from six specified countries would be â€˜detrimental to the interests of the United States,â€™â€ the Hawaii court order said. The ban also â€œplainly discriminates based on nationality in the manner that the Ninth Circuit has found antithetical to both Section 1152(a) and the founding principles of this Nation,â€ it noted.

Non-visa holders from most of the countries listed have already been banned for the last several months, after the Supreme Court ruled to allow parts of a previous travel ban to go into effect in June. The latest initiative removed Sudan from the list, and added Chad, North Korea and Venezuela. It was planned to go into effect Wednesday.

Omar Jadwat, who is the director of the American Civil Liberty Unionâ€™s Immigrantsâ€™ Rights Project and was among those arguing the case in Maryland, called Trumpâ€™s ban â€œillegal and unconstitutional.â€

â€œWeâ€™re glad, but not surprised, that President Trumpâ€™s illegal and unconstitutional Muslim ban has been blocked once again,â€ Jadwat said. â€œLike the plaintiffs in the Hawaii case, we are working to ensure the ban never takes effect.â€

Making America Safe is my number one priority. We will not admit those into our country we cannot safely vet.https://t.co/KJ886okyfC â€” Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) September 24, 2017

The changes were interpreted by many as mere political posturing â€• an attempt to make the ban appear less overtly targeted toward Muslims.

â€œEach new version is just an updated version of the previous ones, and they all have one goal: to keep out people primarily from majority-Muslim countries,â€ Becca Heller, head of the International Refugee Assistant Project, said Monday. â€œWe will not rest until this cruel and senseless policy is blocked for good.â€

A White House statement released Tuesday afternoon called the Hawaii court order â€œdangerously flawedâ€ and noted the travel ban was issued after an â€œextensive worldwide security review.â€

â€œThe entry restrictions in the proclamation apply to countries based on their inability or unwillingness to share critical information necessary to safely vet applications, as well as a threat assessment related to terrorism, instability, and other grave national security concerns,â€ the White House said. â€œThese restrictions are vital to ensuring that foreign nations comply with the minimum security standards required for the integrity of our immigration system and the security of our Nation.â€

The Department of Homeland Security â€œwill comply with any lawful judicial order,â€ acting secretary Elaine Duke said in a statement, adding that they â€œlook forward to prevailing in this matter upon appeal.â€ She said the â€œrequirements are essential to securing the homeland.â€

NurPhoto via Getty Images An activist in Los Angeles holds a sign on Oct. 15 during a protest against President Donald Trump's travel ban.

The new orders doesnâ€™t directly implicate the U.S. refugee resettlement program because the Trump administration had already taken measures to limit the number of refugees able to seek safety in the country. The 120-day suspension included in the second iteration of the ban expires on Oct. 24. Experts donâ€™t think the White House will replace it with a new refugee ban because the administration already slashed the annual resettlement ceiling to 45,000 for fiscal year 2018, the lowest itâ€™s been since the programâ€™s inception in 1980.

The series of limits placed on immigration places tens of thousands of people already in the resettlement pipeline in limbo. Plus, it precludes so many more from being able to begin the process.

For Amir Abbasi, 33, the uncertainty has been excruciating. (He asked for his name to be changed out of fear of persecution by authorities in his home country.) He and his partner fled Iran due to the persecution they faced for being gay. They illegally traveled to Turkey in 2014 and first went through the Canadian refugee pipeline.

They were told the country couldnâ€™t handle any more cases, so earlier this year they began the process with the U.S. program. After one pre-screening interview, they stopped hearing from U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.

He no longer holds hope that his U.S. application will lead to anything, he said. He doesnâ€™t know where to go or what to do.

â€œLife in Turkey is very hard,â€ he said. â€œWe donâ€™t have any access to job markets legally. Most LGBT refugees donâ€™t have access to funds from their families. And if you work illegally you might be arrested and you might be deported to Iran.â€
TITLE: Federal Judges In 2 States Block Donald Trump's Latest Travel Ban

TEXT:
Wedding crashers are usually frowned upon, unless theyâ€™re cute and fluffy, it seems.

A stray dog recently gained two loving owners when he strolled into a wedding uninvited.

The pup, now named Snoop, gatecrashed the wedding of MarÃ­lia and Matheus Pieroni, who had moved their outdoor wedding indoors due to stormy weather.

Snoop walked down the aisle in the middle of the ceremony and soon made himself at home, even snuggling down on MarÃ­liaâ€™s veil.

Brazil-based photographer Felipe Paludetto was on hand to capture the hilarious moment.

Felipe Paludetto

Felipe Paludetto Felipe Paludetto

After winning the hearts of the wedding guests, Snoop unexpectedely disappeared after the ceremony.

But the newlyweds decided their first act as husband and wife would be to track down the pooch and give him a loving home.

A week later a local resident made them aware of the dogâ€™s whereabouts and the couple fulfilled their promise.

Speaking to The Dodo, MarÃ­lia said Snoop is settling in just fine.

â€œHe came home and I showered him,â€ she said.

â€œHe played a lot, ate, drank water. He is very happy and slept super good the first night. Weâ€™re all very happy.â€

We hope the three of them have a long and happy future together.
TITLE: Newlyweds Adopt Stray Dog Who Snuck Into Their Wedding Looking For Shelter

SUMMARY:
My Wind-Down Ritual When I was younger I was always able to survive on not much sleep or irregular sleep.
Doctor, GP, media personality and fitness expertIs Treating Myself The Same As Self Compassion?
Up until I really started learning about it, I believed that self-compassion and treating myself were the same thing.
I enjoy the process - no I love the process - as much as the end result.
Lifestyle Writer at HuffPost UK
TEXT:
My Wind-Down Ritual When I was younger I was always able to survive on not much sleep or irregular sleep. But being a junior doctor working night-shifts in my late 20s, was the first time I realised the link between sleep and how it affects my health and the way I feel. Doctor, GP, media personality and fitness expert

Is Treating Myself The Same As Self Compassion? My understanding of self-compassion has changed dramatically in the last three months or so. Up until I really started learning about it, I believed that self-compassion and treating myself were the same thing. They're not. There's a world of a difference between the two. Self-compassion is defined by two key features: Sunny Spells and Scattered Showers

Bullet Journalling Isn't Just About Organising My Life, It's Like Therapy For Me What has surprised me the most is how much I've enjoyed time to create and decorate my pages to make them look nice. So many people have commented on how much effort it must take to manually create a diary and if that's what you're thinking then it's 100% not for you. I enjoy the process - no I love the process - as much as the end result. Life Writer, HuffPost UK

How I Learned To Love My Commute (And How You Can Too) Now I realise that may sound like one big lie, but let me reassure you it is possible to enjoy spending long periods of time on a train with someone's sweaty armpit in your face - you just have to train yourself in the art of happy commuting. Lifestyle Writer at HuffPost UK
TITLE: Downtime

SUMMARY:
If you've never heard of spaghetti squash, it's a vegetable with fibrous strands which, when cooked, resemble cooked spaghetti.
Take these spaghetti squash pizza bowls with pizza sauce, cheese and pepperoni.
This dish is easy to make, satisfying and packed with delicious pizza flavours.
To make these pizza bowls, start by roasting spaghetti squash halves until golden.
Then it's time to add the pizza topping ingredients: pizza sauce, parmesan, ground Italian sausage, red onion, capsicum, pepperoni and mozzarella.
TEXT:
Eating low carb doesn't have to mean saying goodbye to your favourite foods. You just have to know a few handy food tricks.

If you've never heard of spaghetti squash, it's a vegetable with fibrous strands which, when cooked, resemble cooked spaghetti. It's basically nature's low-carb version of pasta.

Once you have your delicious low-carb spaghetti, you can serve it just like you would regular pasta -- with bolognese, carbonara sauce, pesto -- or you can stuff the squash with your favourite ingredients and bake it.

Take these spaghetti squash pizza bowls with pizza sauce, cheese and pepperoni. This dish is easy to make, satisfying and packed with delicious pizza flavours.

To make these pizza bowls, start by roasting spaghetti squash halves until golden. Take a fork and fluff the squash to create the spaghetti strands. Then it's time to add the pizza topping ingredients: pizza sauce, parmesan, ground Italian sausage, red onion, capsicum, pepperoni and mozzarella. Place the pizza boats back in the oven until the cheese has melted, then dig in.

Check out the recipe in the video above.
TITLE: Watch: How To Make Low-Carb Pizza Bowls

Soll es einen muslimischen Feiertag geben? Deutschland diskutiert heftig Ã¼ber die Frage, die Bundesinnenminister Thomas de MaiziÃ¨re (CDU) thematisiert hatte. Nur von den Muslimen hÃ¶rt man - mal abgesehen vom immer rÃ¼hrigen Vorsitzenden des Zentralrats der Muslime, Aiman Mazyek, nichts.

Kenan Firat, Masterstudent im Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen: "Meiner Meinung nach ist die Diskussion Ã¼berflÃ¼ssig"

"Meiner Meinung nach ist die Diskussion Ã¼ber die EinfÃ¼hrung muslimischer Feiertage in Deutschland Ã¼berflÃ¼ssig. Die islamische Religionsgemeinde ist ein kleiner BevÃ¶lkerungsanteil der deutschen Gesellschaft. Die dominierende Religion Deutschlands ist das Christentum und dementsprechend sollten die Feiertage auch stattfinden.

Zudem befeuert diese Diskussion die politische Situation, indem sie den Populisten mehr ZÃ¼ndstoff zur Argumentation liefert."

"Ich weiÃŸ nicht, woher so eine Schnapsidee kommt. Kein Muslim, den ich kenne, hat jemals den Wunsch nach einem offiziellen Feiertag geÃ¤uÃŸert. Ich auch nicht.

Ich finde es auch ganz skurril, dass gerade Thomas de MaiziÃ¨re das Ã¤uÃŸert. Er, der keine Gelegenheit auslÃ¤sst, den Muslimen klarzumachen, dass sie hier fehl am Platz sind.

Was wir brauchen ist: WertschÃ¤tzung von Religionen und deren AnhÃ¤ngern, dadurch hÃ¶here Identifikation mit dem Land und dadurch stÃ¤rkere ZugehÃ¶rigkeit zum Land."

Es gibt sehr viele Muslime in Deutschland, daher darf man diese nicht unbeachtet lassen. Und es schadet niemandem, wenn ein Muslim an dem fÃ¼r ihn wichtigen Feiertag nicht arbeitet und ihn zuhause mit der Familie feiert."

In der Grundschule wurden die muslimischen Kinder von unserem Rektor, der fÃ¼nf Jahre in der TÃ¼rkei unterrichtet hatte, an Feiertagen vom Unterricht befreit. MitschÃ¼ler waren neidisch. Sie hÃ¤tten sich Ã¼ber zusÃ¤tzliche Feiertage ebenfalls gefreut.

Integration funktioniert nur, wenn beide Seiten sie leben. Muslime in Deutschland werden sich immer benachteiligt fÃ¼hlen, solange sie nicht akzeptiert und gewÃ¼rdigt werden."
