TEXT:
Australiaâ€™s Attorney General has been schooled in etiquette - and grammar - after having his surname reportedly pronounced â€œBrand-arseâ€ after he refused to correctly say his colleagueâ€™s name.

George Brandis has been repeatedly criticised for failing to say Richard Di Nataleâ€™s surname properly.

George Brandis has called Richard Di Natale "Di Na-tar-lay" for some time



RDN asks him to pronounce it "Di Na-ta-lee"



Brandis declines pic.twitter.com/mc6uUjRY6p â€” Josh Butler (@JoshButler) October 17, 2017

Brandisâ€™s comments were widely criticised on social media.

There's something vaguely ethnocentric about Brandis deciding he gets to decide how someone else's non-Anglo name should be pronounced... â€” Snorkelling Fish (@snorkellingfish) October 17, 2017

Its very rude not to make an effort&pronounce peoples names properly.Tries too hard to prove that hes an Aussie by pronouncing it like that â€” Lana Arcus (@lana_arcus) October 17, 2017

Apparently Brandis is incapable of being professionally respectful. That was your moment to acknowledge the error, apologise, move on. â€” Jodes (@whoozqueen) October 17, 2017

When challenged on the mispronounciation, Brandis retorted: â€œI mean no offence Senator Di Natale, thatâ€™s just the way I pronounce the English language. Iâ€™m sorry if my pronunciation is imperfect.â€

He then persisted to incorrectly pronounce his colleagueâ€™s name.

In retaliation, senator Peter Whish-Wilson later referred to Brandis as â€œBrand-arseâ€, according to local media reports.

He then apologised saying: â€œThatâ€™s just how I pronounce it.â€

Peter Whish-WIlson just called George Brandis "senator Brand-Arse" then apologised saying "that's just how I pronounce it" #auspol #SenateQT â€” Paul Karp (@Paul_Karp) October 18, 2017

Senator Peter Whish-Wilson just pronounced George Brandis' name as "Brand-arse"



Probs a dig at the AGs pronunciation of Di Natale #qt â€” Matthew Doran (@MattDoran91) October 18, 2017

Senator Peter Whish-Wilson pronounced George Brandis name as "Brand-arse" in #qt but did apologis as he has trouble pronouncing things ğŸ˜‚ â€” Katherine (@KatherinedeHeer) October 18, 2017
TITLE: Australian Attorney General George Brandis Mispronounces Colleagues' Name, Gets Branded 'Brand-Arse'

TEXT:

Son lointain successeur GÃ©rard Collomb assurait ces derniers mois que le futur dispositif n'a rien Ã  voir avec celui mis en place sous la gauche plurielle et Emmanuel Macron a lui-mÃªme affirmÃ© ce mercredi que sa PSQ ne sera pas "le retour pur et simple Ã  la police de proximitÃ©", fortement connotÃ©e et dÃ©criÃ©e Ã  droite oÃ¹ l'on y voit "une vieille lubie de la gauche".

D'aprÃ¨s le prÃ©sident, la PSQ consistera ainsi en une police dÃ©ployÃ©e sur des "territoires prioritaires du point de vue de l'insÃ©curitÃ©", dans les quartiers, au contact des citoyens, pour lutter contre la dÃ©linquance Ã  la fois par la rÃ©pression -si besoin- et par la dissuasion. Le tout en pouvant donner une rÃ©ponse judiciaire et effectuer des interventions. La lutte contre le harcÃ¨lement, notamment dans les transports, fera aussi partie de ce dispositif.

La police de sÃ©curitÃ© du quotidien aura comme prioritÃ© la lutte contre le harcÃ¨lement dans les transports. #LeGrandEntretien #TF1EMacron â€” Emmanuel Macron (@EmmanuelMacron) 15 octobre 2017

"Nous dessinons des Ã©lÃ©ments de doctrine forts mais les initiatives reposent sur le terrain. La dÃ©linquance de Pau ne ressemble pas Ã  celle de Toulouse ou de Nantes", ajoute Eric Morvan, nouveau chef de la police nationale, qui plaide pour une "police de la disponibilitÃ©".

"La doctrine proposera notamment les moyens de rendre compte de l'action des forces de sÃ©curitÃ© Ã  nos concitoyens, dans une perspective plus qualitative, complÃ©tant les statistiques de la dÃ©linquance", a aussi promis Emmanuel Macron.

Une trentaine de villes se sont dÃ©jÃ  portÃ©es candidates Ã  l'expÃ©rimentation qui doit Ãªtre lancÃ©e dÃ©but 2018, dont Lille, Grenoble, Toulouse, Saint-Denis ou Aulnay. La sÃ©lection aura lieu dans le courant du mois de dÃ©cembre. Toutes espÃ¨rent renouer "une relation de confiance et d'estime" entre la population et la police.

Ã‰viter le raccourci vers la "pol prox"

De quoi rappeler la "pol prox", comme surnommÃ©e Ã  l'Ã©poque. Introduite en 1998 par Jean-Pierre ChevÃ¨nement, ministre de l'IntÃ©rieur, elle devait donner "la prioritÃ© Ã  la sÃ©curitÃ© quotidienne des FranÃ§ais", comme le rÃ©sumait Lionel Jospin. Le but: privilÃ©gier la prÃ©vention et tenter de diminuer les besoins de rÃ©pression. Pour ce faire, les agents patrouillaient sur le terrain, dans les quartiers, se familiarisaient avec les habitants, interagissaient avec eux. Leur prÃ©sence faisait Ã©galement office de dissuasion et de mÃ©diation.

En 2003, face Ã  des rÃ©sultats statistiques jugÃ©s dÃ©cevants sur le plan de la baisse de la dÃ©linquance, Nicolas Sarkozy avait actÃ© la fin de ce dispositif, annonÃ§ant aux policiers concernÃ©s: "vous n'Ãªtes pas des travailleurs sociaux. Organiser un match de rugby pour les jeunes du quartier, c'est bien, mais ce n'est pas la mission premiÃ¨re de la police".

C'est ce procÃ¨s en laxisme sur fond de clivage droite-gauche qu'Emmanuel Macron et GÃ©rard Collomb veulent Ã©viter en annonÃ§ant cette nouvelle police aux airs de dÃ©jÃ -vu. Il s'agit aussi de rÃ©pondre aux inquiÃ©tudes exprimÃ©es par les forces de l'ordre, Ã  l'image de CÃ©line Berthon, secrÃ©taire gÃ©nÃ©rale du Syndicat des commissaires de la police nationale. Selon elle, la PSQ "ne peut pas Ãªtre une resucÃ©e de la police de proximitÃ©, elle ne peut pas Ãªtre non plus une philosophie pensÃ©e uniquement au niveau ministÃ©riel avec une dÃ©clinaison identique sur tous les territoires".

Des policiers de l'UnitÃ© territoriale de quartier (Uteq) surveillent le quartier du Mas-du-Taureau, Ã  Vaulx-en-Velin, le 24 mars 2010.

"Il est difficile de diffÃ©rencier cette nouvelle police, de la police de proximitÃ© version Jospin d'il y a 20 ans qui -soyons clairs- a particuliÃ¨rement marquÃ© les esprits pour son inefficacitÃ© dans l'histoire de la Police nationale, dÃ©plorait aussi Bruno Beschizza, secrÃ©taire national Ã  la SÃ©curitÃ© des RÃ©publicains et ancien commandant de police, dans une tribune au HuffPost publiÃ©e en aoÃ»t.

"Pourquoi ce recyclage? Il faut aussi rappeler que s'il y a 20 ans, cette police de proximitÃ© Ã©tait une mauvaise idÃ©e, c'est devenu aujourd'hui une trÃ¨s mauvaise idÃ©e puisque les missions de proximitÃ© sont dÃ©jÃ  assurÃ©es... par la police municipale", ajoutait-il.

"Plus assez d'agents"

"A ce jour, avec les informations que l'on a, je ne suis pas capable de dire s'il y a une rÃ©elle diffÃ©rence entre cette nouvelle police et la police de proximitÃ©", souligne aussi FrÃ©dÃ©ric Lagache, secrÃ©taire gÃ©nÃ©ral adjoint du syndicat policier Alliance. "Si c'est dans une optique d'assainir les quartiers, faire un travail de policier et arrÃªter les dÃ©linquants, oui, pas de souci, affirme-t-il au HuffPost. Mais si c'est pour faire dans le social, Ã§a ne marchera pas. De mÃªme que Ã§a n'a pas marchÃ© il y a 20 ans".

Le syndicaliste voit d'ailleurs une explication Ã  l'Ã©chec de le la "pol prox" dans les annÃ©es 90: "On a pris des policiers qui travaillaient dans l'investigation, l'un des piliers de la police, pour ce fameux dispositif. Ce pilier a donc Ã©tÃ© fragilisÃ©. Alors la dÃ©linquance n'a pas baissÃ©, puisqu'il n'y avait plus assez d'agents pour enquÃªter et localiser les dÃ©linquants". Aujourd'hui, il estime que le mÃªme problÃ¨me pourrait se poser pour la PSQ.

Ainsi, la police de la sÃ©curitÃ© du quotidien ne devrait pas Ãªtre crÃ©Ã©e ex nihilo. Des agents d'autres services verront leur missions redÃ©finies pour s'accorder au dispositif. Pour FrÃ©dÃ©ric Lagache, "Ã  moins qu'ils y mettent plus de moyens, tout Ã§a ne changera rien".

Britainâ€™s economy would get a â€œsignificantâ€ boost if Brexit was reversed in a second EU referendum, a leading global think tank has suggested.
â€œIn case Brexit gets reversed by political decision (change of majority, new referendum, etc), the positive impact on growth would be significant,â€ the think tank said.
That certainty will support the investment that will drive the productivity gains of the future,â€ Hammond said.
â€œToday, the OECD has recognised the importance of our Â£23bn national productivity investment fund which will improve our countryâ€™s infrastructure, increase research and development and build more houses.
In addition, our reforms to technical education and our ambitious industrial strategy will also help to deliver an economy that works for everyone.â€
TEXT:
Britainâ€™s economy would get a â€œsignificantâ€ boost if Brexit was reversed in a second EU referendum, a leading global think tank has suggested.

The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) also warned that the UKâ€™s growth would be hit hard if it quits the European Union without a trade deal.

In its latest assessment of the UK economy, the OECD projected growth of just 1% for 2018 and forecast that things would get even worse if a â€œdisorderly Brexitâ€ occurred and no deal was agreed with the 27-nation bloc.

The think tank pointed out that immigration had been a big boon to the UK labour market and predicted that a collapse in current Brexit talks with Brussels would lead to soaring prices, a plunging pound and business investment drying up.

To avoid such a scenario, the OECD suggested that a new referendum â€“ or a change in Theresa Mayâ€™s majority - would have a â€œpositiveâ€ impact on growth if it led to Britain staying in the EU.

OECD chief Angel Gurria also risked a row with Tory MPs by appearing to compare the damage done by Brexit to the London Blitz in World War Two.

PA Archive/PA Images OECD secretary general Angel Gurria.

â€œIn case Brexit gets reversed by political decision (change of majority, new referendum, etc), the positive impact on growth would be significant,â€ the think tank said.

Downing Street was swift to stamp on the suggestion, with the Prime Ministerâ€™s official spokesman saying the idea of a re-run of the referendum was â€œabsolutelyâ€ not on the cards.

A Government spokesman added: â€œThere will not be a second referendum. We are working to protect British jobs and the economy.â€

Chancellor Philip Hammond also said â€œthe Government is clear we are leaving the European Unionâ€, but was careful to add his own warning against a â€˜no dealâ€™ Brexit.

â€œWe know that delivering a time limited transition period, avoiding a disruptive cliff-edge exit from the EU we can provide greater certainty for businesses. That certainty will support the investment that will drive the productivity gains of the future,â€ Hammond said.

Empics Entertainment Chancellor Philip Hammond.

The OECD had a stark warning of the damage to UK jobs and growth if the country ended up on World Trade Organisation (WTO) trade tariffs rather than a close trade deal with the EU.

â€œA break-up of EU-UK negotiations, cancelling out the prospect of a trading relationship in the foreseeable future, would trigger an adverse reaction of financial markets, pushing the exchange rate to new lows and leading to sovereign rating downgrades.

â€œBusiness investment would seize up, and heightened price pressures would choke off private consumption. The current account deficit could be harder to finance, although its size would likely be reduced.â€

OECD secretary general Angel Gurria, who unveiled his report alongside Hammond in London on Tuesday, said â€œit will be crucial the EU and the UK maintain the closest economic relationship possibleâ€ in future.

Gurria said the OECD wanted an exit that was â€œas seamless and smooth as possibleâ€ but pointed out that the UK had benefited from its close trade ties with the rest of the EU.

He also claimed that the British wartime phrase â€œKeep Calm And Carry Onâ€ was apt for the approach to Brexit, adding Winston Churchillâ€™s resolve in the Blitz was a model for today.

Asked if the PM felt such a comparison was appropriate, a spokesman for the Theresa May replied: â€œNo.â€

OECD OECD figures showing immigration has helped lift growth in the past decade.

He even hinted that EU migration should continue. â€œOn the question of the closest economic relationship possible, it applies to goods and services but also to the movement of labour - from which has benefited the UK so much.â€

To offset some of the damage, the OECD urged Hammond to spend spare funds on identifying ways to improve productivity, which measures the output per hour of an individual worker, by enhancing the skills of low-income workers.

A Treasury spokesman said: â€œIncreasing productivity is a key priority for this government, so that we can build on our record employment levels and improve peopleâ€™s quality of life.

â€œToday, the OECD has recognised the importance of our Â£23bn national productivity investment fund which will improve our countryâ€™s infrastructure, increase research and development and build more houses. In addition, our reforms to technical education and our ambitious industrial strategy will also help to deliver an economy that works for everyone.â€
TITLE: Reversing Brexit Would Give 'Significant' Boost To UK Economy, OECD Think Tank Suggests

TEXT:
Beim Dinner haben sich GroÃŸbritanniens Premierministerin May und EU-KommissionsprÃ¤sident Juncker darauf verstÃ¤ndigt, die Brexit-GesprÃ¤che zu beschleunigen

Laut einem Bericht hat May kaum noch Raum fÃ¼r Verhandlungen - und hofft auf ein Entgegenkommen der EU

Am Montag traf sich die britische Premierministerin Theresa May mit EU-KommissionsprÃ¤sident Jean-Claude Juncker zum Abendessen in BrÃ¼ssel. Freundlich und konstruktiv sei die AtmosphÃ¤re gewesen, lieÃŸen Teilnehmer verlauten.

Dass das betont wird, sagt schon viel. Schon einmal waren bei einem Brexit-Dinner der beiden die Differenzen beim EU-Austritt der Briten zutage getreten. Das sollte diesmal also nicht passieren.

Nur viel herausgekommen ist auf den ersten Blick auch nicht: Die beiden einigten sich darauf, die GesprÃ¤che beschleunigen zu wollen.

May und Juncker wollen GesprÃ¤che beschleunigen

Vor dem Treffen scherzte Juncker noch. "Ich weiÃŸ nicht, warum selbst die berÃ¼hmtesten Journalisten immer schon vor einem Treffen die Ergebnisse wissen mÃ¼ssen. Ich werde Frau May heute Abend sehen, wir werden diskutieren, und Sie werden dann den Obduktionsbericht sehen", sagte er.

TatsÃ¤chlich Ã¤hnelt die Premierministerin mehr und mehr einer lebenden Toten.

Ein bisschen Tempo nach viel Blockade

May steht massiv unter Druck - aus dem eigenen Land, aber auch aus der EU.

Am Donnerstag und Freitag sollen die EU-Staats- und Regierungschefs auf einem Gipfel die AustrittsgesprÃ¤che mit GroÃŸbritannien bewerten. Aber es lÃ¤uft nicht gut.

Zuletzt hatte EU-ChefunterhÃ¤ndler Michel Barnier eine "Blockade" der Briten bei den Verhandlungen beklagt. Bei Finanzfragen wÃ¼rden die UnterhÃ¤ndler in einer Sackgasse stecken.

Unter Berufung auf FunktionÃ¤ren der EU und GroÃŸbritanniens berichtet das Polit-Magazin "Politico", eines der Ziele von May sei es gewesen, den EU-Vertretern klarzumachen: Sie kÃ¶nne nach ihrer Rede in Florenz keine weiteren ZugestÃ¤ndnisse machen. In Florenz hatte May versprochen, sich an die Regeln der EU halten zu wollen - und verlangte auch eine zweijÃ¤hrige Ãœbergangszeit.

"Sie hat keinerlei Raum mehr fÃ¼r ManÃ¶ver. Also mÃ¼ssen sie ihr helfen, Raum dafÃ¼r zu schaffen", zitiert "Politico" einen britischen Beamten.

Die Verhandlungen sollten schon viel weiter sein

UrsprÃ¼nglich wollten die Staats- und Regierungschefs bereits jetzt die zweite Phase der Brexit-Verhandlungen einlÃ¤uten. Darin sollte es um die kÃ¼nftigen Beziehungen, ein Handelsabkommen beider Seiten und eine Ãœbergangsphase gehe.

Vorher will die EU aber unbedingt wichtige Trennungsfragen klÃ¤ren, unter anderem Milliardenforderungen an London. Dies gelang bisher nicht. Nun hofft die EU, bis Dezember die HÃ¼rde zu nehmen.

Die nÃ¤chste Phase wird noch komplizierter

Der Druck auf May wird auch in der nÃ¤chsten Phase der Verhandlungen wohl weiter zunehmen. Dann geht es um Handel und Sicherheit. May vertritt Ã¶ffentlich nach wie vor die Position, GroÃŸbritannien solle aus der EU ausscheiden - auch ungeregelt, ohne einen anschlieÃŸenden Deal.

Der Widerstand gegen diesen Kurs steigt. Die oppositionelle britische Labour-Partei etwa will ein ungeregeltes Ausscheiden GroÃŸbritanniens aus der EU verhindern. Die Abgeordneten kÃ¶nnten bei einem anstehenden Gesetzgebungsverfahren zum EU-Austirtt ein Veto-Recht erzwingen oder Rebellen aus der Regierungsfraktion Ã¼berzeugen, mit ihnen zu stimmen.

May verfÃ¼gt im Parlament nur Ã¼ber eine hauchdÃ¼nne Mehrheit. Eine fÃ¼r nÃ¤chste Woche geplante Debatte Ã¼ber das EU-Austrittsgesetz wurde kurzfristig verschoben - mÃ¶glicherweise aus Angst, unliebsame Ã„nderungsantrÃ¤ge kÃ¶nnten eine Mehrheit finden, wie britische Medien spekulierten.



Mit Material der dpa.

(sk)

TEXT:
The British National Health Service has no time for racist Twitter trolls.

Its official blood service account on Friday expertly destroyed a tweeter who posted a vile comment in response to an appeal for more black blood donors to help patients with sickle cell anemia.

The @GiveBloodNHS account issued its appeal back in June:

Black people with sickle cell disease urgently need black donors. https://t.co/BiFaOY5YnO â€” GiveBlood NHS â¤ (@GiveBloodNHS) June 19, 2017

The inherited disease causes patientsâ€™ red blood cells to alter shape in ways that block the flow of blood and oxygen. It disproportionately affects black people.

â€œIf we deport all blacks, this will stop being an issue.â€

The tweet has since vanished following the suspension of the personâ€™s account.

But the @GiveBloodNHS accountâ€™s fierce responses live on:

OR.. we could just deport you. âœŠğŸ½ https://t.co/pjldJ0WBT7 â€” GiveBlood NHS â¤ (@GiveBloodNHS) October 12, 2017

We would not welcome you as a blood donor so please do not try to attend one of our sessions. â€” GiveBlood NHS â¤ (@GiveBloodNHS) October 13, 2017

The National Health Service clapback went down well with other Twitter users and was going viral, with some people suggesting it inspired them to donate blood.

I want to buy a drink or five for the person that tweeted this. You absolute legend. â€” Robin William Scott (@robinwscott) October 12, 2017

Going to sign up now, this has definitely given me the push to do so â™¥ï¸ thank you for this! Love from a girl who is Black AND English ğŸ¤˜ğŸ¾ â€” Bec Awuor (@Queeniebey) October 14, 2017

Seriously, you can take all my blood for that clap back!!! â€” Chizzy (@chizzyakudolu) October 12, 2017

I want an opposite to the block button to be able to elevate this tweet for how fabulous it is. â€” Veep (@PrincessofVP) October 12, 2017

I'm giving extra blood next time, just for this. â€” Chris Off (@seismicshed) October 12, 2017

Think he'll need hospital treatment for that burn. â€” 911 Bastards (@john3ners) October 12, 2017
TITLE: Britain's National Health Service Expertly Shut Down A Racist Twitter Troll

POLITIQUE - Combien la rÃ©forme fiscale va-t-elle faire gagner aux FranÃ§ais les plus riches? C'est la question qu'a posÃ©e le journal LibÃ©ration au gouvernement mardi 17 octobre, et qui a reÃ§u le soutien de plus de 100 parlementaires.

TEXT:
A giant rainbow flag and tens of National flags are waved down Whitehall during the Pride in London Festival, London on July 8, 2017. The Pride in London Festival sees hundreds of thousands of people take to the streets in celebration and support of the LBGT+ community. This year's London Pride event marks 50 years since homosexuality was decriminalised in England and Wales under the 1967 Sexual Offences Act. (Photo by Alberto Pezzali/NurPhoto via Getty Images)

Und noch einen weiteren Seitenhieb gegen die Liberalen lieÃŸ der GrÃ¼nen-Politiker im GesprÃ¤ch nicht aus. "Wenn die FDP jetzt schon AnsprÃ¼che fÃ¼r MinisterÃ¤mter anmeldet und Posten verteilen will, ist das sehr voreilig. Erst kommen Sondierungen, dann Koalitionsverhandlungen, und Ã¼ber die Ressorts und das Personal wird ganz am Ende entschieden", sagte Ã–zdemir. Inhalte sollten nun im Vordergrund stehen.

FDP-Chef Christian Lindner hatte am Dienstag in der "Frankfurter Allgemeinen Zeitung" gefordert, das Finanzministerium solle nicht der Union Ã¼berlassen werden. "Ein GrÃ¼ner, ein CSU- oder ein FDP-Finanzminister - alles wÃ¤re besser, als das Kanzleramt und das Finanzministerium weiterhin in CDU-Hand zu halten", sagte Lindner.

Ã–zdemir wollte sich auf Nachfrage im GesprÃ¤ch mit der "Passauer Neuen Presse" nicht zu den Spekulationen Ã¤uÃŸern, ob er das AuÃŸenministerium anstrebe. Zugleich lieÃŸ er jedoch auch durchblicken, welche Posten fÃ¼r die GrÃ¼nen in einer Jamaika-Koalition attraktiv wÃ¤ren:

"Wir GrÃ¼nen sind die Partei der Ã¶kologischen Modernisierung. DafÃ¼r wird die Wirtschafts- und Energiepolitik von ganz entscheidender Bedeutung sein, aber auch eine nachhaltige Landwirtschafts- und Verkehrspolitik."
TITLE: "Wieder von den BÃ¤umen runterkommen": GrÃ¼nen-Politiker Ã–zdemir mahnt Union und FDP

SUMMARY:
Stranger Things, (season 2): After a roller-coaster of Season 1,Stranger Things is back with a whole new season of suspense and chaos.
The Jeremy Rush-directed flick will be available on Netflix India from October 20.
Riverdale (season 2):The second season of the popular American teen drama series Riverdale comes your way with a new episode every Thursday.
It started on October 12, on Netflix India.
It premiered on October 12 on Netflix India.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

After careful scrutiny, I have chosen the best of the best for you from the Netflix India's October 2017 catalogue. Here are my top picks from their originals, or licensed series, shows, and movies:

1. Stranger Things, (season 2): After a roller-coaster of Season 1,Stranger Things is back with a whole new season of suspense and chaos. Want to know how the surviving citizens of Hawkins, Indiana will cope with the horrors of the Demogorgon and the secrets of Hawkins Lab? Well, you will have to wait until October 27, before all hell breaks loose again.

2. Wheelman:If you have a thing for adrenaline-pumping action and relentless thrill then Wheelman is just for you. The Jeremy Rush-directed flick will be available on Netflix India from October 20.

3. Haters Back Off (season 2):If you are a fan of comedy then you will be happy to learn that a brand new season of Haters Back Off is coming your way on the 20th.

4. Voltron: Legendary Defender (season 4): Fans of animation are up for a grand treat as the fourth season of Voltron: Legendary Defender started streaming on Netflix from October 13.

5. The Meyerowitz Stories:The Noah Baumbach-directed, Palme d'Or-nominated American comedy-drama film starring Adam Sandler, Ben Stiller, Dustin Hoffman and Emma Thompson, released on October 13.

6. Mindhunter (season 1):Also streaming on Netflix from October 13 is the first season of Mindhunter. If you love crime serials then this is right up your alley.

7. Riverdale (season 2):The second season of the popular American teen drama series Riverdale comes your way with a new episode every Thursday. It started on October 12, on Netflix India.

8. Dynasty (season 1):If you are a fan of the good old soap operas then you can feast your eyes on the first season of Dynasty. Starring the likes of Grant Show, Nathalie Kelley, Elizabeth Gillies, etc. It premiered on October 12 on Netflix India.

9. Arrow (season 5):The fifth season of Arrow began on October 6. And if you are a comic fan then you are in for a major treat.

10. Suburra (season 1):The first season of the Italian mafia series Suburraâ€”the prequel to the 2015 film of the same name, premiered October 6.

11. Designated Survivor (season 2):Season 2 of the American political drama series Designated Survivor is a new addition to Netflix Indian catalog for this month.

12. Outlander (season 3): The popular Netflix original series Outlander is back with its third season. If you loved the first two seasons then surely you wouldn't be able to resist this one either.

13. The Dark Knight Rises:Fans of Christopher Nolan and Batman are surely going to cherish that fact that The Dark Knight Rises, starring Christian Bale, Tom Hardy, Marion Cotillard, has been added to the Netflix India catalog this month.

14. Mechanic: Resurrection:There are few actors as kickass as Jason Statham. And he can be seen in all his glory in Mechanic: Resurrection which also stars Jessica Alba and Tommy Lee Jones. Get ready to experience a new kind of an adrenaline rush this October on Netflix.

15. The Whole Nine Yards:And last but certainly not the least, October brings to you the Jonathan Lynn crime comedy filmThe Whole Nine Yards, starring Bruce Willis, Matthew Perry, and Natasha Henstridge.

A version of this article was first published in A Potpourri of Vestiges.

The opinions expressed in this post are the personal views of the author. They do not necessarily reflect the views of HuffPost India. Any omissions or errors are the author's and HuffPost India does not assume any liability or responsibility for them.
TITLE: 15 Reasons To Give In To Your Netflixation This October

SUMMARY:
The first category, so-called "key access group" antibiotics, are those that should be "widely available, affordable and quality assured".
The final category, "reserve group" antibiotics, should only be used as a last resort when all alternatives have failed.
However, sale of watch group and reserve group antibiotics rose much more steeply â€“ by 73% and 174%, respectively.
Unapproved formulations figured hugely in sales â€“ 270m units of the FDC antibiotics sold in 2011-12 contained unapproved formulations.
The Indian government banned some unapproved FDCs, including antibiotic formulations from sale â€“ most recently in 2016.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Efforts to conquer antimicrobial resistance are being jeopardised in India due to the sale of huge volumes of antibiotics that combine two anti-microbial drugs in one pill, our latest analysis reveals. Many of these fixed-dose combination (FDC) formulations, as they are known, have not been approved by India's drug regulator. Their sale is illegal.

Antibiotic resistance is a global crisis, threatening to reverse the astonishing health benefits achieved with antibiotics. As bacteria adapt to survive, effective treatments, even for common infections, are diminishing.

Unfortunately, new antibiotics in development are not yet offering realistic prospects for treating the infections caused by resistant bacteria. These infections include common kidney and chest infections, as well as life-threatening conditions, such as sepsis and meningitis.

So, wherever we live and in whatever guise we encounter antibiotics â€“ as patients, prescribers, pharmacists, drug sellers, pharmaceutical companies, drug developers, animal owners or veterinarians â€“ we have a shared responsibility to ensure our existing stash of these precious drugs remains as effective as possible against disease-causing bacteria. The World Health Organisation (WHO) is acutely aware of this, using its unique position to lead policy change for rational antibiotic use.

This year, the WHO made a major revision to its list of essential medicines, classifying antibiotics into three categories with recommendations on when each category should be used in common bacterial infections (such as chest or kidney infections, and excluding tuberculosis and viral infections, such as HIV).

The first category, so-called "key access group" antibiotics, are those that should be "widely available, affordable and quality assured". These antibiotics are suitable to treat most common bacterial infections. The second category, "watch group" antibiotics, are recommended for specific infections. Bacteria tend to develop resistance easily to these drugs, so judicious use is needed.

The final category, "reserve group" antibiotics, should only be used as a last resort when all alternatives have failed. The WHO specifies that these drugs should be "protected and prioritised" to preserve their effectiveness.

Lack of regulatory scrutiny

India is known as "the pharmacy of the world", due to its large pharmaceutical industry. It has among the highest per capita sales of antibiotics globally, as well as high levels of antimicrobial resistance.

In our study of antibiotic sales in India between 2007 and 2012, we found that total sales were rising annually, and the increase was driven by FDCs. While total antibiotic sales increased by 26% over five years, FDC sales rose by 38%. By 2011â€“12, FDCs comprised a third of all antibiotics sold in India (872m units).

Analysed according to the new WHO categories, we found that sales of FDCs with key access antibiotics had risen by 20% in five years. However, sale of watch group and reserve group antibiotics rose much more steeply â€“ by 73% and 174%, respectively.

We found 118 different antibiotic FDC formulations on the market, but only 43 were approved by India's drug regulator, the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation. The sale of unapproved new medicines is illegal in India, yet 75 formulations had no approval record. So they had no regulatory scrutiny to decide if they were likely, on balance, to be of more public benefit than harm.

Unapproved formulations figured hugely in sales â€“ 270m units of the FDC antibiotics sold in 2011-12 contained unapproved formulations. The Indian government banned some unapproved FDCs, including antibiotic formulations from sale â€“ most recently in 2016. But the bans have been challenged by the industry and it appears the FDCs remain on sale.

Considering the WHO vision of conserving watch and reserve group antibiotics, their increasing sales, not to mention the numbers of unapproved formulations, suggest there is a formidable task ahead in India.

Patricia McGettigan, Reader in Clinical Pharmacology and Medical Education, Queen Mary University of London and Allyson Pollock, Professor of Public Health, Newcastle University

This article was originally published on The Conversation. Read the original article.
TITLE: Indian Government Not Doing Enough To Tackle Sale Of Unapproved Antibiotics

TEXT:
Rawpixel Ltd via Getty Images

Il me semble que, malgrÃ© le fait que le grand-pÃ¨re de Boucar Diouf lui a appris pas mal de choses, il a oubliÃ© de lui apprendre ce qu'est une sociÃ©tÃ© de droit et la signification d'une charte de droits et libertÃ©s. Son dernier billet en est la preuve ostentatoire.

Le vivre-ensemble, cher Boucar, n'est pas de faire de compromis d'une part ou d'une autre sur nos libertÃ©s et droits fondamentaux, mais plutÃ´t le respect de ces derniers qu'on soit d'accord ou pas sur comment on les exerce.

Par ailleurs, M. Diouf illustre l'enjeu entourant le multiculturalisme en le comparant Ã  une Â« compÃ©tition d'AÃ¯kido Â» oÃ¹ chacun essaie de tordre le bras de l'autre en utilisant sa force contre lui. Mais quelle idÃ©e tordue!

Cher Boucar, ne vous prononcez pas sur des sujets que vous ne comprenez pas, s'il vous plait. Votre analogie dÃ©montre clairement que vous n'avez aucune idÃ©e de ce que c'est, l'AÃ¯kido! (Oui, je suis un maÃ®tre d'AÃ¯kido et je sais de quoi je parle.)

Les mots Â« compÃ©tition Â» et Â« AÃ¯kido Â» sont antonymes. Ce dernier signifie littÃ©ralement ''la voie d'Ãªtre en harmonie avec l'Ã©nergie''. L'AÃ¯kido sert Ã  concilier deux forces opposantes afin de les rendre une seule, encore plus puissante. En d'autres mots, il favorise le vivre-ensemble entre adversaires, les personnes aux opinions diffÃ©rentes, de cultures diffÃ©rentes... et non pas la victoire de l'un contre l'autre. La seule victoire que l'AÃ¯kido rapporte est celle sur soi-mÃªme.

Alors oui, le multiculturalisme est comparable Ã  l'AÃ¯kido, mais pas en tant que compÃ©tition, mais en tant qu'outil de conciliation afin de faire de notre diversitÃ© notre force et non pas notre faiblesse.

Votre billet flatte dans le sens du poil tous ces nationalistes identitaires qui veulent assimiler "l'autre" au dÃ©triment du respect de leurs droits et libertÃ©s.

Votre billet flatte dans le sens du poil tous ces nationalistes identitaires qui veulent assimiler "l'autre" au dÃ©triment du respect de leurs droits et libertÃ©s.

Oui, parler de la rÃ©duction des seuils d'immigration ne doit pas Ãªtre taxÃ© automatiquement d'intolÃ©rance et/ou de xÃ©nophobie, pour Ã§a je suis d'accord avec vous. Sauf que quand on associe un tel discours Ã  un qui considÃ¨re tous ceux qui ne pensent pas comme ''nous-autres'' comme des citoyens de second degrÃ©, ou qui met en doute leurs valeurs ou leur culture, c'est lÃ  oÃ¹ ce discours devient anti-immigration et limite xÃ©nophobe.

Vivre comme les Romains ne veut pas dire adopter leurs valeurs, culture, traditions ou coutumes. Ã‡a veut dire respecter leurs lois, point! Si pour vous cher Boucar, vivre comme les Romains signifie adopter leur mode de vie, leur culture, fine, tant mieux si vous Ãªtes content, mais cela ne veut pas dire que c'est la seule et/ou la bonne voie d'intÃ©gration. L'important est qu'on soit libre dans le choix de notre voie d'intÃ©gration sinon cette derniÃ¨re sera plutÃ´t une assimilation comme on a fait aux autochtones une autre fois.

Et oui, je le vois venir: Â« Mais si on va dans leur pays, on fait comme eux Â» . Oui, je sais que vous faites comme eux, mais pas parce que c'est leur culture ou coutume, mais ce sont leurs lois qui exigent de faire telle ou telle chose ou de s'habiller ou de se comporter d'une telle maniÃ¨re.

Au-delÃ  du respect des lois d'un pays quelconque, qu'il soit le mien ou non, personne ne peut et ne doit me forcer Ã  faire quoi que ce soit contre mon grÃ©. Si je veux adopter une autre culture, Ã§a doit se faire sur une base uniquement volontaire. La fameuse RÃ©volution tranquille a Ã©tÃ© qualifiÃ©e comme telle, pas parce qu'on a forcÃ© les religieux Ã  se retirer de la sphÃ¨re politique, mais parce qu'ils l'ont fait eux-mÃªmes d'une maniÃ¨re volontaire. Alors l'expression Â« on s'est dÃ©barrassÃ© de la religion au QuÃ©bec Â» n'est pas trÃ¨s exacte; c'est la sociÃ©tÃ© au complet qui s'est entendue Ã  sÃ©parer l'Ã©tat de l'influence politique de la religion, et non pas Ã  Â« se dÃ©barrasser Â» de cette derniÃ¨re. D'ailleurs, dans un rÃ©cent billet sur l'identification religieuse au QuÃ©bec, on peut clairement constater que la religion est bien prÃ©sente au QuÃ©bec :

Â« [...] pas moins de 74,7% des QuÃ©bÃ©cois s'identifient comme chrÃ©tiens catholiques.

Ã€ cela s'ajoute 7,5% de la population s'affirmant comme des chrÃ©tiens non catholiques (protestants, orthodoxes, etc.).

Seulement 12,1% des QuÃ©bÃ©cois affirment n'avoir aucune affiliation religieuse. Â»

Finalement, si quelqu'un se sent visÃ© par cette commission sur le racisme et la discrimination systÃ©mique, malgrÃ© toutes les explications fournies que ce ne sont pas les personnes qui sont visÃ©es, mais un systÃ¨me dÃ©suet, eh bien... probablement c'est parce que le chapeau le fait quelque part.

Peut-Ãªtre que tout Ã§a, cher Boucar, vous n'avez pas eu la chance de l'apprendre de votre grand-pÃ¨re, hÃ©las!
TITLE: La leÃ§on ratÃ©e du vivre-ensemble de Boucar Diouf

SUMMARY:
Die eine hat zwei Kinder, die andere eins.
Und auch ich ging mit meiner Tochter weiter.
Und ich fragte mich: Ist es wirklich so seltsam, wenn eine Mutter drei Tage mit Freundinnen in ein Wellnesshotel fÃ¤hrt?
Meine Tochter ist drei Jahre alt und der Alltag zwischen Kind, Haushalt, Job und Beziehung ist anstrengend.
Nur so kann sie lernen, dass sie auch auf ihre Acht geben muss.
TEXT:
Ich stehe mit meiner Tochter an der Eisdiele. Ein beliebter Treffpunkt fÃ¼r MÃ¼tter mit ihren Kindern. Neben uns stehen zwei Frauen mit ihren Buggys. Die eine hat zwei Kinder, die andere eins. Sie unterhalten sich Ã¼ber die Kinderkrippe. Vermutlich gehen die Kinder in die gleiche Einrichtung.

"Hast du die Mail gelesen, die gerade herum ging?", fragt eine der beiden MÃ¼tter. "Nein, warum?", antwortet die andere. "Ein paar MÃ¼tter wollen zusammen drei Tage in ein Wellnesshotel fahren", erzÃ¤hlt sie mit hochgezogenen Augenbrauen. Und fÃ¼gt hinzu: "Ich weiÃŸ nicht, was die fÃ¼r ein Leben haben."

"Naja drei Tage, die fahren halt Ã¼ber das Wochenende", sagt die andere Mutter darauf. "Ja genau ganze drei Tage, also Wochenende und noch einen Tag dazu. Ich frage mich, wie die das machen. Bei uns wÃ¼rde das erst klappen, wenn die Kinder grÃ¶ÃŸer sind."

Damit war das Thema vorbei. Sie sprachen Ã¼ber etwas anderes. Und auch ich ging mit meiner Tochter weiter. Doch das GesprÃ¤ch wirkte nach.

Und ich fragte mich: Ist es wirklich so seltsam, wenn eine Mutter drei Tage mit Freundinnen in ein Wellnesshotel fÃ¤hrt? Oder einen Wochenendtrip nach Berlin macht? Ist es verwerflich, wenn ich mir als Mutter einmal eine Auszeit nehme?

Wir MÃ¼tter mÃ¼ssen mehr auf uns achten

Ich finde nicht. Ganz im Gegenteil. Es ist unser gutes Recht und auch unsere Verantwortung unserer Familie gegenÃ¼ber. Denn wir mÃ¼ssen auf uns achten, sonst sind wir irgendwann vÃ¶llig erschÃ¶pft oder werden sogar krank.

Dieser Ansicht ist auch Anne Schilling, GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrerin des MÃ¼ttergenesungswerks in Berlin: "MÃ¼tter stellen ihre BedÃ¼rfnisse hinten an und denken, dass sie keine 'gute' Mutter sind, wenn sie etwas fÃ¼r sich tun und das Kind oder die Familie einmal nicht an erster Stelle steht. Oft befinden sie sich in einer Spirale der stÃ¤ndigen Ãœberforderung. Und das kann krank machen."

Anne Schilling arbeitet seit 15 Jahren als GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrerin des MÃ¼ttergenesungswerks und ihr ist eine Sache aufgefallen: "Seit vielen Jahren steigt bei MÃ¼ttern die Diagnose ErschÃ¶pfung bis zum Burn-out. Ãœber 80 Prozent der Frauen, die zu uns kommen, leiden darunter."

Sie erklÃ¤rt auch, warum das so ist. Die MÃ¼tter von heute haben sehr hohe AnsprÃ¼che an sich selbst, wollen mÃ¶glichst alles perfekt machen. Sie ignorieren die Anzeichen der ErschÃ¶pfung lange, nehmen sich wenig Auszeiten, weil sie denken, dass das ein Zeichen von SchwÃ¤che ist.

Ich will eine starke und gesunde Mutter bleiben

Ich kenne das GefÃ¼hl. Meine Tochter ist drei Jahre alt und der Alltag zwischen Kind, Haushalt, Job und Beziehung ist anstrengend. Auch ich stelle meine BedÃ¼rfnisse oft hinten an und komme manchmal an meine Grenzen.

Aber ich habe beschlossen, mehr an mich zu denken. Einen gesunden Egoismus zu entwickeln. Deswegen haben ich auch vor zwei Wochen eine Flug nach Lissabon gebucht. Mit meinen besten Freundinnen. In Zukunft will ich das Ã¶fter machen: auf mich schauen.

Denn zum einen will ich eine starke und gesunde Mutter bleiben. Und zum anderen will ich meiner Tochter auch vorleben, dass ich auf meine BedÃ¼rfnisse achte. Nur so kann sie lernen, dass sie auch auf ihre Acht geben muss.

Wenn ich noch einmal die Gelegenheit hÃ¤tte, der Mutter an der Eisdiele einen Satz mitzugeben, dann wÃ¼rde ich ihr sagen: Du bist keine schlechte Mutter, nur weil du mal an dich denkst.

Was denkt ihr darÃ¼ber?

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform fÃ¼r alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.
TITLE: Ich habe ein GesprÃ¤ch zwischen zwei MÃ¼ttern mitgehÃ¶rt - jetzt verstehe ich, warum viele von uns krank werden

SUMMARY:
Greenpeace has released its latest â€˜Greener Electronicsâ€™ report in which it ranks each of the major tech companies on their commitment to environmentally friendly practices.
â€œWhile Amazon highlights the importance it places on responsible sourcing, it provides little information beyond its broad supply chain standards.â€ states the report.
â€œAmazon has not made any commitment to eliminate hazardous chemicals from its products or the manufacturing process of its supply chain,â€ the report concludes.
The authors commended Amazonâ€™s recent support of policies in the US that would reduce greenhouse emissions and support the rollout of renewable energy.
â€œApple has thus far been fairly aggressive in pursuing its 2020 goal to deploy 4GW of renewable energy in its supply chain,â€ states the report.
TEXT:
Greenpeace has released its latest â€˜Greener Electronicsâ€™ report in which it ranks each of the major tech companies on their commitment to environmentally friendly practices.

While Apple featured as the second most responsible company, Amazon faced heavy criticism from the report with the authors going so far as to say it is â€œone of the least transparent companies in the world in terms of its environmental performance.â€

Each company is given a score that is based on numerous factors that include the cleanliness of their supply chain, how reusable their products are and even their level advocacy on the political stage.

Greenpeace

As you can see from the scoring sheet, other poor performers include Samsung, Huawei and Asus.

The reports authors Gary Cook and Elizabeth Jardim criticised Amazon not only for its complete lack of transparency but also with the way it handles hazardous chemicals within its own supply chain.

â€œWhile Amazon highlights the importance it places on responsible sourcing, it provides little information beyond its broad supply chain standards.â€ states the report.

â€œAmazon does not publish details on whether it has placed restrictions or eliminated hazardous materials not covered by the current Rohs standard, such as PVC, brominated flame retardants, or phthalates, as many leading companies have done.â€

Philippe Wojazer / Reuters

In terms of its commitment to change its supply chain for the better, the company also scored terribly.

â€œAmazon has not made any commitment to eliminate hazardous chemicals from its products or the manufacturing process of its supply chain,â€ the report concludes.

Oddly despite its own lack of transparency, Amazon scored well in one single are and that was advocacy. The authors commended Amazonâ€™s recent support of policies in the US that would reduce greenhouse emissions and support the rollout of renewable energy.

Of the remaining tech giants, Apple enjoyed the second-highest score in the report with the authors praising Appleâ€™s commitment to renewable energy and to meaningful changes to its supply chain.

Justin Sullivan via Getty Images

While its flagship example will be its brand-new space-age headquarters Apple Park thatâ€™s 100% powered by renewable energy, the report also praises Apple for its commitment to using renewable energy overseas.

â€œApple has thus far been fairly aggressive in pursuing its 2020 goal to deploy 4GW of renewable energy in its supply chain,â€ states the report. â€œWith Apple itself having deployed nearly 500MW of solar and wind in China, and has made significant progress with its suppliers as well.â€

In April Apple also made a major commitment to closed-loop manufacturing which essentially means it will stop mining for new precious metals or toxic materials and instead only use recycled materials from its older handsets.

While the report praises this, it does also point out the limitations that Apple has placed on itself including the fact that newer products like the new MacBook are actually making it harder for Apple to repair them thus increasing wastage.

Other poor performers included Samsung who was singled out in particular because of the sheer size of its influence over the technology industry.

Jean Chung via Getty Images

â€œIn neither Samsungâ€™s product lines nor the operation of its factories did we find much evidence that reducing Samsungâ€™s environmental impact has been been made a priority by the companyâ€™s leadership.â€

â€œSamsung has not kept pace with the efforts of Apple to reduce its greenhouse gas footprint and transition its factories to renewable sources of energy, and has seen its emissions rapidly climb as a result.â€
TITLE: Amazon Performs Terribly In Greenpeace's Latest 'Greener Electronics' Report

The mum revealed on Imgur that she decided to lock herself in the bathroom this week, in order to enjoy a moment to eat some chocolates.
The mother-of-two explained that her children probably thought she was â€œtaking the worldâ€™s longest pooâ€ after she barricaded herself in the guest bathroom to enjoy a sweet treat.

TEXT:
A mum has shared her secret for getting some much-needed â€œalone timeâ€.

The mum revealed on Imgur that she decided to lock herself in the bathroom this week, in order to enjoy a moment to eat some chocolates.

Without any interruption.

The mother-of-two explained that her children probably thought she was â€œtaking the worldâ€™s longest pooâ€ after she barricaded herself in the guest bathroom to enjoy a sweet treat.

â€œI just didnâ€™t feel like having my one indulgence while my three- and one-year-olds asked me to share or cried while I ate it in front of them,â€ she explained.

â€œI thought maybe some parents on here might be able to relate and therefore enjoy this.â€

And many other parents rushed to share their â€œalone timeâ€ stories.

One said: â€œMy boys want everything I have. I go to the garage to work on stuff but Iâ€™m actually wolfing down cake.â€

Another added: â€œIâ€™ve got a mini fridge in my bedroom with a lock on it. Itâ€™s called the goddamit. I got sick and tired of buying stuff and them finding it.

â€œI used to sit on the floor of the kitchen behind the counter and eat skittles. Right after I told the kids there werenâ€™t any left.â€

Although not everyone has mastered the art of finding â€œalone timeâ€:

â€œIâ€™m more impressed you actually managed to be in the bathroom alone without a kid in there. I havenâ€™t peed by myself in about six years,â€ confessed one parent.
TITLE: Mum Reveals The Real Reason Why She Takes So Long In The Bathroom

SUMMARY:
Gabrielle Union talked about the â€œterrifyingâ€ act of raising young black men in America on â€œThe Viewâ€ on Tuesday.
The actress revealed the tough conversations sheâ€™s had to have while raising two of husband Dwyane Wadeâ€™s sons and his nephew.
â€œIt is absolutely terrifying,â€ Union said.
â€œIf they couldnâ€™t easily be identified as our children, they were just dangerous black boys.
Union stressed that having that conversation with young boys is difficult.
TEXT:
Gabrielle Union talked about the â€œterrifyingâ€ act of raising young black men in America on â€œThe Viewâ€ on Tuesday.

The actress revealed the tough conversations sheâ€™s had to have while raising two of husband Dwyane Wadeâ€™s sons and his nephew.

â€œIt is absolutely terrifying,â€ Union said. â€œIt is a constant, scary challenge.â€

Edward Berthelot via Getty Images

Union talked about the â€œpanicâ€ and â€œnumbnessâ€ she felt after finding out via Snapchat that her sons were participating in a game referred to as the â€œdrive-by dunk challenge,â€ where kids drive through the neighborhood and dunk in any basketball hoop they passed.

It seems innocent enough, but Union was worried about Floridaâ€™s open-carry and â€œstand your groundâ€ gun laws; the latter allows people to use deadly force without retreating if they fear for their safety.

So she communicated to the boys why that â€œgameâ€ wasnâ€™t really a game at all: â€œThe second I got home, I was like, â€˜They can kill you and get away with it, because now youâ€™re trespassing.â€™â€

.@itsgabrielleu talks raising young black men in America today, and shares why she calls it "absolutely terrifying": https://t.co/VA4LZWXMuF pic.twitter.com/qASB7yY8i6 â€” The View (@TheView) October 18, 2017

She added later that the boys â€œwanna be able to act the way their friends act, talking back to authority,â€ but that sheâ€™s had to stress that theyâ€™ll â€œdieâ€ if they do that because â€œitâ€™s different.â€

Union calls instances like that â€œblack truth bombs,â€ and then describes another â€œbombâ€ she dropped on her sons when they were living in Chicago last year.

â€œIf they couldnâ€™t easily be identified as our children, they were just dangerous black boys. And their very presence to a lot of our neighbors felt threatening. Thatâ€™s all you have to say to get away with killing black people,â€ Union said.

Union stressed that having that conversation with young boys is difficult.

â€œWhat do you say, you know? Your very blackness, from birth, has been demonized and weaponized and is considered inherently threatening and less than,â€ she said.
TITLE: Gabrielle Union Speaks Out On The 'Terrifying' Reality Of Raising Black Sons In America

SUMMARY:
Jon Snow has been the face of Channel 4 News since 1989.
Jon Snow joined ITN in 1976 and became Washington Correspondent in 1984.
Since then, he has travelled the world to cover the news â€“ from the fall of the Berlin Wall and the release of Nelson Mandela, to Barack Obama's inauguration and the earthquake in Haiti.
His many awards include the Richard Dimbleby Bafta award for Best Factual Contribution to Television (2005), and Royal Television Society awards for Journalist of the Year (2006) and Presenter of the Year (2009).
TEXT:

Jon Snow joined ITN in 1976 and became Washington Correspondent in 1984. Since then, he has travelled the world to cover the news â€“ from the fall of the Berlin Wall and the release of Nelson Mandela, to Barack Obama's inauguration and the earthquake in Haiti.

His many awards include the Richard Dimbleby Bafta award for Best Factual Contribution to Television (2005), and Royal Television Society awards for Journalist of the Year (2006) and Presenter of the Year (2009).

SUMMARY:
Londonâ€™s electric black cab has, we think itâ€™s fair to say, been a long time coming.
LEVCThe six vehicles and their drivers will be collecting data that records not only the emissions coming from the vehicle but also looks to asses the state of Londonâ€™s charging network.
Each car is driven by an electric motor which can then be charged via a 1.3 litre petrol-powered generator.
The car has a fully-electric range of around 70-miles but if you turn on the petrol generator that range increases to some 400-miles.
Compared to the previous petrol-powered black cabs, the new TX5 has a larger cabin that contains six seats, WiFi, USB-charging and the ability to process contactless payments.
TEXT:
Londonâ€™s electric black cab has, we think itâ€™s fair to say, been a long time coming.

Well today the company that makes the vehicles has confirmed that six of them are currently driving around the capital as they go through the final and perhaps most gruelling test environment: Londonâ€™s traffic.

LEVC

The six vehicles and their drivers will be collecting data that records not only the emissions coming from the vehicle but also looks to asses the state of Londonâ€™s charging network.

Each car is driven by an electric motor which can then be charged via a 1.3 litre petrol-powered generator.

The car has a fully-electric range of around 70-miles but if you turn on the petrol generator that range increases to some 400-miles.

LEVC

While itâ€™s certainly not going to compete with the range of say a Tesla, these vehicles have been designed to at the very least comply with the â€œzero emission capableâ€ requirement for all London taxis from January 2018.

Compared to the previous petrol-powered black cabs, the new TX5 has a larger cabin that contains six seats, WiFi, USB-charging and the ability to process contactless payments.

The driver meanwhile will have access to a full-touchscreen that provides them with a SatNav specifically designed to show congestion while also showing every available charging location in London.

In addition the screen will also feature integrated ride-hailing services including Gett, myTaxi and Kabbee.
TITLE: London's Electric Black Cab Is Being Tested On The Streets Of London

SUMMARY:
The AFL has denied a bid on Tuesday by transgender player Hannah Mouncey to play in the 2018 AFL Women's League (AFLW) season after she nominated herself for an upcoming draft.
"This decision solely relates to Ms Mouncey's nomination for the 2018 AFLW draft and participation in the 2018 AFLW competition.
Absolutely heart broken for Hannah Mouncey ğŸ’” there is no good reason she shouldn't be able to play AFLW.
Good luck to all the girls who nominated for the AFLW draft tomorrow, especially my mates from Canberra.
â€” Hannah Mouncey ğŸ¤¾â€â™€ï¸ (@hannahmouncey1) October 17, 2017The AFLW draft is this Wednesday October 18.
TEXT:
The AFL has denied a bid on Tuesday by transgender player Hannah Mouncey to play in the 2018 AFL Women's League (AFLW) season after she nominated herself for an upcoming draft.

The provisional decision comes after 27-year-old Mouncey, a former national men's handball player who underwent hormone treatment after the Rio Olympics, played recently in Canberra's Ainslie Tricolours in the local AFL Women's competition -- where she was deemed eligible to play.

Despite this, an AFL statement said that, while she has been left out of the list of potential draft picks for next year's season, she may still be eligible for future seasons.

AFL statement re Hannah Mouncey: "Hannah may nominate for future AFLW drafts and for registration in other Australian Football

competitions" October 17, 2017

In assessing Mouncey's bid, it appears the AFL was reluctant to be rushed into a concrete decision on the matter and said that league staff considered relevant information including "the available data on transgender strength, stamina, physique along with the specific nature of the AFLW competition".

"The [AFL] subcommittee's decision took into account the stage of maturity of the AFLW competition, its current player cohort and Ms Mouncey's individual circumstances," the statement said.

"This decision solely relates to Ms Mouncey's nomination for the 2018 AFLW draft and participation in the 2018 AFLW competition.

"Ms Mouncey may nominate for future AFLW drafts and for registration in other Australian Football competitions."

Absolutely heart broken for Hannah Mouncey ğŸ’” there is no good reason she shouldn't be able to play AFLW. Size disparities are common in AFL! â€” Another 37 yearsğŸ¯ğŸ‘» (@PollyMaeve) October 17, 2017

In regards to her physical ability to perform as a woman, Mouncey has previously passed tests used by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) to determine whether she can participate in women's sport.

In order to compete, an athlete must show that their testosterone level is under 10 nanomoles per litre. The AFL has adopted this guideline for their own competition.

Hannah Mouncey not allowed to play in AFLW in 2018. AFL says physical disparity is significant and would give unreasonable advantage â€” Lee Gaskin (@Lee_Gaskin1) October 17, 2017

Confused: AFL says YES to same sex marriage and NO to Hannah Mouncey. Isn't it all about inclusion... â€” Mark Robinson (@Robbo_heraldsun) October 17, 2017

With that said, AFL General Manager of inclusion and social policy Tanya Hosch said Mouncey had contributed to a learning process for the AFL when it comes to transgender player policy and reasserted the code's commitment "to equality and inclusion at all levels of the game".

"Hannah's passion for football is undeniable, and I want to thank her and her team for their constructive participation in the decision-making process," she said.

"We acknowledge Hannah's openness and co-operation. She has contributed to a process which will substantially inform the development of the AFL's transgender policy and procedure for future players at the elite level.

"The AFL has made very strong commitments to equality and inclusion at all levels of the game. We recognise that participating in sport has physical, psychological and social benefits and we are committed to making Australian football on every level welcoming to all in our community."

Good luck to all the girls who nominated for the AFLW draft tomorrow, especially my mates from Canberra. I can't wait to see you all at the highest level and to play with and against you back in Canberra next year! â€” Hannah Mouncey ğŸ¤¾â€â™€ï¸ (@hannahmouncey1) October 17, 2017

The AFLW draft is this Wednesday October 18.

It remains unclear as to what needs to change for Mouncey to be eligible for the draft in future AFLW seasons. HuffPost Australia has contacted the AFLW for clarification.
TITLE: AFL Denies Transgender Footy Player's Bid To Play In The 2018 AFLW League

Weitestgehend kampflos konnten Soldaten der irakischen Armee und der schiitischen Miliz al-Haschd asch-SchaÊ¿bÄ« in den vergangenen zwei Tagen wichtige Positionen der Kurden im Norden des Landes einnehmen.

Haider Al Abadi behauptet, Sigmar Gabriel habe ihn tatsÃ¤chlich angerufen und zu #Kirkuk gratuliert#KurdistanBlockade #savekurds â€” KurdistanUnderAttack (@KurdistanUnAtck) 17. Oktober 2017

Denn glaubt man der Darstellung Abadis, sicherte Gabriel der irakischen Regierung darin seine UnterstÃ¼tzung zu. Der SPD-Politiker habe demnach erklÃ¤rt, er spreche sich fÃ¼r die territoriale IntegritÃ¤t des Landes aus und lehne das UnabhÃ¤ngigkeitseferendum Kurdistans ab.

"Er bekÃ¤mpft aktiv europÃ¤ische-aufgeklÃ¤rte Werte und unterstÃ¼tzt so eine brutale Terrororganisation", schrieb Huch, der Gabriel eine "Schande fÃ¼r das AuÃŸenministerium" nannte, bei Facebook.

Bei Twitter entbrannte unter mehreren kurdischen Aktivisten eine Diskussion um den Inhalt des TelefongesprÃ¤chs.

Abadi bedankt sich bei unserem AuÃŸenminister Sigmar Gabriel fÃ¼r seine pro-Bagdad Haltung gegen das #KurdistanReferendum. https://t.co/InRO7svVjN â€” Ismail Zagros (@ZagrosIsmail) 17. Oktober 2017

Doch nicht nur die prokurdische Bewegung zeigte sich verwundert Ã¼ber die deutsche Haltung in der Krise.

Auch die ARD kritisierte, der Westen lasse die Kurden im Stich. In einem Kommentar fÃ¼r "Tagesschau.de" schrieb Carsten KÃ¼hntopp: "Wenn die Peschmerga nicht nach Kirkuk marschiert wÃ¤ren, hÃ¤tte der IS einige der grÃ¶ÃŸten Ã–lfelder des Landes in seine Gewalt gebracht." Die Einnahme Kirkuks durch die Zentralregierung sei "politisch und moralisch nicht okay".

Im AuswÃ¤rtigen Amt ist man anderer Auffassung

Im AuswÃ¤rtigen Amt scheint derweil Verwirrung um die ErklÃ¤rung des irakischen Premiers zu herrschen.

Denn die Darstellung Gabriels ist eine andere: Der AuÃŸenminister habe Abadi mitgeteilt, "niemand sollte meinen, es gebe eine militÃ¤rische LÃ¶sung fÃ¼r die innerirakischen Spannungen, die in den letzten Tagen zutage getreten sind", heiÃŸt es in einer Stellungnahme vom Dienstag.

Der SPD-Politiker habe demnach vor einer militÃ¤rischen Eskalation gewarnt und an die Verantwortung aller appelliert, "dass der Weg zurÃ¼ck zum Verhandlungstisch und zu einem konstruktiven Dialog erÃ¶ffnet wird, um die Differenzen friedlich zu lÃ¶sen." Die Diskrepanz zu den Ã„uÃŸerungen der irakischen Zentralregierung ist offenkundig.

Zu der Darstellung aus Bagdad wollte eine Sprecherin des AuswÃ¤rtigen Amtes auf Anfrage der HuffPost keinen Kommentar abgeben.

(ll)
TITLE: Ein Telefonat Sigmar Gabriels mit dem irakischen Premier sorgt fÃ¼r Wirbel

SUMMARY:
Mother of student Najeeb with JNU students, social activists, and student leaders under the banner of Student Islamic Organisation of India (SIO) stages a protest outside the HRD Ministry demanding justice for the missing JNU student Najeeb Ahmed, on February 22, 2017 in New Delhi.
ADVERTISEMENTThe Delhi High Court today said "there is complete lack of interest" on the CBI's part in probing the disappearance of JNU student Najeeb Ahmed.
The court had handed over the probe to the CBI five months ago.
A bench of Justices GS Sistani and Chander Shekhar observed that there was "no result either ways.
The court was hearing the plea of the missing student's mother, Fatima Nafees, seeking directions from the court to trace her son who disappeared from Jawaharlal Nehru University's (JNU) Mahi-Mandvi hostel on October 15 last year.
TEXT:
Mother of student Najeeb with JNU students, social activists, and student leaders under the banner of Student Islamic Organisation of India (SIO) stages a protest outside the HRD Ministry demanding justice for the missing JNU student Najeeb Ahmed, on February 22, 2017 in New Delhi.

ADVERTISEMENT

The Delhi High Court today said "there is complete lack of interest" on the CBI's part in probing the disappearance of JNU student Najeeb Ahmed.

The court had handed over the probe to the CBI five months ago.

A bench of Justices GS Sistani and Chander Shekhar observed that there was "no result either ways. No result even on paper".

The strong remarks by the bench came after contradictions appeared in what the CBI said in court and what it had indicated in its status report on the issue of analysis of the calls and messages of the suspect students in the case.

The court was hearing the plea of the missing student's mother, Fatima Nafees, seeking directions from the court to trace her son who disappeared from Jawaharlal Nehru University's (JNU) Mahi-Mandvi hostel on October 15 last year.
TITLE: Complete Lack Of Interest On CBI's Part In Probing Disappearance Of Najeeb Ahmed: Delhi HC

SUMMARY:
As a male winner of â€˜The X Factorâ€™, the pressure is on reigning champion Matt Terry right now.
They know us from â€˜X Factorâ€™ and there is that automatic pressure.
â€œWhen â€˜X Factorâ€™ comes on, thatâ€™s Britainâ€™s countdown to Christmas and when it starts to get colder.
â€œIâ€™m here thanks to them, so Iâ€™m always happy to be part of the â€˜X Factorâ€™ family,â€ he says.
'X Factor' Winners
TEXT:
As a male winner of â€˜The X Factorâ€™, the pressure is on reigning champion Matt Terry right now.

As he officially launches his post-talent show career, all eyes are currently on him to see if he can succeed where Steve Brookstein, Leon Jackson, Joe McElderry and Ben Haenow stumbled.

However, the 24-year-old admits he is not concerned about the so-called â€œcurseâ€ that has plagued the men who have won the competition before him.

RCA/Sony Matt Terry

Last week, he released his new R&B-tinged single, â€˜Sucker For Youâ€™, and he is hoping the fact he has done things â€œdifferentlyâ€ to some of his predecessors will see him right.

â€œI donâ€™t really believe in the curse,â€ he confidently tells HuffPost UK. â€œEverybody is individual and we all have our own path.

â€œI feel like thereâ€™s always pressure no matter what position you finish in, first, second, third or eighth. They know us from â€˜X Factorâ€™ and there is that automatic pressure.

â€œI just try not to think about it much and just do stuff without thinking. My path is my path and whatever is meant to happen will.â€

He continued: â€œI can only speak for myself, but this year, Iâ€™ve done everything differently,â€ he explains, pointing out he was the first ever â€˜X Factorâ€™ winner to release an original Christmas song as their winnerâ€™s single. Penned by Ed Sheeran, it reached number three in the charts last December.

â€œThen I signed to RCA instead of Syco,â€ he says of the move, which is rare for an â€˜X Factorâ€™ champion, who traditionally sign to Simon Cowellâ€™s record label.

â€œI obviously never got to work with Syco, so I donâ€™t know the difference, but RCA have been incredible,â€ Matt says. â€œThey trust me and I love all the team on board.â€

Syco/Thames/Dymond Matt won the 2016 series of 'The X Factor'

Matt then surprised fans with his fluent Spanish with a feature spot on Enrique Iglesiasâ€™s â€˜SÃºbeme La Radioâ€™, having learnt the language when he lived in Spain with his family as a child.

â€³That was super exciting because Iâ€™ve always wanted to branch out and do that,â€ he says, revealing there will be some Spanish tracks on his forthcoming album.

And although he is not signed to Syco, Matt claimed Simon has hailed that decision as â€œgeniusâ€.

â€œI caught up with him not long ago and he was just saying how proud he was of me, and saying it was genius what weâ€™re doing with the Spanish thing, and how different it was,â€ he says. â€œHeâ€™s very pleased with it and is very happy.

â€œAt the end of the day, I will always be one of Simonâ€™s artists because of the show. Iâ€™m here thanks to him, I suppose

â€œIâ€™m always invited to his Syco summer parties, charity events, and music-wise, he set a few meeting up for me in Miami.â€

Mattâ€™s former mentor on â€˜The X Factorâ€™, Nicole Scherzinger, has also given her seal of approval too, and it seems the pair still remain as close as they were on the show.

â€œWhen I send her stuff, she normally plays it really loud and dances to it and then sends me videos back,â€ he says. â€œShe loves â€˜Sucker For Youâ€™ and gave me a full review on Whatsapp.

â€œShe literally loves it, and is so proud of me, she couldnâ€™t believe I wrote some of the stuff.â€

Syco / Thames / Dymond Matt remains close with his mentor Nicole Scherzinger

Unlike many past â€˜X Factorâ€™ stars, Matt has been heavily involved in the writing process for the album, revealing heâ€™s penned almost all of the tracks himself - something which he admitted he didnâ€™t have much experience of before getting down to it.

Explaining it â€œcame super naturallyâ€ to him, he continues: â€œGoing into the studio, it was just something I had to do and I wrote almost the entire album. My label is really happy with me.

â€œMy A&R called me up the other day and told me how much heâ€™d enjoyed the process, and it was all down to my good songwriting and hard work.â€

While Matt is staying â€œsuper positiveâ€ about his music career, and hopes people will love his music, the show he found fame on is currently taking a battering.

Despite numerous tweaks and changes from boss Simon, the â€˜X Factorâ€™ ratings slump has worsened, recording its lowest figure in its 14-year history last month, when just 4.5 million people tuned in to one audition episode.

And while there seems to be a consensus itâ€™s time bosses pulled the plug, Matt is insistent there is still a place for it on our screens.

â€œI donâ€™t think the UK would be the same without it,â€ Matt says. â€œWhen â€˜X Factorâ€™ comes on, thatâ€™s Britainâ€™s countdown to Christmas and when it starts to get colder. Itâ€™s like a season.

â€œIf it were to take a break, I think everyone would notice it and it would be a shame. I still think itâ€™s got a future, and they should just keep spicing it up.â€

RCA/Sony Matt released 'Sucker For You' last week

So, what changes would Matt himself make to the show, having been through the process himself?

Thatâ€™s an easy question for him, as he answers without hesitation: â€œI would get rid of the Six Chair Challenge - it is horrendous.

â€œIt is the worst experience to go through. Then again, it is probably one of the most interesting parts for the public.

â€œI feel like they should bring back the dance round,â€ he laments. â€œWe actually had a dance round and they filmed it, but it didnâ€™t air.â€

Revealing he may be popping up later in the current series (most likely to be a performance of his new single during live shows), Matt adds he is happy to embrace the â€˜X Factorâ€™ tag while he attempts to break free from the show.

â€œIâ€™m here thanks to them, so Iâ€™m always happy to be part of the â€˜X Factorâ€™ family,â€ he says. â€œThey gave me that platform to step on to.â€

Mattâ€™s single, â€˜Sucker For Youâ€™, is out now.

'X Factor' Winners
TITLE: Matt Terry On Why Doing Things Differently Means He's Not Concerned About The Curse Of The Male 'X Factor' Winner

TEXT:
CINÃ‰MA - AprÃ¨s "Snow Therapy", prix du jury en 2014 dans la catÃ©gorie "Un certain regard", le rÃ©alisateur suÃ©dois Ruben Ã–stlund signe son retour avec "The Square", Palme d'Or du 70Ã¨me Festival de Canne cette annÃ©e. Le film nous plonge dans le milieu superficiel et bourgeois de l'art, mais pas seulement... Parmi les nombreuses histoires et messages qui s'entremÃªlent dans ce long-mÃ©trage, les mendiants, rÃ©fugiÃ©s et SDF ont une place centrale.

En salle le 18 octobre, "The Square" raconte l'histoire de Christian (l'acteur Claes Bang), un conservateur de musÃ©e d'art contemporain trÃ¨s rÃ©putÃ© et apprÃ©ciÃ©. GrÃ¢ce Ã  de nouveaux fonds, il prÃ©pare une exposition appelÃ©e "The Square", un carrÃ© de 4x4 mÃ¨tres installÃ© sur une grande place de Stockholm qui reprÃ©sente de maniÃ¨re mÃ©taphorique, un sanctuaire de l'humanitÃ© et de la bienveillance oÃ¹ chacun a les mÃªmes droits et devoirs.

Le film bascule lorsque Christian se fait voler son portable et son portefeuille par des pickpockets dans la rue, alors qu'il pensait aider une femme en dÃ©tresse. S'il est un directeur qui dÃ©nonce la bourgeoisie hypocrite, les pertes des "bonnes" valeurs de la sociÃ©tÃ© et le sort rÃ©servÃ© aux migrants, Christian veut alors se venger de ses dÃ©trousseurs et sombre peu Ã  peu dans l'Ã©goÃ¯sme, la mÃ©chancetÃ© et l'absurditÃ©. Elle est loin la trÃ¨s chÃ¨re bienveillance de son carrÃ© "The Square".

Dans ce long-mÃ©trage, on suit plusieurs intrigues: une histoire d'amour (avec Elisabeth Moss), la vie du musÃ©e, la prÃ©paration de l'exposition, la vie de famille du conservateur et sa vengeance... toutes ont en commun le rapport des Hommes et des classes sociales entre elles.

"J'ai voulu confronter mes personnages Ã  diffÃ©rents problÃ¨mes pour nous permettre de rÃ©flÃ©chir Ã  nos propres comportements, tout Ã§a avec une approche satirique", confiait Ruben Ã–stlund Ã  Arte, en mai dernier. Toutes ces histoires nous ramÃ¨nent aussi Ã  la place des mendiants dans notre sociÃ©tÃ©.

Les personnes qui souffrent de l'indiffÃ©rence et du rejet sont au cÅ“ur de l'Å“uvre d'art "The Square", comme du film. Ã€ travers le comportement de Christian, le rÃ©alisateur suÃ©dois nous dit qu'il est plus facile de s'intÃ©resser aux dÃ©munis sous forme d'art abstrait que de faire un simple geste dans leur direction.

Ces indigents reviennent d'ailleurs Ã  plusieurs reprises dans ce long-mÃ©trage de 2h20. Un homme fait la manche juste avant le vol d'un tÃ©lÃ©phone portable. Le conservateur retrouve aussi une SDF devant sa supÃ©rette habituelle. Ã€ un autre encore, le personnage principal refuse de donner de l'argent mais lui demande finalement d'attendre et surveiller ses filles, parties faire du shopping dans un centre commercial immense, Ã  sa place...

Alamode Film

C'est aussi une sans-abri qui est amenÃ©e Ã  jouer un rÃ´le central dans l'exposition "The Square". Elle est tout bonnement utilisÃ©e pour la "promo" et se retrouve au cÅ“ur d'une vidÃ©o choc et sanglante. Le message de ce spot publicitaire: "Quel degrÃ© d'inhumanitÃ© faudra-t-il atteindre pour toucher votre humanitÃ©?"

Ces mendiants parlent pour Ruben Ã–stlund. Ã€ travers eux, le rÃ©alisateur nous gÃªne et pointe du doigt les tares de notre sociÃ©tÃ©. Le rÃ©alisateur utilise aussi l'art contemporain et ses Å“uvres Ã©tranges pour souligner toute l'absurditÃ© de cette situation. De maniÃ¨re plus globale, il Ã©voque le manque de confiance qui existe entre les classes sociales et l'Ã©goÃ¯sme de notre Ã©poque.

"C'Ã©tait ma premiÃ¨re intention en faisant ce film", explique Ruben Ã–stlund dans une interview pendant le Festival de Cannes. "J'ai voulu travailler sur ce qu'en France, on appelle le 'vivre ensemble' et sur comment nous devons nous comporter entre nous. Je suis parti de ces questions trÃ¨s contemporaines et j'ai voulu les mettre en lumiÃ¨re".

Il va mÃªme plus loin en montrant une foule, lors d'une rÃ©ception du musÃ©e, qui ne bouge pas et ne vient pas en aide Ã  une femme en train de se faire violer lors d'une performance.

Ce n'est pas la premiÃ¨re fois que le rÃ©alisateur Ã©voque ces thÃ©matiques. Dans "Snow Therapy" dÃ©jÃ , ses personnages perdaient confiance en la sociÃ©tÃ©.

Entertainment Reporter, The Huffington Post UK

Katie Price's Honesty on Abortion Is Exactly What We Need on TV We live in a world where 'abortion' is a word that's still whispered, and Katie deserves nothing but praise for telling the nation what many of us wouldn't say to our own friends. Editorial Assistant, Entertainment

10 Reasons why Jeremy Kyle is good for your health Jezza tells it straight. I know the guests often have heart breaking stories, webs of lies or just a pure barrel of filth, but sometimes you need to hear it straight. It can help you reflect in your own personal problems and give yourself a good talking to. Writer- Moving Pictures- Notting Hill

The Commonwealth Games - The Joy of Whingeing The one event that was not shifted about like a wrestler's jock strap was the closing ceremony of the Commonwealth Games, featuring a collection of countries that Britain holds so little sway over that it seemed like a meeting of human rights refuseniks. LBC 97.3 talk show host, DJ and writer.

Cher joins returning cast members Meryl Streep, Amanda Seyfried, Colin Firth, Pierce Brosnan, Julie Waters and Christine Baranski.
A fan asked Cher if the rumours of her move to the musical were true, she replied in true Cher form.
Though to be fair, it was easy to just think they were the usual kinds of things Cher tweets out in the middle of the night.
FERNANDO ğŸ¤” â€” Cher (@cher) October 16, 2017
TEXT:
We heard some good news so we thought we'd Cher with you. Get it?

Well it looks like the 71-year-old Oscar winner is heading to the big screen again, this time joining the cast of the 'Mamma Mia' sequel, "Mamma Mia 2: Here We Go Again!'.

Cher joins returning cast members Meryl Streep, Amanda Seyfried, Colin Firth, Pierce Brosnan, Julie Waters and Christine Baranski.

While the plot of the film is being kept under wraps, Lily James has also joined the cast playing a younger version of Meryl Streep's character Donna, so we're guessing there'll be flashbacks ahoy in the ABBA-themed musical romp.

The news of Cher joining the cast was ceremoniously announced like all good things in Cher's life, via her immensely great Twitter feed. A fan asked Cher if the rumours of her move to the musical were true, she replied in true Cher form.

WELL...IM IN MOMMA MIA2 ğŸ‚ â€” Cher (@cher) October 16, 2017

The best thing about Cher's reveal was that she had been giving us hints on Twitter this whole time, it's just that because Cher is so well known for her unhinged and emoji-laden tweets, no one really caught on.

So... that explains why she's been quietly tweeting the lyrics of a certain ABBA song. Though to be fair, it was easy to just think they were the usual kinds of things Cher tweets out in the middle of the night.

FERNANDO ğŸ¤” â€” Cher (@cher) October 16, 2017
TITLE: Cher Has Been Cast In The Mamma Mia Sequel, Sends Iconic Tweet About It
