SUMMARY:
In 2009, at the age of 23, Thorburn begun competing in world competitions as part of Britainâ€™s Alpine Ski Team.
Just before the 2010 Winter Olympics, the British Alpine Ski Teamâ€™s governing body, Snowsport GB, went bust, leaving Thorburn without a coach and unable to compete.
With an urge to carry on racing, Thorburn decided to take a risk and changed to a freestyle ski sport discipline called ski cross to â€œsee if she was any goodâ€.
Ultimately I had to remember my love for the sport.â€PamThorburn/Ellis BrighamMy Training ğŸ’ªTalk us through your week in fitness.
I get on the hill ski training from 9am to 1pm and come back down for lunch.
TEXT:
Pam Thorburn was just three years old when she first hit the slopes.

The GB ski cross athlete, from Glasgow, developed a love of speed from an early age, fuelled by the desire to be a faster skier than her older brother.

She qualified for the British Childrenâ€™s ski team at just 10 years old and she started racing full time when she was 16. In 2009, at the age of 23, Thorburn begun competing in world competitions as part of Britainâ€™s Alpine Ski Team.

But it hasnâ€™t been an easy ride. Just before the 2010 Winter Olympics, the British Alpine Ski Teamâ€™s governing body, Snowsport GB, went bust, leaving Thorburn without a coach and unable to compete.

With an urge to carry on racing, Thorburn decided to take a risk and changed to a freestyle ski sport discipline called ski cross to â€œsee if she was any goodâ€.

Thankfully, she was.

Thorburn is now focused on reaching 2018 Winter Olympics in South Korea, so we caught up with her to find out what it takes to train like a ski cross athlete.

Pam Thorburn/Ellis Brigham

My Journey ğŸŒ

What do you credit for your success in your fitness journey?

â€œMy family are really sporty. My dad was a karate champion so growing up we were always doing something active. That really gave me the passion I have for sport today.â€

Whatâ€™s one of the most memorable moments in your career and why?

â€œWhen I was 12, I had my introduction to international competition. I was at a childrenâ€™s race in Slovenia as part of the British Team and I ended up on the podium. It was the first time I had competed against the rest of the world, and the first time I thought â€˜hey I can really do this!â€™â€

Was there ever a low point where you wanted to throw in the towel and how did you get past it?

â€œYes, after I qualified for the 2010 Olympic Games and I didnâ€™t go. I thought wow, I have sacrificed so much for as long as I can remember to get here, and Iâ€™m not going due to reasons outside of my control, that was a big hit to take. Ultimately I had to remember my love for the sport.â€

PamThorburn/Ellis Brigham

My Training ğŸ’ª

Talk us through your week in fitness.

â€œMy off-snow training and on-snow training differs drastically.

â€œOff-snow: Iâ€™m in the gym for two to three sessions a day, five days a week. I take one day of complete rest and one day for active recovery. During these sessions, I do everything from lifting, strength training, high intensity intervals, steady state biking, strong man training with sandbags and ropes, and a lot of core and stretching.

â€œOn-snow: I wake up early and do some warm up on the bike. I get on the hill ski training from 9am to 1pm and come back down for lunch. Get back in the gym in the afternoon or outside for some kind of activity like volleyball, or mountain climbing. I finish off with some recovery biking, core and stretching before dinner.â€

Whatâ€™s your favourite type of workout and why?

â€œLegs, legs and more legs! Anything with weighted squats or lunges Iâ€™d do everyday.â€

Whatâ€™s your favourite way to spend your rest day?

â€œIf Iâ€™m abroad, I love to go and explore new places. I think itâ€™s important when travelling - thereâ€™s so much to go and see, more than just the ski area.

â€œIf Iâ€™m at home, I love to go to the movies. Chilling out and turning my brain off for a couple of hours. Plus, who can resist that sweet and salty popcorn?â€

Pam Thorburn/Ellis Brigham

My Food ğŸ³

What do you eat throughout the week to complement your training schedule?

â€œI try to prep as many of my meals as possible. I have recently started using my slow cooker most days for that, it makes everything so easy. Iâ€™ve also started to eat less animal products so thatâ€™s been quite a transition, but Iâ€™m loving it.â€

What are your pre and post-workout snacks?

â€œI kind of stick to the same things when Iâ€™m working outâ€¦ basically the stuff I know works for me. I usually drink a BCAA (amino acids) drink before and a protein shake afterwards.

Whatâ€™s the biggest lesson youâ€™ve learned about food?

â€œTo care less about calories. I used to always think it was so important to count my calories, now I know itâ€™s all about the ingredients.â€

A post shared by Pam Thorburn- Ski X Athlete (@pamthorburn) on Nov 3, 2016 at 9:16am PDT

My Motivation ğŸ™Œ

Do you have a motivational mantra that keeps you going?

â€œYes, itâ€™s: â€˜If the plan doesnâ€™t work, change the planâ€¦ not the goalâ€™. After having 13 surgeries and so many injuries, I find it really important to remember what Iâ€™m working for. â€

Do you always have fitness or body goals you are aiming for?

â€œFor me, itâ€™s always about feeling. If I feel good, healthy, fit and strong, Iâ€™m happy. I donâ€™t worry too much about body fat or weight, that usually takes care of itself.â€

Whatâ€™s your ultimate workout track and why?

â€œItâ€™s â€˜The Last Fightâ€™ by Bullet For My Valentine. It fires me up every time. When that comes on, I know itâ€™s time to step up.â€

Pam is an Ellis Brigham ambassador. The mountain sportswear retailer is hosting Snowfest 2017, a week-long in-store celebration of all things ski and snowboard. It will kick off with a launch party at the flagship Covent Garden store on 24 October, from 5pm till 10pm. Entry is free for guests to enjoy music and Alpine inspired food. For more information and to register interest visithttps://www.ellis-brigham.com/ advice-inspiration/blogs/ events/snowfest-2017.
TITLE: Fit Fix: GB Ski Cross Athlete Pam Thorburn On The Off-Snow Training That Prepares Her For The Slopes

TEXT:
CSU-Politiker Stoiber hat bei "Hart aber fair" immer wieder Ã¼ber ein Thema gesprochen: die FlÃ¼chtlingspolitik

Plasberg versuchte mehrmals, auch mithilfe der GÃ¤ste, ihn zu unterbrechen

Die Aufregerszene seht ihr im Video oben

Der Wahlsonntag war ein Tag der starken Kandidaten: In Niedersachsen schaffte SPD-MinisterprÃ¤sident Stephan Weil eine Ã¼berraschende Aufholjagd, in Ã–sterreich triumphierte der erst 31-jÃ¤hrige Sebastian Kurz bei der Nationalratswahl.

â€œStarke Kandidaten, starke Wahlergebnisse - Warnruf fÃ¼r Angela Merkel?â€, fragte daher ARD-Moderator Frank Plasberg.

Eingeladen waren am Montagabend:

â–º CSU-Politiker und Ex-MinisterprÃ¤sident Edmund Stoiber

â–º Ex-SPD-Parteichef Matthias Platzeck

â–º TÃ¼bingens GrÃ¼nen-OberbÃ¼rgermeister Boris Palmer

â–º Die Ã¶sterreichische Journalistin Alexandra FÃ¶derl-Schmid

â–º Der deutsche Journalist Peter Zudeick

Vor allem einer der eingeladenen Politiker wollte in der Sendung offenbar unbedingt etwas loswerden: Edmund Stoiber. Immer wieder redete sich der frÃ¼here MinisterprÃ¤sident Bayerns in Rage - und konnte selbst von Moderator Plasberg nicht gestoppt werden.

Vorbild Ã–sterreich?

Eine der groÃŸen Fragen der Sendung war: Kann Ã–sterreich und der Erfolg des konservativen Sebastian Kurz als Vorbild fÃ¼r Deutschland dienen?

Stoiber glaubt daran. Er halte das Ende der GroÃŸen Koalition in Berlin fÃ¼r richtig, ebenso den Kompromiss der Schwesterparteien CDU und CSU im Streit um die FlÃ¼chtlingsobergrenze.

"Die Menschen wollen eine Begrenzung", sagte Stoiber.

UnterstÃ¼tzung erhielt Stoiber in der Sendung immer wieder von GrÃ¼nen-Politiker Boris Palmer. Der OberbÃ¼rgermeister TÃ¼bingens ist fÃ¼r seine markigen Aussagen und seine Warnungen vor einer Ãœberforderung bei der Integration bekannt. Auch bei "Hart aber fair" machte Palmer sein konservatives Profil deutlich.

"Ich gebe auch zu, dass ich mich in meiner schwÃ¤bischen Heimat unwohler fÃ¼hle", sagte Palmer. Etwas habe sich verÃ¤ndert mit dem Zuzug von FlÃ¼chtlingen - und das wolle er sagen kÃ¶nnen, ohne als Rassist beschimpft zu werden.

Palmer verteidigte auch Sebastian Kurz gegen den Vorwurf, wie die FPÃ– in Ã–sterreich rechtspopulistisch nach Stimmen gefischt zu haben. "Ich kann da nichts SkandalÃ¶ses erkennen", bekrÃ¤ftigte Palmer. â€œWenn Populismus schon ist, dass man sagt, was bei den Leuten vermutlich Zustimmung erzeugt, dann sind alle Politiker Populisten!â€

"Aber der Punkt ist, der Punkt ist..."

Stoiber stimmte zu. Die â€œungeordnete FlÃ¼chtlingssituationâ€ habe bei den Menschen Ã„ngste ausgelÃ¶st, â€œweil wir plÃ¶tzlich eine andere Kultur integrieren mÃ¼ssenâ€. Stoiber fÃ¼hrte noch weiter aus, was seit 2015 schon oft analysiert wurde.

Plasberg wollte ihn unterbrechen. â€œHerr Stoiber, ich glaube, Sie brauchen diese Problembeschreibung nicht machen.â€

â€œAber der Punkt istâ€, rief Stoiber Plasberg entgegen, â€œder Punkt ist die Begrenzung. Und Kurz ist derjenige, der fÃ¼r Ã–sterreich eine Obergrenze eingefÃ¼hrt hat.â€

â€œOkay, Herr Stoiber, wenn Sie das Wort Obergrenze haben wollenâ€¦â€, gestand Plasberg dem CSU-Politiker zu. Doch der war offenbar immer noch nicht fertig.

Kurz habe die Zuwanderung begrenzt - und deshalb gewonnen

Stoiber fÃ¼hrte seinen Punkt zu Ende: Kurz habe in Ã–sterreich das Problem der ungeordneten Zuwanderung gelÃ¶st und habe seine Partei daher vom dritten Platz in den Umfragen vor einigen Monaten auf den ersten Platz bei der Wahl am Sonntag gefÃ¼hrt.

Die Ã¶sterreichische Journalistin Alexandra FÃ¶derl-Schmid erklÃ¤rte fÃ¼r die Zuschauer noch einmal, dass in Ã–sterreich eine Obergrenze von 37.000 FlÃ¼chtlingen pro Jahr gelte - die Zahl sei aber ohnehin in den vergangenen Monaten nicht mehr erreicht worden.

Das sei vielleicht auch ein Modell fÃ¼r die Koalitionsverhandlungen in Deutschland: einen zu hohen Richtwert ansetzen, meinte FÃ¶derl-Schmid.

Die Journalistin betonte, dass aus dem Ergebnis der Wahl in Ã–sterreich nicht abzuleiten sei: Die Union mÃ¼sse weiter nach rechts rÃ¼cken. Denn immerhin hat auch die FPÃ– nicht Stimmen verloren, sondern kam am Sonntag auf ein Rekordergebnis - trotz des rechtskonservativen Kurses von Kurz.

Stoiber antwortete, in Bayern gebe es eine andere Situation. Ãœber Jahre hÃ¤tte die CSU auch die â€œkleinen Leuteâ€ in den demokratischen Prozess integrieren kÃ¶nnen. Die Ã–VP habe das dagegen in den vergangenen Jahren nicht geschafft, erst Kurz habe die Ã–VP wieder zu einer wirklichen Volkspartei gemacht.

Ist die CDU Schuld an der SchwÃ¤che der CSU?

Plasberg war mit der Antwort nicht zufrieden. Auch Journalistin FÃ¶derl-Schmid war dieser Meinung. Plasberg stellte sich schlieÃŸlich neben die Journalistin, beugte sich vor und schaute Stoiber direkt an: â€œSie haben jetzt die Leistung der CSU hervorgehoben, die Frage, die ich aber gestellt habeâ€¦â€

â€œIch hab Sie Ihnen doch beantwortetâ€, erwiderte Stoiber. FÃ¶derl-Schmidt hakte noch einmal nach: â€œWenn ich Sie richtig verstehe, sagen Sie, dass die CDU Schuld ist, dass die CSU in Bayern schwach abgeschnitten hat?â€

Stoiber antwortete nicht direkt, sprach wieder Ã¼ber die Begrenzung der Zuwanderung. Sollte aber heiÃŸen: Ja, die CDU ist Schuld, weil sie sich nicht auf die Obergrenze eingelassen hat.

"Die FlÃ¼chtlingsfrage erschlÃ¤gt einfach alles"

Einen weiteren erstaunlichen Satz sagte Stoiber noch in der Sendung: "Die FlÃ¼chtlingsfrage erschlÃ¤gt einfach alles."

Da hatte er Recht. Die Frage nach der Zuwanderung und der Obergrenze beherrschte die Sendung. "Das wurde uns aufgezwungen", sagte Plasberg mit einem Augenzwinkern, als sich der Ex-SPD-Chef Platzeck Ã¼ber die thematische EintÃ¶nigkeit beschwerte.

Stoiber erklÃ¤rte spÃ¤ter noch einmal: Die FlÃ¼chtlingsfrage mÃ¼sse aus dem Mittelpunkt der gesellschaftlichen Diskussion durch LÃ¶sungen gebracht werden, erst dann kÃ¶nne man Ã¼ber Digitalisierung, soziale Ungleichheit und so weiter reden.

Das erklÃ¤rte auch Stoibers Auftritt bei "Hart aber fair".

Theresa May was accused of breaking her post-Grenfell tragedy promises on fire safety funding today as a council has been left to foot an Â£8.4million bill to fit sprinklers in tower blocks.
@nottsfire say sprinklers â€œsave lives & reduce injuriesâ€ PM thinks she knows better & wonâ€™t commit a penny to my constituentsâ€™ safety #PMQs â€” Lilian Greenwood (@LilianGreenwood) October 18, 2017She said: â€œAfter Grenfell the Prime Minister promised we cannot and will not ask people to live in unsafe homes.
This is something that must happen.â€Nottingham City Councilâ€™s request for funds to install the safety features were denied by the Department for Communities and Local Government in September.
â€œIt would appear the work you want to carry out to buildings does not meet either of these categories and the fire safety measures you outline are additional rather than essential.
On that basis, any costs would have to be borne by your authority without any further financial assistance.â€
TEXT:
Theresa May was accused of breaking her post-Grenfell tragedy promises on fire safety funding today as a council has been left to foot an Â£8.4million bill to fit sprinklers in tower blocks.

In the aftermath of the inferno which left at least 80 people dead, the Prime Minister said the Government was â€œsupporting local authoritiesâ€ and is â€œmaking sure that the resources are there to make sure what is needed to keep people safe is being done.â€

During Prime Ministerâ€™s Questions in the Commons today, Nottingham South MP Lilian Greenwood asked why the Government â€œwonâ€™t provide a pennyâ€ to her local council to carry out work to tower blocks in the city.

.@nottsfire say sprinklers â€œsave lives & reduce injuriesâ€ PM thinks she knows better & wonâ€™t commit a penny to my constituentsâ€™ safety #PMQs â€” Lilian Greenwood (@LilianGreenwood) October 18, 2017

She said: â€œAfter Grenfell the Prime Minister promised we cannot and will not ask people to live in unsafe homes.

â€œHow safe would she feel living on the 20th floor of Pine View or South Church Court in my constituency with one staircase and no sprinklers?â€

Responding from the Despatch Box, May said: â€œItâ€™s not the case that sprinklers is the only issue that needs to be looked at or can be addressed or the only solution to ensuring the safety of those tower blocks.

â€œIt is up to the council to make decisions on what they wish to do but weâ€™ve been very clear that discussions have taken place with the DCLG and local authorities on this.â€

Greenwood shouted â€œyouâ€™re breaking your promisesâ€ to the Prime Minister as she spoke.

Installing sprinklers in high rise buildings was one of the recommendations to come out of the inquest into the deaths of six people in the Lakanal House fire in Southwark in 2009.

The importance of sprinklers were reiterated by the London Fire Brigade last month, when Commissioner Dany Cotton claimed retro-fitting the devices â€œcanâ€™t be optional; it canâ€™t be a â€˜nice to haveâ€™. This is something that must happen.â€

Nottingham City Councilâ€™s request for funds to install the safety features were denied by the Department for Communities and Local Government in September.

A letter from Housing Minister Alok Sharma to the council said: â€œThe government expects building owners to fund measures designed to make a building safe and to draw on existing resources to do so. We would consider the removal of financial restrictions in limited circumstances.

â€œIt would appear the work you want to carry out to buildings does not meet either of these categories and the fire safety measures you outline are additional rather than essential. On that basis, any costs would have to be borne by your authority without any further financial assistance.â€
TITLE: PMQS: Theresa May 'Breaking Her Promises' On Fire Safety After Grenfell

Sur ce marchÃ© aux codes parfois hermÃ©tiques, les nouveaux arrivants privilÃ©gient alors souvent l'art contemporain aux oeuvres plus anciennes: une question de goÃ»t, mais pas seulement.

En matiÃ¨re de baisse, 2008 est restÃ© comme une preuve de l'instabilitÃ© des prix, en particulier dans l'art contemporain, explique Antoinette Leonardi: "L'art contemporain a brusquement perdu 50% de sa valeur.
Mais il reste une donnÃ©e, un facteur indÃ©pendant de la prudence dont se prÃ©valent les banques en matiÃ¨re d'investissement dans le domaine artistique: une fiscalitÃ© avantageuse.
TEXT:
ART - L'art est une affaire de coeur, mais aussi d'investissement. Alors que s'ouvre ce jeudi 19 octobre la Foire Internationale d'Art Contemporain (jusqu'au 22), les amateurs d'art se frottent les mains, et les investisseurs aussi. Pendant le rendez-vous annuel, qui compte parmi les grandes vitrines de l'art contemporain, les sommes Ã©changÃ©es atteignent souvent des dizaines de milliers d'euros par oeuvre, faisant de ces crÃ©ations une valeur d'investissement.

Avec 72.000 visiteurs en 2016, la FIAC a connu une frÃ©quentation stable aprÃ¨s une annÃ©e 2015 record, un succÃ¨s qui s'est traduit du cÃ´tÃ© ventes. Une majoritÃ© des galeries Ã©taient ainsi "satisfaites" selon la directrice artistique de la foire Jennifer Flay, avec quelques achats records: un oeuvre du trÃ¨s cotÃ© Rudolf Stingel a trouvÃ© preneur pour plus de 2 millions d'euros, le Bumper de Rauschenberg s'est arrachÃ© pour un million, tout comme le fameux Iron Tree Trunk d'Ai Weiwei.

Des chiffres qui font tourner la tÃªte, si l'on oublie que ces oeuvres ne sont pas que des coups de coeur de collectionneurs passionnÃ©s, mais des investissements Ã  long terme, pour des clients qui cherchent Ã  diversifier leur patrimoine. C'est ainsi que des banques, connues ou non du grand public, proposent Ã  leurs clients aisÃ©s leur assistance pour investir dans l'art (voir la vidÃ©o en tÃªte d'article).

L'art contemporain, coqueluche des nouveaux investisseurs

" Il est vrai que le monde de l'art est complexe, mÃªme si c'est dans une certaine mesure le cas de tous les investissements ", explique Mathilde Courteault, responsable de Neuflize OBC Art. C'est pourquoi sa banque a ouvert, il y a une vingtaine d'annÃ©es, un dÃ©partement assurant un ensemble de services Ã  leur clients intÃ©ressÃ©s par ce secteur, allant du management de collection jusqu'Ã  la valorisation, c'est-Ã -dire l'estimation de patrimoine artistique.

Sur ce marchÃ© aux codes parfois hermÃ©tiques, les nouveaux arrivants privilÃ©gient alors souvent l'art contemporain aux oeuvres plus anciennes: une question de goÃ»t, mais pas seulement. C'est aussi une question de prix et de choix, comme le rappelle Antoinette Leonardi, Directrice du Conseil en Art Ã  BNP Paribas Wealth Management: "Il y a Ã©normÃ©ment d'offre dans l'art contemporain, alors que dans les autres spÃ©cialitÃ©s la tendance est plutÃ´t Ã  la rarÃ©faction."

RÃ©sultat, la popularitÃ© des foires d'art contemporain n'est pas seulement le fait de curieux, mais de plus en plus d'acheteurs. Selon le site de rÃ©fÃ©rence Artprice, si l'on comptait environ 500.000 collectionneurs il y a trente ans, ils sont aujourd'hui 70 millions. En quinze ans, le total des ventes annuelles en volume a Ã©tÃ© multipliÃ© par 1200%, passant de 93 millions Ã  1,2 milliard de dollars pour des oeuvres achetÃ©es en majoritÃ© Ã  moins de 5000 dollars.

Le risque d'un marchÃ© trÃ¨s volatile

L'emballement des ventes et des prix ne fait pas pour autant de l'art contemporain un bon placement, tempÃ¨rent les experts. "La rentabilitÃ© d'une oeuvre est trÃ¨s difficile Ã  prÃ©voir." n'hÃ©site pas Ã  dÃ©clarer Mathilde Courteault, pour qui s'engager dans ce domaine est "avant tout un choix de passion"... soumis aux retournements parfois brusques du marchÃ© (cette annÃ©e l'a encore prouvÃ©).

En matiÃ¨re de baisse, 2008 est restÃ© comme une preuve de l'instabilitÃ© des prix, en particulier dans l'art contemporain, explique Antoinette Leonardi: "L'art contemporain a brusquement perdu 50% de sa valeur. C'est un marchÃ© trÃ¨s volatile, alors que les impressionnistes, par exemple, sont beaucoup moins spÃ©culatifs et leur cote est plus stable." Par peur de ce terrain glissant, sa banque se refuse Ã  conseiller du contemporain qui ne soit pas "classique", c'est-Ã -dire dÃ©jÃ  bien installÃ© dans le paysage artistique, Ã  l'image de Soulages.

La peur de l'effet bulle ne semble pourtant pas rebutter la majoritÃ© des investisseurs: depuis 2005, les prix de l'art contemporain ont augmentÃ© de plus de 70%, de quoi attirer encore plus d'apprentis collectionneurs. Une ruÃ©e vers l'or qui inquiÃ¨te plus qu'elle ne rÃ©jouit chez BNP Wealth Management, oÃ¹ l'on dÃ©nonce une "frÃ©nÃ©sie" et oÃ¹ l'on rappelle qu'on a "vu des cotes monter et descendre de faÃ§on fulgurante".

Mais il reste une donnÃ©e, un facteur indÃ©pendant de la prudence dont se prÃ©valent les banques en matiÃ¨re d'investissement dans le domaine artistique: une fiscalitÃ© avantageuse. Les oeuvres d'art ne sont en effet pas comprises dans le calcul de l'ISF et bÃ©nÃ©ficient d'une taxation forfaitaire allÃ©gÃ©e de 5% en cas de plus-value. De quoi rapprocher le coeur et la raison.
TITLE: Ouverture de la FIAC 2017 : Investir dans l'art contemporain est-il plus risquÃ© que la Bourse?

Selon le journal Les Echos, ce bonus-malus vise Ã  pÃ©naliser les entreprises qui, par un recours excessif aux contrats courts, coÃ»tent cher Ã  l'assurance chÃ´mage.
Force OuvriÃ¨re est Ã©galement favorable Ã  ce dispositif qui "encouragera Ã  la vertu".
Pas opposÃ© au principe, Solidaires dÃ©nonce toutefois la schizophrÃ©nie d'un exÃ©cutif qui veut surtaxer la prÃ©caritÃ© tout en la facilitant.

TEXT:
POLITIQUE - Ce n'est pas tous les jours que l'on voit Laurent Berger esquisser l'ombre d'un sourire. InvitÃ© ce mercredi sur BFMTV et RMC, le secrÃ©taire gÃ©nÃ©ral de la CFDT a confirmÃ© que le gouvernement entendait bien proposer un systÃ¨me de bonus-malus pour inciter les entreprises Ã  avoir moins recours aux CDD. Une promesse de campagne d'Emmanuel Macron qui fait hurler le patronat.

"Oui je confirme et je confirme que c'est une bonne chose. Cela fait des annÃ©es que la CFDT dit qu'il faut taxer les CDD. En tout cas il faut responsabiliser les entreprises dans l'organisation des contrats courts", a indiquÃ© Laurent Berger.

Selon le journal Les Echos, ce bonus-malus vise Ã  pÃ©naliser les entreprises qui, par un recours excessif aux contrats courts, coÃ»tent cher Ã  l'assurance chÃ´mage. Il "prendrait la forme d'un taux de cotisation patronal variable", qui pourrait aller de 2% de cotisations patronales pour les sociÃ©tÃ©s les plus vertueuses Ã  un maximum hypothÃ©tique de 10 %, contre 4,05 % aujourd'hui.

Les syndicats plutÃ´t enthousiastes

"En gros lorsqu'on utilise beaucoup de CDD ou de contrats courts on paie plus cher parce que l'on crÃ©Ã© beaucoup d'externalitÃ©s c'est-Ã -dire que je fais beaucoup de chÃ´meurs indemnisÃ©s Ã  l'assurance-chÃ´mage et donc c'est normal que je paie plus", rÃ©sume Laurent Berger.

Force OuvriÃ¨re est Ã©galement favorable Ã  ce dispositif qui "encouragera Ã  la vertu". "Ce qui n'est pas normal, c'est qu'on a eu une inflation de contrats courts ces derniÃ¨res annÃ©es", avait mis en garde Jean-Claude Mailly en invitant le gouvernement Ã  mettre en place un systÃ¨me "incitatif". Mais la CGT conteste le principe mÃªme du bonus.

"Nous sommes pour le malus pour les entreprises qui utilisent trop de travailleurs prÃ©caires. Mais nous ne sommes pas pour le bonus. Les entreprises ont dÃ©jÃ  beaucoup d'aides de l'Etat, que ce soient des exonÃ©rations de cotisations ou des aides publiques", a prÃ©venu son numÃ©ro un Philippe Martinez.

Pas opposÃ© au principe, Solidaires dÃ©nonce toutefois la schizophrÃ©nie d'un exÃ©cutif qui veut surtaxer la prÃ©caritÃ© tout en la facilitant. "On ne peut pas dire 'on va taxer plus les CDD', aprÃ¨s avoir mis des ordonnances qui vont permettre un accroissement justement de ces contrats Ã  durÃ©e dÃ©terminÃ©e", a relevÃ© son porte-parole Eric Beynel.

Fronde patronale

Une chose est certaine: le Medef fera tout ce qu'il peut pour s'y opposer. "Tout systÃ¨me qui vise Ã  taxer des contrats courts, qui stigmatise certains types de contrats ou d'entreprises, est une absurditÃ© et serait totalement contreproductif", a prÃ©venu son numÃ©ro un Pierre Gattaz. Les CDD sont dÃ©jÃ  surtaxÃ©s depuis 2013, ce qui n'a pas permis d'enrayer l'inflation des emplois courts.

"Le recours Ã  des contrats trÃ¨s courts correspond parfois Ã  des mÃ©tiers ou des situations spÃ©cifiques", a-t-il soulignÃ© en prenant pour exemple l'organisation l'an dernier de l'Euro-2016 de football ou celle des Jeux Olympiques en 2024, des Ã©vÃ©nements qui nÃ©cessitent l'embauche de personnes en CDD ou en intÃ©rim.

Dans le secteur des services oÃ¹ le recours aux emplois courts est commandÃ© par des pÃ©riodes de suractivitÃ©, l'opposition est tout aussi virulente. Le Groupement des professions de services (GPS) a jugÃ© "inacceptable" le projet du gouvernement tandis que la principale organisation du secteur hÃ´telier l'Umih a appelÃ© Ã  montrer un "front uni" et Ã  s'organiser avec les autres branches concernÃ©es "par cette stigmatisation", Ã  savoir "les mÃ©tiers de l'Ã©vÃ©nement, les forains, l'agriculture, la sÃ©curitÃ©, le bÃ¢timent, la propretÃ©".

De quoi faire reculer le gouvernement au moment oÃ¹ celui-ci multiplie les gages de bonne volontÃ© Ã  l'Ã©gard des entreprises?

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Bonus-malus sur les CDD, la mesure applaudie par la CFDT et qui fait hurler le patronat

TEXT:
Contre la mÃ©connaissance du plaisir fÃ©minin, il photographie des femmes avant, pendant, et aprÃ¨s un orgasme

SEXUALITÃ‰ - "Le plus souvent, la sexualitÃ© fÃ©minine est recouverte d'un voile de honte et de secret", explique Fan Yang. Responsable au niveau mondial de la marque Smile Makers, qui vend des accessoires de plaisir fÃ©minin, elle a proposÃ© au photographe brÃ©silien Marcos Alberti de travailler sur un projet pour briser cette mÃ©connaissance.

IntitulÃ©e The O Project, cette sÃ©rie de photographies montre des femmes, dans toute leur diversitÃ©, avant, pendant et aprÃ¨s un orgasme. Des images qui viennent valoriser le plaisir fÃ©minin, encore trop ignorÃ©.

"AprÃ¨s le Wine Project rÃ©alisÃ© l'annÃ©e derniÃ¨re, mon travail a fait le tour du monde", raconte le photographe. Il avait alors pris en photo ses amis Ã  jeun, puis aprÃ¨s un premier, deuxiÃ¨me, troisiÃ¨me verre de vin. "[Smile Makers] m'a contactÃ© pour un projet qui montre le bien-Ãªtre sexuel", poursuit-il. "Je n'ai acceptÃ© de travailler avec cette marque seulement parce que je croyais en leur message."

"Notre partenariat avec Marcos nous a permis de crÃ©er cette sÃ©rie de photographies qui retourne le stigmate social de la sexualitÃ© des femmes, et encourage la normalisation du plaisir fÃ©minin", indique pour sa part Fan Yang. "Nous espÃ©rons que toutes celles qui verront ce projet se sentiront plus confiantes envers leur corps et leur sexualitÃ©."

Pour briser les clichÃ©s, Marcos Alberti accepte de documenter le plaisir des femmes sous un aspect lÃ©ger, amusant. "Quand on pense Ã  un orgasme fÃ©minin, la premiÃ¨re chose qui nous vient Ã  l'esprit est ce que nous voyons Ã  la tÃ©lÃ©vision ou sur internet", argumente le photographe. Il poursuit: "Cette fois c'est rÃ©el, avec de vraies femmes, de vraies situations".

"Toutes les femmes Ã©taient Ã©merveillÃ©es devant leurs photos"

Reste que se masturber devant un objectif n'est pas forcÃ©ment une partie de plaisir. Deux cents femmes ont rÃ©pondu Ã  l'annonce de la marque Smile Makers pour des sÃ©ances photos Ã  Singapour. Mais au fur et Ã  mesure que l'idÃ©e leur Ã©tait prÃ©sentÃ©e, la plupart se dÃ©sistaient. Un vingtaine d'entre elles ont finalement acceptÃ© de participer, sÃ©duites par le projet. Elles viennent aussi bien de France et des Ã‰tats-Unis que de Chine ou de Singapour mÃªme.

"Quand vous abordez le sujet de la sexualitÃ© Ã  travers la lentille de l'humour, les gens commencent Ã  s'ouvrir et Ã  partager leurs opinions plus librement", tÃ©moigne Marcos Alberti, "ce qui peut conduire Ã  des changements monumentaux dans les mentalitÃ©s".

Pour mettre en confiance les diffÃ©rentes femmes qui acceptent d'Ãªtre photographiÃ©es, il installe un rideau, avec seulement un trou pour l'objectif de son appareil, ainsi qu'un drap qui dissimule la partie infÃ©rieure de leur corps, pour prÃ©server au maximum leur intimitÃ©. "A ma plus grande surprise, elles ont toutes oubliÃ© ma prÃ©sence", s'Ã©tonne-t-il.

"Toutes les femmes qui ont posÃ© Ã©taient Ã©merveillÃ©es devant leurs photos", raconte Fan Yang, "surtout devant les derniÃ¨res, oÃ¹ elles sont resplendissantes". Une vidÃ©o, publiÃ©e sur Youtube, vient dÃ©voiler les coulisses de ces sÃ©ances photos particuliÃ¨res.

DÃ©couvrez ci-dessous les 22 images tirÃ©es de ce projet:

The O Project The O Project







1 of 22 partager cette image:

PENSACOLA, Fla. â€” A 325-pound (150-kilogram) Florida woman is charged with killing her nine-year-old cousin by sitting on the child as punishment.
During the punishment, Dericka told Posey and two other adult relatives, who are identified in the report as the girl's parents, that she couldn't breathe.
James Smith told investigators that Posey sat on the girl for about 10 minutes before she complained she couldn't breathe.
Child welfare investigatingMike Carroll, secretary of the Florida Department of Children and Families, issued a statement that called the child's death "appalling."

TEXT:
PENSACOLA, Fla. â€” A 325-pound (150-kilogram) Florida woman is charged with killing her nine-year-old cousin by sitting on the child as punishment.

Veronica Green Posey, 64, was arrested and charged with homicide and cruelty toward a child, The Pensacola News Journal reported. The Escambia County Sheriff's Office report identified Posey as the girl's cousin.

Paramedics and deputies responded to the family's Pensacola home following a 911 call Saturday. Posey told deputies she sat on Dericka Lindsay as discipline "for being out of control."

During the punishment, Dericka told Posey and two other adult relatives, who are identified in the report as the girl's parents, that she couldn't breathe. When Posey got up, Dericka wasn't breathing. Authorities said Posey called 911 and started CPR on the child.

The arrest report said Grace Joan Smith, 69, and James Edmund Smith are charged with child neglect.

Grace Smith called Posey, who is her niece, to her house to help with disciplining the girl, according to the report. She told investigators that Posey hit the girl with a ruler and metal pipe before the child ran to an armchair.

James Smith told investigators that Posey sat on the girl for about 10 minutes before she complained she couldn't breathe. She stayed on the chair for an additional two minutes before getting up, he said.

Child welfare investigating

Mike Carroll, secretary of the Florida Department of Children and Families, issued a statement that called the child's death "appalling." He said the agency will work with the sheriff's office to hold those responsible for her death accountable.

"As the family has a prior interaction with the child welfare system, a thorough quality assurance review will be conducted to review all prior interactions this family has had with the child welfare system," the statement said.

Posey was released Monday on US$125,000 bail. The Smiths remained in jail, with Grace Smith's bond set at $75,000 and James Smith's bond at $50,000. Escambia County jail records didn't list an attorney for Posey or the Smiths.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Girl Dies After 325-Pound Cousin Sits On Her As Punishment

SUMMARY:
â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Wie ich mich von der Hauptschule zum Master kÃ¤mpfteIn vielen Akademikerhaushalten ist der Studienabschluss eine wichtige Statusfrage.
â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Eine Grafik verrÃ¤t, wie ungerecht die deutsche Bildungspolitik ist - doch niemand darf sie sehenAm wichtigsten ist aber, dass ein mentaler Wandel in der Gesellschaft erfolgt: Ein Studium darf nicht lÃ¤nger pauschal als ein hÃ¶herwertiges Angebot als eine duale Ausbildung oder ein Meisterbrief wahrgenommen werden.
Bei vielen ist noch im Kopf, dass man mit einem Uni-Abschluss abgesichert ist - doch das trifft heute nicht mehr zu.
Und ich weiÃŸ: Ein Weg mit vielen Kurven und Abbiegungen schadet nicht.
Diskutiert mit und schickt uns eure Erlebnisse an Blog@huffingtonpost.de.
TEXT:
Grenzen gibt es fÃ¼r mich nicht. Ich bin zwar in Fulda geboren, doch einen Teil meiner Kindheit verbrachte ich in der Heimat meiner Eltern: Italien.

Ich komme aus einer Arbeiterfamilie, mein Vater war Arbeiter, meine Mutter Arbeiterin. Auch ich beschritt anfangs den klassischen Bildungspfad eines Arbeiter- und Einwandererkindes: ZunÃ¤chst Hauptschule, dann Berufsfachschule und mittlere Reife. SpÃ¤ter machte ich auch mein Abitur, studierte und promovierte.

Doch meinen Weg kÃ¶nnen nicht viele gehen - denn etliche sind in ihrer Entscheidung nicht frei. Das gilt sowohl fÃ¼r Migranten-, Arbeiter- als auch Akademikerkinder.

Schon frÃ¼h merkte ich: Eltern sind die AnwÃ¤lte ihrer Kinder. In meiner Kindheit wurde noch in der Grundschule entschieden, wer aufs Gymnasium gehen darf. Doch gerade die akademischen Eltern sprachen regelmÃ¤ÃŸig mit den Lehrern, um deren Entscheidung zu beeinflussen.

Meine Eltern wÃ¤ren nie auf den Gedanken gekommen, mit meinen Lehrern Ã¼ber deren Beurteilung zu sprechen.

Den Weg durch das deutsche Schulsystem musste und durfte ich alleine gehen.

FÃ¼r mich war die Hauptschulzeit eine schÃ¶ne Zeit. Ich wurde weitestgehend freigestellt und verbrachte viel Zeit beim Hausmeister. Mir machte die praktische Arbeit SpaÃŸ, in den Unterricht musste ich nur zu Klassenarbeiten.

Meine Eltern fanden meinen Wunsch zu studieren in Ordnung. Zur Finanzierung meines Studiums habe ich dann jahrelang nebenbei in einer Reifenfabrik gearbeitet. FÃ¼r mich war das die Grundsicherung - und vÃ¶llig normal, dass ich mich mit Arbeit finanziere.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Wie ich mich von der Hauptschule zum Master kÃ¤mpfte

In vielen Akademikerhaushalten ist der Studienabschluss eine wichtige Statusfrage. Umgekehrt ist fÃ¼r Menschen mit Migrationserfahrung und Arbeitereltern ein praktischer Beruf selbstverstÃ¤ndlich.

Ich habe lange an einer Hochschule gelehrt und dort gemerkt: Egal ob Migrant, Arbeiterkind oder Sohn beziehungsweise Tochter eines Anwalts - eine groÃŸe Zahl merkt, dass ein Studium fÃ¼r sie nicht perfekt ist, aber viele kÃ¶nnen nicht abbrechen.

Vor allem Akademikerkinder sehen sich gezwungen an der UniversitÃ¤t zu bleiben, weil die Eltern das von ihnen erwarten.

Arbeiterkinder sind in ihrer Wahl freier - und wÃ¤hlen bei Zweifeln eher eine duale oder praktische Ausbildung als eine akademische Laufbahn.

Klar ist aber auch: Es ist deutlich schwieriger den Weg an eine UniversitÃ¤t zu finden, wenn man aus einem Arbeiter- oder migrantischen Haushalt kommt

â–º Das grÃ¶ÃŸte Problem sind die finanziellen Rahmenbedingungen: Es kann nicht sein, dass man auf die Eltern angewiesen ist. In vielen Uni-StÃ¤dten haben sich die Mieten in den letzten Jahren verdoppelt. Zwar wurde das BAfÃ¶G angehoben, aber die staatliche UnterstÃ¼tzung hÃ¤lt nicht Schritt mit den rapide steigenden Lebenskosten.

â–º AuÃŸerdem mÃ¼ssen die StudiengÃ¤nge viel internationaler werden. Deutschland sucht hÃ¤nderingend nach FachkrÃ¤ften. Es muss selbstverstÃ¤ndlich sein, dass Vorlesungen und Seminare auf Englisch gehalten werden.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Eine Grafik verrÃ¤t, wie ungerecht die deutsche Bildungspolitik ist - doch niemand darf sie sehen

Am wichtigsten ist aber, dass ein mentaler Wandel in der Gesellschaft erfolgt: Ein Studium darf nicht lÃ¤nger pauschal als ein hÃ¶herwertiges Angebot als eine duale Ausbildung oder ein Meisterbrief wahrgenommen werden.

Alle jungen Menschen mÃ¼ssen frei entscheiden kÃ¶nnen, welchen Weg sie gehen - und unabhÃ¤ngig von den finanziellen MÃ¶glichkeiten ihrer Eltern.

Beruflicher und persÃ¶nlicher Erfolg geht auch ohne Studium. Bei vielen ist noch im Kopf, dass man mit einem Uni-Abschluss abgesichert ist - doch das trifft heute nicht mehr zu.

Jeder sollte selbst schauen, was seine Neigung ist. Jeder sollte offen fÃ¼r verschiedene Bildungswege sein.

Ich war das auch. Und ich weiÃŸ: Ein Weg mit vielen Kurven und Abbiegungen schadet nicht. Er formt.

Dieser Text wurde von Marco Fieber aufgezeichnet.

Oft schauen wir auf gesellschaftliche Entwicklungen nur aus einer abstrakten Perspektive: Experten sprechen Ã¼ber Probleme anhand von Studien. Politiker loben, was gut lÃ¤uft, anhand von grauen Statistiken - all das hat mit dem Alltag der Menschen, die von diesen Entwicklungen betroffen sind oder sie prÃ¤gen, oft wenig zu tun.

Diese Menschen kommen jetzt in der HuffPost zu Wort. Denn wie fÃ¼hlt sich Armut in einem reichen Land jenseits der Statistiken an? Wie sieht Deutschland aus der Perspektive eines Obdachlosen aus? Vor welchen Problemen steht ein gerade angekommener FlÃ¼chtling? Wer hat mit seiner Initiative ein gravierendes Problem gelÃ¶st? All das ist Thema in HuffPost-Voices.

Diskutiert mit und schickt uns eure Erlebnisse an Blog@huffingtonpost.de.
TITLE: Ein Studium darf nicht hÃ¶herwertiger als ein Meisterbrief wahrgenommen werden

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTFive men, including a disabled auto rickshaw driver, became the latest victims to a vicious attack by self-styled "gau rakshaks" (cow protectors) in Faridabad on Friday morning.
Azad, along with a 14-year-old boy Sonu, were reportedly stopped by six men at the outskirts of Delhi on suspicion of carrying beef.
They were carrying meat to a local shop, and reportedly told the men they were not carrying beef but would go to the police station with them if required.
However, these men allegedly beat the two of them even as a crowd of over 40 people watched.
Local Bharatiya Janata Party leader Tejpal Nagar got them the jobs with India's largest energy conglomerate NTPC Limited, according to the report.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Five men, including a disabled auto rickshaw driver, became the latest victims to a vicious attack by self-styled "gau rakshaks" (cow protectors) in Faridabad on Friday morning.

Azad, along with a 14-year-old boy Sonu, were reportedly stopped by six men at the outskirts of Delhi on suspicion of carrying beef. They were carrying meat to a local shop, and reportedly told the men they were not carrying beef but would go to the police station with them if required. However, these men allegedly beat the two of them even as a crowd of over 40 people watched. When Azad's family members rushed to the spot and tried to save him, they were allegedly beaten up as well.

"When I could no longer take the pain... I fell unconscious," he told NDTV. The attackers waited for him to regain consciousness and ordered him to chant "Jai Hanuman", he told the channel. They even threatened to feed him pork, which is against his religion, if he didn't comply.

According to the report, the police was registered a case against the victims for "cow smuggling" but withdrew it after it was determined to be buffalo meat.

Meanwhile, 15 men, who were accused of lynching Mohammad Akhlaq in Dadri two years ago on suspicions of eating beef, have been given government jobs, reported The Hindu. Local Bharatiya Janata Party leader Tejpal Nagar got them the jobs with India's largest energy conglomerate NTPC Limited, according to the report.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Differently Abled Auto Rickshaw Driver Beaten Up On Suspicions Of Carrying Beef, Even As Akhlaq's Murder Accused Land Govt Jobs

TEXT:
A mum has shared her secret for getting some much-needed â€œalone timeâ€.

The mum revealed on Imgur that she decided to lock herself in the bathroom this week, in order to enjoy a moment to eat some chocolates.

Without any interruption.

The mother-of-two explained that her children probably thought she was â€œtaking the worldâ€™s longest pooâ€ after she barricaded herself in the guest bathroom to enjoy a sweet treat.

â€œI just didnâ€™t feel like having my one indulgence while my three- and one-year-olds asked me to share or cried while I ate it in front of them,â€ she explained.

â€œI thought maybe some parents on here might be able to relate and therefore enjoy this.â€

And many other parents rushed to share their â€œalone timeâ€ stories.

One said: â€œMy boys want everything I have. I go to the garage to work on stuff but Iâ€™m actually wolfing down cake.â€

Another added: â€œIâ€™ve got a mini fridge in my bedroom with a lock on it. Itâ€™s called the goddamit. I got sick and tired of buying stuff and them finding it.

â€œI used to sit on the floor of the kitchen behind the counter and eat skittles. Right after I told the kids there werenâ€™t any left.â€

Although not everyone has mastered the art of finding â€œalone timeâ€:

â€œIâ€™m more impressed you actually managed to be in the bathroom alone without a kid in there. I havenâ€™t peed by myself in about six years,â€ confessed one parent.
TITLE: Mum Reveals The Real Reason Why She Takes So Long In The Bathroom

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTIn the days following the Harvey Weinstein scandal, thousands of women have joined the #MeToo social media campaign against sexual harassment, exposing the extent of the crisis.
Not only was the hashtag was tweeted nearly a million times in 48 hours, it triggered over 12 million #MeToo Facebook posts, comments and reactions in 24 hours.
Today, the Kolkata Police came out in support of the women who are speaking out against sexual harassment, sharing a powerful message on Facebook:We at Kolkata Police have been perturbed by the number of women who have shared #metoo.
We also feel it important to talk to boys about the need to stop sexual harassment, and for this, we have recently launched a project, Dear Boys, in schools.
We have visited ten schools of Kolkata, and the second part of Dear Boys will start mid-November.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

In the days following the Harvey Weinstein scandal, thousands of women have joined the #MeToo social media campaign against sexual harassment, exposing the extent of the crisis.

The global campaign took off on Sunday following a tweet by actress Alyssa Milano, which said, "Suggested by a friend: If all the women who have been sexually harassed or assaulted wrote 'Me too' as a status, we might give people a sense of the magnitude of the problem."

Not only was the hashtag was tweeted nearly a million times in 48 hours, it triggered over 12 million #MeToo Facebook posts, comments and reactions in 24 hours.

Today, the Kolkata Police came out in support of the women who are speaking out against sexual harassment, sharing a powerful message on Facebook:

We at Kolkata Police have been perturbed by the number of women who have shared #metoo. And we would also like to reiterate our pledge and commitment by saying that we hear every single one of you."

We urge you to be strong, we want you to be very, very angry about the leering, jeering, threats, verbal and physical abuses, we are asking you to be not afraid and to report to the police every time.

We also feel it important to talk to boys about the need to stop sexual harassment, and for this, we have recently launched a project, Dear Boys, in schools. We have visited ten schools of Kolkata, and the second part of Dear Boys will start mid-November.

Read the full post.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: Kolkata Police Leads The Way With Message Of Empathy For Women Tweeting About Sexual Harassment

SUMMARY:
WASHINGTON â€” The NAFTA countries haven't broken up.
NAFTA talks will be extended into 2018, and the next negotiating round is being pushed back three weeks in a tacit admission that negotiators aren't going to meet their original deadline for a deal by year-end.
Foreign Affairs Minister Chrystia Freeland talks to U.S. Trade Rep Robert Lighthizer and Mexican Secretary of Economy Ildefonso Guajardo Villarreal after a NAFTA press event in Washington, D.C., on Tuesday.
Mexico seeks 'win, win, win'Mexico's Economic Secretary Ildefonso Guajardo acknowledged the bargaining would be difficult.
He urged countries to pursue a "win, win, win'' â€” not a "lose, lose, lose.''
TEXT:
WASHINGTON â€” The NAFTA countries haven't broken up. But they are publicly bickering. They are delaying their next get-together date. And they appear to have agreed they won't be resolving their differences by the end of this year.

The tensions at the negotiating table have exploded into public view.

NAFTA talks will be extended into 2018, and the next negotiating round is being pushed back three weeks in a tacit admission that negotiators aren't going to meet their original deadline for a deal by year-end.

The latest round revealed enormous chasms in negotiating positions on everything from dairy, autos and Buy American rules to even the basic architecture of an agreement â€” and it was reflected in an awkward news conference Tuesday.

U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer said other countries are struggling to accept the reality that the U.S. wants to rebalance its trade agreements. He said other countries and industries must stop counting on easy export access to the U.S. market.

Foreign Affairs Minister Chrystia Freeland talks to U.S. Trade Rep Robert Lighthizer and Mexican Secretary of Economy Ildefonso Guajardo Villarreal after a NAFTA press event in Washington, D.C., on Tuesday.

"Frankly I am surprised and disappointed by the resistance to change from our negotiating partners,'' he said, with his Canadian and Mexican colleagues standing at his sides.

"We have seen no indication that our partners are willing to make any changes that will result in a rebalancing.''

He urged all sides to consider being more flexible before the talks resume again in Mexico next month. The next round starts Nov. 17, three weeks later than the original anticipated Oct. 27 start date.

Frankly I am surprised and disappointed by the resistance to change from our negotiating partners. Robert Lighthizer

Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister Chrystia Freeland sounded a marginally more diplomatic note. She said it's actually a positive development that the countries have agreed to extend talks through the first quarter of 2018, allowing more time for preparation between rounds and for reaching a deal.

Sources say the U.S. asked for the delay between rounds. They say the other countries gladly seized on that offer. One official said they interpreted it as a positive sign the Americans really want to work at negotiations, and want them to succeed.

The countries had initially set an end-of-year target for completing a deal. That was based on the notion that the process would stall in 2018, and drag into 2019, because the political systems of Mexico and the U.S. will soon be seized by national elections.

Freeland appears to blame U.S.

Still, Freeland appeared to blame the U.S. for a lack of progress.

"Vice-President Mike Pence (said this summer) that he believed a win-win-win outcome would be achieved in these negotiations. Canada believes that too,'' she said.

"But that cannot be achieved with a winner-take-all mindset or an approach that seeks to undermine NAFTA rather than modernize it. ... We've ... seen a series of unconventional proposals in critical areas of the negotiations that make our work much more challenging.

This is troubling. Chrystia Freeland

"We have seen proposals that would turn back the clock on 23 years of predictability, openness and collaboration under NAFTA. In some cases these proposals run counter to WTO rules. This is troubling.''

The ministers even disagreed on stage about the most basic economic theory. Freeland brushed off the importance of trade deficits, a Trump administration obsession which a number of economists â€” and Freeland herself â€” discount as a cause of trouble for the U.S. economy.

Lighthizer stared at her when he later spoke, and said: "For us, they do matter.''

The Trump administration insists reversing the long-term imbalance of imports-versus-exports matters to U.S. prosperity, and although NAFTA partners represent only a small share of that imbalance, and even though Canada arguably doesn't contribute to it at all, Lighthizer said it's a change they must accept.

Foreign Affairs Minister Chrystia Freeland, U.S. Trade Rep Robert Lighthizer and Mexican Secretary of Economy Ildefonso Guajardo Villarreal make statements to the media after a NAFTA event in Washington, D.C. on Tuesday.

The U.S. has surprised its neighbours by proposing things like a sunset clause that could end NAFTA in five years unless all three countries agree to extend it, and a near-total gutting of the agreement's enforcement mechanisms.

This has made it explicitly clear the U.S. does not envision the easy negotiation other countries had hoped for, and which some Americans themselves had hinted at. That includes President Donald Trump, who recently said he only wanted minor "tweaking'' to trade with Canada.

That happy-talk completely faded at this last week-long round in Washington.

Mexico seeks 'win, win, win'

Mexico's Economic Secretary Ildefonso Guajardo acknowledged the bargaining would be difficult. He said obstacles to progress remain and that all sides need to work towards constructive solutions.

He urged countries to pursue a "win, win, win'' â€” not a "lose, lose, lose.''

"We must understand that we all have limits,'' Guajardo said. "We must ensure the decisions we make today do not come back to haunt us tomorrow.''

Are the countries preparing a Plan B, possibly including the end of NAFTA?

Hope for the best. And prepare for the worst. Chrystia Freeland

Freeland says she's been preparing various scenarios since August 2016. While the business community is increasingly warning that the agreement may be in peril, she says she has been working on the possible outcomes for a while.

"It's not new,'' she told a news conference at the Canadian embassy, after her frosty public appearance with her peers.

"Hope for the best. And prepare for the worst.''
TITLE: NAFTA Tensions Erupt At Press Conference Announcing Talks Extended Until 2018

SUMMARY:
Channel 4 has been accused of â€œracial stereotypingâ€ and â€œpigeon-holingâ€ by a leading interfaith campaigner after it disguised a white woman as Muslim for a social experiment.
As part of the show, â€˜My Week As A Muslimâ€™, Katie Freeman was â€œtransformedâ€ into a British Pakistani Muslim, with make-up artists darkening her skin and giving her a new, wider nose with prosthetics.
In a trailer for the programme, set to air next week, Freeman is heard saying that when she saw Muslims she thought â€œtheyâ€™re going to blow something upâ€.
The Briton then went on to spend a week with a Muslim family in Manchester days after an Islamist extremist killed 22 people in a bombing at the cityâ€™s arena.
â€” billie (@billiejpreece) October 17, 2017just saw channel 4 have a show called my week as a muslim where this white woman has brownface and prosthetics so she can learn about racism etc.
TEXT:
Channel 4 has been accused of â€œracial stereotypingâ€ and â€œpigeon-holingâ€ by a leading interfaith campaigner after it disguised a white woman as Muslim for a social experiment.

As part of the show, â€˜My Week As A Muslimâ€™, Katie Freeman was â€œtransformedâ€ into a British Pakistani Muslim, with make-up artists darkening her skin and giving her a new, wider nose with prosthetics.

In a trailer for the programme, set to air next week, Freeman is heard saying that when she saw Muslims she thought â€œtheyâ€™re going to blow something upâ€.

The Briton then went on to spend a week with a Muslim family in Manchester days after an Islamist extremist killed 22 people in a bombing at the cityâ€™s arena.

While the show is yet to air, the trailer has already generated serious controversy, with critics calling it â€œthe most offensive show of the yearâ€.

Channel 4 Channel 4 'transformed' Katie Freeman into a British Pakistani woman with make up and prosthetics

Fiyaz Mughal, director and founder of interfaith and anti-extremist organisation Faith Matters, condemned the programme as â€œdeeply troublingâ€.

â€œAt the core of it, it reinforces difference,â€ he told HuffPost UK.

â€œWe all know weâ€™re different, that we donâ€™t all look the same.

â€œBut if youâ€™re trying to create a documentary about people changing opinion and feeling more connected, then why are you visibly doing something that reinforces difference?â€

During the show, Freeman was subjected to racial abuse after venturing out onto the city streets in her disguise, which included a head scarf.

Channel 4 Viewers have called the programme 'the most offensive show of the year' based on the trailer

Mughal, who also runs Tell Mama, a helpline for victims of Islamophobic violence, continued: â€œThey could have simply taken a secret camera and given it to a group of Muslim women and they would have captured a whole range of different things like that.

â€œOr they could take a woman like her and get her to spend a week with a Muslim family and see whether her opinion changed... you donâ€™t need to change your looks.â€

He added: â€œThey [Channel 4] need to ask which commissioning editor approved this.

Channel 4 Freeman spent a week with a Muslim family in the wake of the Manchester Arena bombing

â€œIf it hit my table, or the table of many other people from minority communities, I could tell you they would find it offensive to put someone in a prosthetic face, widen their nose and make them look a certain way.

â€œI think they have something to answer for.â€

Channel 4 viewers complained about the programme on Twitter after seeing a trailer for the show on Tuesday night:

Anyone else seen that ad for My Week as a Muslim where they LITERALLY BROWNFACE A WOMAN. MY GOD. â€” billie (@billiejpreece) October 17, 2017

just saw channel 4 have a show called my week as a muslim where this white woman has brownface and prosthetics so she can learn about racism etc. Because god forbid we just listen to muslims when they tell us what abuse they get â€” Alice Beggs ğŸŒ» (@AliceBeggs) October 18, 2017

Just wondering why â€˜my week as a Muslimâ€™ has been made when REAL MUSLIM WOMEN can just share their experiences and we can LISTEN TO THEM!?!? â€” Lottieâœ¨ (@ltties) October 17, 2017

â€œMy week as a Muslimâ€ looks like the most offensive tv show of this year â€” Junior Levi (@JuniorMortimer) October 17, 2017

The showâ€™s executive producer Fozia Khan defended the decision to dress Freeman up, suggesting it played an important part of the experiment.
TITLE: Channel 4 Show 'My Week As A Muslim' Sparks Racism Row After White Woman 'Transformed' Into A Muslim

Il aimait tous les petits coins cachÃ©s, les tempÃªtes et tous les aspects du Canada. Il voulait rendre ce pays meilleur. Il savait qu'autant nous Ã©tions un bon pays, il fallait Ãªtre meilleur. SUMMARY:
Hoy sÃ© que compartÃ­ esa batalla con muchas mÃ¡s personas de lo que imaginÃ© y de las que sabÃ­a, pues casi nadie lo hablaba.
Por lo que mundialmente persisten los esfuerzos por entender y atender la salud mental.
Uno de ellos tuvo lugar el pasado 10 de octubre con la celebraciÃ³n del 25 aniversario del DÃ­a Mundial de la Salud Mental (DMSM), iniciativa global de la FederaciÃ³n Mundial de la Salud Mental (WFMH, en sus siglas en inglÃ©s).
El principal objetivo es generar conciencia en todo el mundo y movilizar los esfuerzos en polÃ­tica pÃºblica que garanticen el acceso a su atenciÃ³n.
A su vez, la OMS define a la salud como "... un estado de completo de bienestar fÃ­sico, mental y social, y no solamente la ausencia de afecciones o enfermedades".
TEXT:
Mundialmente se estima que hay 320 millones de personas lidiando con un trastorno depresivo.

Suena el despertador y, como cada maÃ±ana, comienza mi lucha por salir de la cama. Quisiera dormir mÃ¡s. Siento que de nuevo me faltÃ³ sueÃ±o. Veo el reloj y cuento las horas que descansÃ©. Fueron mÃ¡s de 11, como el dÃ­a anterior, como las Ãºltimas semanas y los Ãºltimos meses. De todas formas, no tengo energÃ­a y tan solo saber que debo "echarle ganas" para alistarme e ir a estudiar y a trabajar, es tan desafiante como querer "subir el Everest".

Esta escena fue una parte de mi vida diaria durante algunos aÃ±os. Hoy sÃ© que compartÃ­ esa batalla con muchas mÃ¡s personas de lo que imaginÃ© y de las que sabÃ­a, pues casi nadie lo hablaba. Sin embargo, mundialmente se estima que hay 320 millones de personas lidiando con un trastorno depresivo. Tan solo en MÃ©xico somos 2 de cada 10 y 1 de cada 3 lo desarrollarÃ¡ antes de los 65 aÃ±os. Por lo que mundialmente persisten los esfuerzos por entender y atender la salud mental.

Uno de ellos tuvo lugar el pasado 10 de octubre con la celebraciÃ³n del 25 aniversario del DÃ­a Mundial de la Salud Mental (DMSM), iniciativa global de la FederaciÃ³n Mundial de la Salud Mental (WFMH, en sus siglas en inglÃ©s). El principal objetivo es generar conciencia en todo el mundo y movilizar los esfuerzos en polÃ­tica pÃºblica que garanticen el acceso a su atenciÃ³n.

El persistente y generalizado desconocimiento sobre las causas, consecuencias y costos de cualquiera de ellos daba lugar al estigma social que me provocÃ³ vergÃ¼enza para pedir ayuda.

Por otra parte, esta iniciativa es una invitaciÃ³n al involucramiento social para comprender su importancia dentro de la propia salud pues de acuerdo con la OrganizaciÃ³n Mundial de la Salud (OMS) la salud mental es "...un estado de bienestar en el cual el individuo es consciente de sus propias capacidades, puede afrontar las tensiones normales de la vida, puede trabajar de forma productiva y fructÃ­fera y es capaz de hacer una contribuciÃ³n a su comunidad". A su vez, la OMS define a la salud como "... un estado de completo de bienestar fÃ­sico, mental y social, y no solamente la ausencia de afecciones o enfermedades". En pocas palabras, "sin salud mental, no hay salud".

En este sentido, gozar de ella nos permite vivir con bienestar y sortear triunfalmente los desafÃ­os y aprovechar las oportunidades de la vida. Perderla por algÃºn trastorno mental (depresiÃ³n, ansiedad, autismo, etc.), neurolÃ³gico (epilepsia, migraÃ±as, Alzheimer, Parkinson, etc.), o de abuso de sustancias (alcohol, sustancias ilegales o no utilizadas para fines mÃ©dicos) implica mÃ¡s que vivir con el propio malestar fÃ­sico pues estas enfermedades comparten la constante de provocar -en mayor o en menor grado- un deterioro en el organismo que dificulta el funcionamiento de la persona en todos sus entornos.

En mi caso, "subir el Everest" fue muy rudo, pues me enfrentÃ© con que a pesar de que a mi alrededor todos tenÃ­an a alguien cercano con uno de estos padecimientos, el persistente y generalizado desconocimiento sobre las causas, consecuencias y costos de cualquiera de ellos daba lugar al estigma social que me provocÃ³ vergÃ¼enza para pedir ayuda, fomentÃ³ la discriminaciÃ³n desde los miembros de mi comunidad (casa, escuela, familia, trabajo, amigos, etc.) y dificultÃ³, en tiempo y forma, mi recuperaciÃ³n.

Por ello, hablar de mi experiencia en este marco temporal, me ofrece la oportunidad de capitalizar lo vivido a favor de otras personas que pudiesen identificarse. Este aÃ±o me uno a la iniciativa para recuperar el tema de "La Salud Mental en el Trabajo" y fomentar la participaciÃ³n colectiva que mejore las condiciones dentro de estos y otros espacios, a favor de quienes padecen una enfermedad mental y, por ende, de la toda la sociedad.

Finalmente, me parece importante destacar la importancia de aprender a reconocer las 5 seÃ±ales de sufrimiento emocional y hacer un llamado para que si notas en ti o en una persona cercana cambios en la personalidad, enojo o nerviosismo, aislamiento, falta de aseo o de cuidado personal y pÃ©rdida de esperanza, pidas ayuda o la ofrezcas . PodrÃ­as mejorar tu vida o la de un ser querido.

Por nuestra salud, hoy y todos los dÃ­as, #HablemosDeSaludMental

*Este contenido representa la opiniÃ³n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost MÃ©xico.
TITLE: Superar una enfermedad mental: tan retador como subir el Everest

SUMMARY:
No matter how hard you're trying to save, grocery shopping isn't really something you can give up altogether.
Luckily, it is actually possible to cut down on your grocery bill -- it just takes a little planning and a lot of self-discipline.
"Go to an Aldi or a bulk or discount supermarket to buy things like pasta, rice, tinned tomatoes and washing powder.
I mean I wouldn't suggest keeping it for months and months and months, but having a back up store of frozen food always comes in handy.
"I knew that was the price so when I walked into Aldi and saw them for 60 cents, I was like 'bonus!'
TEXT:
Know your prices so you can bag the best deals at farmer's markets.

No matter how hard you're trying to save, grocery shopping isn't really something you can give up altogether. A family's gotta eat, and depending on the size of the family, that can sometimes be a lot.

Couple that with the fact supermarkets are designed to make us buy more and you can see how easy it can be to blow your grocery budget, week after week, without even realising you're doing it. (And if you're reading this, guiltily thinking, 'but we needed those limited edition hand soaps!' we are definitely talking about you.)

Luckily, it is actually possible to cut down on your grocery bill -- it just takes a little planning and a lot of self-discipline.

Write a list

"I guess there's a number of things you can do, but the first and most important one is to make sure you always plan ahead and have a list," CEO and founder of JBS Financial Strategists, Jenny Brown, told HuffPost Australia.

"Go with a list and exactly what you want in your mind. Because one of the ways in which grocery shopping can blow out is when you see something not on your list, but you buy it anyway, and it ends up sitting in the fridge and going off or rotting.

"I think especially for those with a family, it's important to try to plan menus for the week and then shop to that."

Buy in bulk

Brown also suggests shopping in bulk for all non-perishable items at a discount chain.

"Go to an Aldi or a bulk or discount supermarket to buy things like pasta, rice, tinned tomatoes and washing powder. Actually, all the cleaning products," she said. "It's amazing. The savings are incredible. It's something I have been doing for the last 12 months and it really makes a difference.

"So my advice would be to buy all the stuff that doesn't go off, that you know you are going to use, and then you can supplement it with your fresh food and vegetables whether it be at your supermarket or butcher or local greengrocer."

Use your freezer

... and take note of specials.

"If you know as a family that you use minced meat a lot, then wait until it's on special and then buy it and freeze it," Brown advised.

"It will last for a couple of months. I mean I wouldn't suggest keeping it for months and months and months, but having a back up store of frozen food always comes in handy.

Got a lot of mouths to feed? Shop in bulk and save.

"Particularly for families where extra kids might come over at the last minute, you can pull that mince out of the freezer and make a big spag bol versus getting takeaway pizzas or what have you.

"I know personally, we've always got stuff [frozen] like chicken fillets. I'll buy them in bulk pack or when they are on sale and just make sure I rotate them.

"Also use it for your bread. When you buy a loaf, leave half of it out and put half in the freezer. It's all the one dollar savings that over a year make a huge difference and really add up."

Shop weekly

If you're in the habit of stopping off at the supermarket every day on your way home from work, you could be spending more than you mean to.

"Planning ahead really is key," Brown said. "If you do pop in on a regular basis like on your way home from work, you tend to buy stuff that you're not necessarily going to use and it becomes expensive.

"If you do that every day, you're blowing out your budget versus planning ahead and sticking to what was on your list."

Try your hand at growing your own herbs.

Grow your own

This may sound far-fetched to apartment dwellers but it is actually possible to cultivate your own produce, particularly if you have a balcony.

"If you're able to, having a veggie garden is a great way to save," Brown said. "It's very easy to grow things like carrots and lettuce. Lettuce is a great example because you rarely use the whole thing and then it goes off.

"The same goes for herbs. They add so much flavour to your meal, and often you don't use the whole sleeve of herbs you buy at a supermarket. If you have your own you can just pick off a couple of stalks."

Do your research

At the end of the day, you're only going to know what's a good a deal and what isn't if you are aware of what supermarkets typically charge for certain items.

"Know your prices. That's the key," Brown said. "When I first started shopping at Aldi I made sure I did a bit of research. So, for instance, I knew how much a tin of tomatoes was at the supermarket, and it ranges from 80 cents to $1.50 depending on the brand.

"I knew that was the price so when I walked into Aldi and saw them for 60 cents, I was like 'bonus!'

"The same thing applies to fresh fruit and veggies at the farmer's market. You can get great deals but you have to know the average prices of things to be sure."
TITLE: How To Cut Down The Price Of Your Grocery Shop

La actriz Kate Winslet dio a conocer cÃ³mo hace ocho aÃ±os se 'vengÃ³' de Harvey Weinstein, el productor cinematogrÃ¡fico envuelto en un escÃ¡ndalo de acoso y violaciÃ³n en Hollywood.

ADVERTISEMENTActivists alleged that PDS outlets in Jharkhand's Simdega district refused to give ration to a family, since their ration cards had gotten cancelled for not being linked to Aadhaar.
The family does not have Aadhaar cards.
The activists placed a request for a new card explaining the circumstances, but the card arrived two weeks after Santoshi's death.
The victim's mother said that since school was shut for Durga Puja holidays, Satoshi didn't have access to the mid-day meals she usually had.
Not just subsidised ration, the February 28 notification from the government also made it mandatory for children to have Aadhaar cards for access to mid-day meals in government schools.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Activists alleged that PDS outlets in Jharkhand's Simdega district refused to give ration to a family, since their ration cards had gotten cancelled for not being linked to Aadhaar. Eleven-year-old Santoshi Kumari allegedly died of starvation on 28 September, after going without food for eight days.

In an exclusive report, Scroll found out that in Simdega's Karimati village, the local dealer had been refusing to give ration to the Kumari's family, saying that their ration card wasn't linked to Aadhaar and hence was no longer valid. The family does not have Aadhaar cards. Non-profit organisations Right to Food Campaign and NREGA Watch discovered that the PDS outlet had taken off the name of Koyli Devi, the child's mother, along with those of 10 other families as their cards were not linked. Activists confirmed with Jaldega block office that Koyli Devi's card had indeed been cancelled. The activists placed a request for a new card explaining the circumstances, but the card arrived two weeks after Santoshi's death.

In February this year, the Centre made it mandatory to have Aadhaar numbers to access subsidised ration under the Public Distribution System (PDS). The victim's mother said that since school was shut for Durga Puja holidays, Satoshi didn't have access to the mid-day meals she usually had. The girl's father is not sound of mind and her mother and sister makes no more than Rs 80-90 a day cutting grass for others, reports Scroll.

Government officials, however, have argued that Santoshi died of malaria, not starvation.

Not just subsidised ration, the February 28 notification from the government also made it mandatory for children to have Aadhaar cards for access to mid-day meals in government schools. In August this year, Hindustan Times reported that only 42% children in the state have enrolled for Aadhaar. It also said that according to a notification from the Union ministry to Rajasthan government, the deadline for enrolling into Aadhaar was 31 August, 2017. Hindustan Times reported that 37 lakh students in 49,000 government schools in the state ran the risk of being denied mid-day meals if they did not get enrolled under the Aadhaar scheme within the stipulated deadline.
TITLE: Activists Allege That An 11-Year-Old Jharkhand Girl Starved To Death Because Her Family Didn't Have Aadhar-Linked Ration Cards

SUMMARY:
Like several other women, I have lost count of the number of times I have been scared.
â€“ While playing a 'game' called 'dark room' with my sisters and other children of varied ages, including a teenage son of the hosts at a Diwali party.
My parents refused to understand why I didn't want to play 'dark room' and preferred watching them play cards.
Because I spent all of yesterday seeing the # MeToo hashtag and telling myself: "sexual abuse at work is what they are talking about.
Any omissions or errors are the author's and HuffPost India does not assume any liability or responsibility for them.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

As women flooded Twitter with their heartbreaking stories of sexual violence with the hashtag # MeToo, it opened a chasm within me filled with memories I thought I had buried. It opened the floodgates of memories of being scared, often among my 'own' people.

Like several other women, I have lost count of the number of times I have been scared.

â€“ While playing a 'game' called 'dark room' with my sisters and other children of varied ages, including a teenage son of the hosts at a Diwali party. My parents refused to understand why I didn't want to play 'dark room' and preferred watching them play cards. My father asked me to join the other children and stop being a 'black sheep'. I was seven years old. These get-togethers continued and so did the discomfort, pain, shame and anger.

â€“ On a train journey with my family as a child of 11, a Malayali uncle offering to share his food at dinner and after we retired for bed and I fell asleep, putting his hand down from the berth above, opening my jeans and shoving his hands in. Bewildering. Painful.

â€“ Every time I took a train journey alone to home from engineering college and back every semester. Could never sleep a wink watching and waiting, sometimes for 36 hours. Was never 'disappointed'. Some man or the other always tried some stunt.

SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW Get top stories and blog posts emailed to me each day. Newsletters may offer personalized content or advertisements. Learn more Newsletter Please enter a valid email address Thank you for signing up! You should receive an email to confirm your subscription shortly. There was a problem processing your signup; please try again later Facebook

Twitter

Youtube

â€“ On my way to write the SPA entrance exam in Delhi in a public bus. When I objected, the man screaming back at me, "take a private car, if you don't like this", in Hindi of course. People around sneered and laughed.

Strange that we bury such incidents. Because I spent all of yesterday seeing the # MeToo hashtag and telling myself: "sexual abuse at work is what they are talking about. THAT hasn't happened to me. At least not in some very hideous way. (We learn to grade such incidents and be grateful you see)."

I wake up everyday thinking how differently a woman artiste is treated at home and overseas. Just when I start to feel happy that it's been a year of great concerts -- one better than the other -- playing in world class venues, great cities, working on my stagecraft, musicianship, sound, costumes and band, I am reminded of the treatment meted out to several women artistes at home in India. Be it big college campuses and premiere institutes or renowned music festivals and corporate-funded bus tours, it will be men who will take the centre-stage, headline the marquee and I will have to be okay knowing that I, the woman, worshipped as goddess in this land of ours, will not be worthy of much more.

The 'bulls' will occupy every big arena while, I, along with the other 'cows', supposedly revered by this land, will have to be okay playing second fiddle. The one odd amongst us will get to be a token presence at best to help make the men's club look 'politically correct' and 'fair'.

For us you need to have a special 'festivals' â€” 'women in music' and special 'women-only' panels -- where we get celebrated like an exotic species and are supposed to discuss our period pains and how it affects our performance abilities on stage etc.

How do I even begin to compete without been given the same platform and opportunities? (The average number of Bollywood songs in a solo female voice amongst 100 recorded? 16, if not lesser in some years ) Misogyny runs deep in our country and this cannot be said enough. Be it in the music and entertainment industry or any other.

If all the good people of the country are watching and not doing anything about this, please know that you are complicit â€“ just like the crowd which sniggered when a man on the bus decided to slip his hand inside my clothes. I was 17. Let's start by having a conversation. Here's the most important thing I want to share as the Festival of Lights approaches us, I am on the right side of history.

I will keep knocking on it everyday, every time and make the wall fall. I'm not getting tired anytime soon. Happy Deepawali.

The opinions expressed in this post are the personal views of the author. They do not necessarily reflect the views of HuffPost India. Any omissions or errors are the author's and HuffPost India does not assume any liability or responsibility for them.
TITLE: I Was Afraid Of Playing 'Dark Room' As A Child On Diwali. Yes, #MeToo.

Londonâ€™s electric black cab has, we think itâ€™s fair to say, been a long time coming.
LEVCThe six vehicles and their drivers will be collecting data that records not only the emissions coming from the vehicle but also looks to asses the state of Londonâ€™s charging network.
Each car is driven by an electric motor which can then be charged via a 1.3 litre petrol-powered generator.
The car has a fully-electric range of around 70-miles but if you turn on the petrol generator that range increases to some 400-miles.
Compared to the previous petrol-powered black cabs, the new TX5 has a larger cabin that contains six seats, WiFi, USB-charging and the ability to process contactless payments.
TEXT:
Londonâ€™s electric black cab has, we think itâ€™s fair to say, been a long time coming.

Well today the company that makes the vehicles has confirmed that six of them are currently driving around the capital as they go through the final and perhaps most gruelling test environment: Londonâ€™s traffic.

LEVC

The six vehicles and their drivers will be collecting data that records not only the emissions coming from the vehicle but also looks to asses the state of Londonâ€™s charging network.

Each car is driven by an electric motor which can then be charged via a 1.3 litre petrol-powered generator.

The car has a fully-electric range of around 70-miles but if you turn on the petrol generator that range increases to some 400-miles.

LEVC

While itâ€™s certainly not going to compete with the range of say a Tesla, these vehicles have been designed to at the very least comply with the â€œzero emission capableâ€ requirement for all London taxis from January 2018.

Compared to the previous petrol-powered black cabs, the new TX5 has a larger cabin that contains six seats, WiFi, USB-charging and the ability to process contactless payments.

The driver meanwhile will have access to a full-touchscreen that provides them with a SatNav specifically designed to show congestion while also showing every available charging location in London.

In addition the screen will also feature integrated ride-hailing services including Gett, myTaxi and Kabbee.
TITLE: London's Electric Black Cab Is Being Tested On The Streets Of London

Paradoxalement, l'engagement politique et une vie professionnelle bien remplie ne constituent qu'une part de l'homme de 60 ans que je suis devenu. Mes mandats d'Ã©lu local m'ont apportÃ© une autre conception de l'engagement public..

19 annÃ©es de mandat dÃ©partemental m'ont ainsi appris la nÃ©cessaire solidaritÃ© entre les territoires, la rÃ©alitÃ© rarement dÃ©crite et mÃªme souvent niÃ©e du lien social que les Ã©quipes municipales construisent chaque jour dans les moindres petits villages mais aussi la pertinence des regroupements pour faire ensemble ce que l'on ne peut faire seul. Ce mandat dÃ©partemental, j'ai eu, il est vrai, la chance de le mettre au service d'une construction politique particuliÃ¨re en Pays basque oÃ¹ les tensions nous ont obligÃ©s Ã  voir plus loin pour construire ce qui est le bien le plus prÃ©cieux de nos sociÃ©tÃ©s dÃ©mocratiques, le "vivre ensemble". La maturitÃ© politique apprise alors a aussi conduit le Pays Basque Ã  tourner le dos Ã  ses vieux dÃ©mons et cela n'a pas de prix.

Cette approche distanciÃ©e qu'autorise un mandat dÃ©partemental, j'ai eu la chance de le conjuguer avec la proximitÃ© d'un mandat municipal tournÃ© vers des rÃ©alisations concrÃ¨tes, durant deux mandats, avant de basculer en 2014 dans l'opposition municipale Ã  Biarritz.

Une Ã©quipe municipale qui se dÃ©lite

Au vu de tout ce qui prÃ©cÃ¨de, il me faut donc choisir. Ce choix est difficile, il me fait tanguer entre le cÅ“ur et la raison. Le cÅ“ur fait pencher pour Biarritz, ma ville pour laquelle j'ai une rÃ©elle passion. La raison me conduit pourtant Ã  choisir le dÃ©partement.

L'horizon local du SÃ©nateur est en effet celui du dÃ©partement. Ses Ã©lecteurs sont les Ã©lus du dÃ©partement. Les dossiers que le SÃ©nateur doit dÃ©fendre Ã  Paris sont ceux qui se conÃ§oivent Ã  l'Ã©chelle du dÃ©partement. Equilibre de l'habitat, politique de l'eau et des bassins versants, dÃ©veloppement Ã©conomique, agricole, touristique, couverture tÃ©lÃ©phonique, dÃ©ploiement d'un rÃ©seau Ã  trÃ¨s haut dÃ©bit, lutte contre la dÃ©sertification mÃ©dicale, prÃ©servation des services publics partout sur le territoire, mobilitÃ©s durables, dÃ©senclavement, transition Ã©nergÃ©tique, Ã©volution du trait de cÃ´te, vitalitÃ© de nos espaces de montagne, autant de sujets oÃ¹ le SÃ©nat doit porter la voix des territoires et oÃ¹ le mandat dÃ©partemental m'apporte une connaissance prÃ©cise des rÃ©alitÃ©s et des enjeux particuliers au Pays Basque et au BÃ©arn que ces questions sous-tendent.

Cette dÃ©cision ne me fait pas pour autant quitter Biarritz dont je reste un des deux conseillers dÃ©partementaux. Je continuerai Ã  donner mon point de vue sur les choix, je devrais plutÃ´t Ã©voquer les non choix de la municipalitÃ©. MalgrÃ© cela, je serai porteur au plus haut niveau des projets de dÃ©veloppement de notre ville. Bref, je la servirai mieux qu'en m'opposant Ã  une Ã©quipe municipale qui se dÃ©lite.

Biarritz a souvent optÃ© pour une gouvernance municipale ouverte mais efficace, associant des hommes et des femmes venus d'horizons diffÃ©rents mais en phase sur un projet de dÃ©veloppement partagÃ© et servi dans la cohÃ©rence.

Cette gouvernance, Ã  laquelle j'ai eu l'honneur d'apporter ma pierre de 2001 Ã  2014, m'a appris l'importance du contrat municipal.
